loans.name: Ana Jacoba

texts.es:
LA SRA. ANA JACOBA G. ES CASADA Y MADRE DE CUATRO HIJOS PERO NINGUNO DEPENDEN DE ELLA, TIENE SU NEGOCIO DE VENTA DE GASOSAS Y ENCHILADAS EN EL MERCADO ISRAEL LEWITE DE MANAGUA, ELLA TRABAJA CON UNA DE SUS HIJAS DE LUNES A SABADO DE 7 DE LA MAÑANA HASTA LAS 5 DE LA TARDE.
ELLA HA TRABAJADO TRECE PRESTAMOS CON CEPRODEL Y TODOS ESTOS HAN SIDO PARA COMPRA DE MERCADERIA PARA SU PEQUEÑO NEGOCIO. ELLA A CUDE NUEVAMENTE A CEPRODEL PARA SOLICITAR UN NUEVO PRESTAMO PARA COMPRA DE GASEOSA, JUGOS Y PRODUCTOS PARA LA ELABORACION DE LAS ENCHILADAS DE CARNES, DE MADURO Y DE PAPA YA QUE ESTOS SON LOS PRODUCTOS QUE ELLA VENDE MAS.
ELLA A GRADECE A CEPRODEL YA QUE CON ESTOS FIANANCIAMIENTOS LE HAN AYUDADDO DE GRAN MANERA YA QUE SU NEGOCIO ACTULMENTE SE HA MANTENIDO Y AHORA CUENTA CON MAS VARIEDAD DE PRODUCTOS PARA COMERCIALIZAR.
texts.en:
Sra. Ana Jacoba G. is married and the mother of four children, but none of them are dependent on her. She has a business selling sodas and enchiladas at the Israel Lewite Market in Managua. Ana works with one of her daughters Monday through Saturday from 7am until 5pm.

She has received thirteen loans from CEPRODEL and all of them were used to buy supplies for her small business. Ana has returned to CEPRODEL to request a new loan to buy sodas, juices, and ingredients for making meat, plantain, and potato enchiladas since these are the items that she sells the most.

Ana is grateful to CEPRODEL since the loans have been a great help. They have allowed her to maintain her business and now she is able to sell a wider variety of products.

loans.use: Purchase sodas, juices, and ingredients for making enchiladas

loans.name: Juan Feliberto

texts.es: Juan Feliberto tiene una pulpería, hace más de diez años siempre esta pensando en mejorar cada día su actividad. El es una persona muy dinámica y disfruta de obtener este medio de vida, la mayoría de sus clientes siempre le solicitan diferentes productos. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, granos básicos, detergentes entre otros. Sueña con    mejorar cada día más su negocio.
texts.en:
Juan Feliberto has a store that he has managed for more than ten years. Every day he thinks about improving his business. Juan is a dynamic person who enjoys this way of life. Most of his customers always request different products.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy candy, soft drinks, grain, detergents, and other items. His dream is to improve his business each day.

loans.use: Purchase candy, soft drinks, grain, detergents, and other items

loans.name: Walter

texts.es: Walter, de 27 años, es un padre de familia muy responsable, vive en su casa que es propia, en compañía de su esposa Raquel de 26 años y de su hijo Diego de 4 años. Este emprendedor hombre se dedica a la venta de desayunos (ofrecidas diariamente), paralelo a ellos también trabaja por turnos en un centro avícola. De esta manera administra sus horas libres, para dedicarse a vender alimentos preparados para el desayuno en donde su esposa es su principal ayuda, juntos ofrecen estos productos en las periferias del  paradero céntrico de la avenida principal de su distrito, y desde entonces le ha ido muy bien. Sus principales clientes son los chóferes que se estacionan cerca de su pequeño establecimiento temporal, asimismo la gente que transita por ahí. Hace dos años que ha empezado con este negocio y ahora tiene como meta comprarse una carreta, para cambiar por la mesa y sillas, que le resultan muy tedioso trasportarlos. Es su octavo crédito con MFP, y como socio antiguo está comprometida en pagar puntualmente sus cuotas. Además tiene planeado continuar apoyando en la directiva a su banco comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará su carreta para poder transportar sus desayunos y de ese modo evitarse los ajetreos del transporte.
texts.en:
Walter, age 27, is a very responsible father. He lives in his own home with his wife Raquel, age 26, and their four year old son Diego. This enterprising gentleman sells breakfasts on a daily basis. In addition, he works shifts at a poultry farm. This allows him the free time to prepare foods to sell for breakfast and his wife is his main assistant. Together they sell their products on the outskirts of the central bus stop located along the main avenue in the district. As a result, they have done very well. His customers are mostly drivers who park their vehicles near his small temporary stall, but he also sells to pedestrians and passersby. Walter started this business two years ago and now his goal is to purchase a food cart to replace his current setup of tables of chairs because they are difficult to transport.

This is his eighth loan with MFP. He is a longtime member who promises to submit his payments on time. Walter plans to continue adhering to the policies set forth by his Communal Bank. With the loan he requested, Walter will purchase his food cart so that he can transport breakfast foods and avoid the hassle of moving pieces of equipment.

loans.use: Purchase a food cart

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase children's clothing, towels, jeans, and jackets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy  wheels, shock absorbers, springs, jacks, a battery and alternator for their vehicle.

loans.name: Miryam

texts.es:
Doña Miryam A. es una señora de 55 años, casada, madre de doce hijos. Vive en la localidad de Nueva Virginia de Siquirres de Limón. Se ha dedicado siempre a su familia y ahora cuenta con el apoyo de un hijo para el servicio que brinda de sastrería.
Inició su negocio hace diez años. Ve en su comunidad la manera de aumentar sus ingresos, ya que es la unica satrería que hay. Por lo que solicita financiamiento a Fundación Mujer para cubrir la demanda de sus clientes.
Ella invertirá su préstamo en la compra de materia prima tales como telas, hilos, encajes, zipper entre otros.
Su sueño es tener un taller de costura bien acondionado y grande para asi ir superandose poco a poco y mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y de su familia.
Actualmente cuenta con el obstáculo de falta de capital de trabajo para la compra de materia prima. por ese motivo busca financiamiento en Fundación Mujer para hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en: Doña Miryam A. is a woman of 55 years of age, married and the mother of twelve children.  She lives in the locality of Nueva Virginia de Siquirres de Limón.  She has always been dedicated to her family and now she counts on the support of a son for the tailoring service that she offers.  She began her business ten years ago.  She sees in her community a way to grow her income, since hers is the only tailor shop that there is.  For this reason she requests financing from Fundación Mujer to cover the demands of her clients.  She will invest her loan in the purchase of commodities such as fabrics, threads, laces, and zippers, among others.  Her dream is to have a dressmaking workshop that is large and well equipped.  Toward this goal she continues growing little by little and improving the quality of life for her and her family.  At present she faces the obstacle of a lack of working capital for the purchase of commodities. For that reason she seeks financing from Fundación Mujer to grow her business.

loans.use: To buy materials such as fabrics, thread, laces and other such supplies.

loans.name: Yamileth De Los Angeles

texts.es:
LA SRA. YAMILETH M. G. ES MADRE SOLTERA DE DOS HIJOS Y ESTOS DEPENDEN ACTUALMENTE DE ELLA Y A LA VEZ SE ENCUNETRAN EN EDAD ESCOLAR, ES UNA PERSONA EMPRENDEDORA QUIENTIENE SU NEGOCIO DE VENTA DE JUGUETES, BOLSOS Y PRODUCTOS DE LIBRERIAS EN EL MERCADO ISRAEL LEWITE, ELLA TRABAJA DE LUNES A SABADO DE SIETE DE LA MAÑANA HASTA LAS SEIS DE LA TARDE CON UNA TRABAJADORA QUE SE ENCARGA DE  A TENDER A LOS CLIENTES.
ELLA HA TRABAJADO A CUATRO PRESTAMOS CON CEPRODEL Y ESTOS HAN SIDO PARA COMPRA DE MERCADERIA PARA SU NEGOCIO, EL CUAL HA VENIDO INCREMENTANDO EN SU MERCADERIA Y AHORA COMPITE CON LA COMPETENCIA.
ELLA A CUDE DE NUEVO A CEPRODEL PARA SOLICITAR UN NUEVO PRESTAMO PARA COMPRAR PRODUCTOS DE LIBRERIA YA QUE ESTA ES LA TEMPORADA DONDE MUEVE MAS ESTOS PRODUCTOS.
texts.en:
Señora Yamileth M. G. is a single mother of two children, who depend on her now since they are of school age.  She is an enterprising person who has a business selling toys, handbags and office products in the Israel Lewite market.  She works from Monday to Saturdays from seven in the morning to six in the evening with a worker that she supervises to tend to the clients.   

She has had four loans with Ceprodel, which have been to purchase merchandise for her business, increasing her inventory so that she now competes with competence.  She has come once more to Ceprodel to request a loan to buy office products, since now is the season when she sells more of these products.

loans.use: To buy products for her bookstore such as notebooks, pencils and backpacks

loans.name: Hector

texts.es: Héctor, de 19 años, es un joven muy responsable, es el mayor de 3 hermanos y vive en casa de su abuela. Este emprendedor joven se dedica al negocio de ropa, mochillas y juguetes; de acuerdo a la temporada cambia de mercaderías y de ese modo dinamiza su negocio. Su puesto se encuentra dentro de un mercado muy concurrido al cual alquila.  De esta manera Héctor poco a poco fue forjando su negocio,  y gracias a ello; ahora estudia por las mañanas en una academia, ya que su mayor anhelo es ingresar a la universidad y forjarse una carrera. Y para subsistirse de sus gastos, por las mañanas a contratado  una persona que le ayude en sus ventas; mientras el estudia. El negocio que realiza le gusta mucho, pero tampoco quiere quedarse sin tener una carrera. Es el noveno crédito con MFP, y sabe lo útil que le será este dinero para mejorar su negocio, por ello se compromete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas. De obtener el crédito que solicita, incrementará polos y short para la temporada de verano.
texts.en: Hector is 19 years old and he is a very responsible young man. He is the eldest of 3 children who live with their grandmother. This enterprising young man sells clothing, knapsacks and toys. In order to make his business more dynamic he varies the merchandise he sells depending on the season. He rents a stand and it is located in a well-traveled market. This is how Hector has been shaping his business and thank to this he is able to go to school in the mornings. His greatest goal is to go to university and to have a career. In provide for his expenses, in the mornings while he's at school, he has an employee who helps him with the sales.  He really enjoys his business but he doesn't want to be left without a career. This is his ninth loan through MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and he knows how helpful this support will be for his business. He will purchase polo shirts and shorts for the summer season.

loans.use: To purchase polo shirts and shorts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Marcia Del Socorro

texts.es: Marcia Del Socorro tiene su pulpería. Hace más de 2 años que  tiene este negocio. Esta no es la primera vez que solicita créditos pues ha sido una persona muy dinámica. La comercialización de granos básicos y productos de consumo del hogar son necesarios para el hogar, ella es una persona muy trabajadora y por el esfuerzo que realiza diariamente, es así que ha podido sacar adelante a su hijo para proporcionarle lo más necesario. El crédito es para la compra de carnes, golosinas, refrescos, pan, detergentes  y granos básicos.
texts.en: Marcia Del Socorro has a general store, which she’s had for more than 2 years.  This is not the first time she has requested a loan, as she is a very dynamic person.  Sales of basic need and consumer products are necessary for the home.  She is a very hard-working person who puts forth a great effort each day.  This is how she’s been able to help her son get ahead and provide for him.  The loan is for the purchase of meats, snacks, refreshments, bread, detergents, and grains.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Freddy

texts.es: Freddy tiene 38 años, su actividad económica es una abarrotería. Hace más de 7 años que tiene este negocio pues inicio como aprendiz, ya que no tenía mucha experiencia en este tipo de negocio. Con el paso de tiempo es que ha fue aprendiendo este negocio que para él lo vio como una fuente de ingreso para un futuro y fue así como decide ofrecer este servicio a quienes lo necesitan, el se siente muy afortunado por la oportunidad. Este crédito lo utilizara para la compra de arroz, frijoles, azúcar, concentrado entre otras. Sueña con terminar de construir su vivienda.
texts.en: Freddy is 38 years old, and his economic activity is a grocery store.  He’s had the business for more than 7 years, and started out as an apprentice as he didn’t have experience in this area.  Over time, he learned the business, which he saw as the source of an income and a future.  This is how he decided to offer this service that people need, and he feels very fortunate for the opportunity.  This loan will be used to buy rice, beans, sugar, and other items.  His dream is to finish building his house.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase soft drinks, Skimo and Parmalat beverages, and water.

loans.name: Concepcción

texts.es:
La señora concepción M. Pérez, vive en la localidad de  Llano Grande Municipio de Coapilla Estado de Chiapas México, es casada  con el señor Abelino García Vázquez,   Y tiene un hijo de de cinco años de nombre Eduardo Manuel quien es su razón de trabajar para salir  adelante.

       Solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra y venta de ropas para luego venderlo en la misma región, comenta  que se dedica a esta actividad  ya que le deja buenos ingresos  y con eso está saliendo adelante con esta actividad.

     Ella se oriento para trabajar de esta manera ya que tiene que tener una actividad de la cual le deje ingresos  y así poder seguir adelante y hoy gracias a dios le va bien.

     De la ganancia que va obteniendo lo invierte comprando más mercancía y nuevos modelos de ropas para que su clientela  le compra con más gusto y mejor se su ganancia.

     Su sueño es que con el tiempo logre tener una casa donde pueda vivir con su familia, como también apoyar a su hijo que esta creciendo en darle una buena educación y sea alguien en la vida.
texts.en:
Concepción M. Pérez lives in the locality of Llano Grande in the Coapilla municipality of the state of Chiapas, México.  She is married to Abelino García Vázquez.  They have one five-year old son, Eduardo Manuel, who is her reason for working to get ahead.

She requested this loan to invest in the purchase and sale of clothing, which she later markets in the same region.  She comments that she dedicates herself to this business because it generates a good income, and is an activity that allows her to get ahead.

She decided on this type of enterprise because she needed to earn money.  Today, thanks to God, things are going well for her.

She uses the income she obtains to invest in more merchandise.  She also wants to buy the newer styles of clothing, so that her customers will like what she offers more and therefore she can increase her profits.
 
Her dream is to, over time, manage to have a house to live in with her family.  She also wants to support her son who is growing, and give him a good education so he can become someone in life.

loans.use: The purchase of clothing, to later sell in the region.

loans.name: Gema Carolina

texts.es: Gema Carolina tiene 27 años, es una persona muy responsable y disfruta mucho de su actividad económica. Ella tiene 1 hijo de 18 años a su cargo, por lo que siempre está al pendiente de lo que sus clientes solicitan ella es una persona muy dinámica y disfruta de interactuar con ellos. Gema siempre lucha por mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Ella solicita este crédito para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, pantalones y ropa en general. Sueña con mejorar su establecimiento.
texts.en: Gema Carolina is 27 years old and a very responsible person who enjoys her business activity.  She has 1 son in her care, and is always alert to customer demand.  She is a very dynamic person who enjoys interacting with them.  Gema always fights to improve her standard of living.  She requests this loan for the purchase of pants, shirts, skirts and other general clothing items.  She dreams with improving her establishment.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Eliani

texts.es:
La señora Eliani Domínguez Pérez, vive en la localidad de llano Grande Municipio de Coapilla Estado de Chipas México, es casada, con el señor Ezequiel Pérez Domínguez, Y apenas  está esperando su primer bebe y está muy  ansiosa por ver lo nacer.
         
        Ella es la primara ves que también solicita el préstamo,  y es para invertirlo en compra de  mercancía para surtir su tienda de abarrotes,  que es la que la ayuda a tener ingresos e n su hogar y con la que espera Salir adelante.
         
        Para iniciar con esta actividad la animo su papa quien fue que le dijo que para poder iniciar un trabajo  es necesario  invertir para poder progresar y luego ver el resultado, lo cual se le está funcionando  pues le está dejando buen ingreso.
   

       De los ingresos  que le va dejando de  toda la semana compra mas mercancía para que su negocio valla incrementado día con día y mejor sea su ganancia. 
        
       Su deseo es que salga adelante con su pequeña familia  que aun está formando, como también a horrar para  lograr construir una casa y ahí vivir más cómoda.
texts.en:
Mrs. Eliani Domínguez Pérez lives in the community of  Llano Grande in the town of Coapilla, state of Chiapas, México. She is married to Mr.Ezequiel Pérez Domínguez and she is expecting her first baby and is looking forward to his birth. 
         
This is also the first time that she has asked for a loan. It is to invest in buying merchandise to supply her grocery store, which helps her have income in her home, and with which she hopes to get ahead.  
         
To start in this activity, she was encouraged by her father. He was the one who told her that to be able to start a job it's necessary to invest to be able to progress and later have results. This is working for her, as it is giving her a good income.         

With the income she makes every week, she buys more merchandise so that her business can grow every day and her earnings can improve.        
        
Her wish is to get ahead with her little family that is still being formes, as well as to save to be able to build a house and live more comfortably.

loans.use: To buy mechandise to supply her grocery store.

loans.name: Benita Emilia

texts.es: Benita Emilia tiene 35 años su actividad es la venta de cosméticos. Hace más de 5 años que tiene este medio de vida. Ella es una madre responsable y emprendedora tiene 1 hijo menor de edad a su cargo. Ella tiene una gran variedad de clientes pues siempre sale a vender sus diferentes productos a sus vecinos, amigos y familiares. Ella necesita este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima como lápiz labial, pintura de uñas, tratamientos, sombras entre otros pues hasta los momentos tiene bastante pedidos que le han solicitado.
texts.en: Benita Emilia is 35 years old and sells cosmetics. She has been making a living doing this for over 5 years. She is a responsible and entrepreneurial woman with a young son in her care. She has a  wide variety of customers and she sells her  various  products to her neighbors, friends and family. She needs the loan to buy products including lipstick, nail polish, beauty treatments and eyeshadow, because she has quite a few orders to fulfil.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Ma Belgica

texts.es:
La señora Bélgica Domínguez P., es casada con el señor Dionisio Pérez Vázquez,   con quien procreo cuatro hijos de los cuales dos ya están casado y dos están  a su responsabilidad  y son: Pilar de doce años y la más chica es Ana cristel de seis años.

       Ella  es la primera vez que  solicita un préstamo en fundación realidad ,  y es para comprar materiales y  surtir su pequeña papelería  ya que hay cosas que le hace falta  y su clientela la busca,  lleva con ella dos años y le va bien a pesar que le hace falta algunas cosas.

       Con el apoyo de su esposo se animo a poner  su propia  actividad ya que en donde ella vive  no hay papelería cerca y los alumnos tienen que ir hasta la otra comunidad para comprar y para apoyarlos  en no irse muy  retirado  del pueblo.
 
      En los ingresos que ella obtiene lo invierte en la misma papelería  ya que hay  útiles que sele terminan y su clientela lo busca  para utilizarla y ella no les diga que no hay.
 
      Desea que su papelería  se incremente día con día para que con ella logre ahorrar para  sacar adelante a sus dos hijas que vienen creciendo y tenga una buena educación.
texts.en:
Bélgica Domínguez P. is married to Dionisio Pérez Vázquez.  They have four children, two are already married and two are still in their care: 12 year-old Pilar and their youngest, 6 year-old Ana Cristel.

This is the first time that Bélgica has requested a loan from Fundación Realidad.  She is requesting the loan to buy materials with which to stock her small stationery store since there are items that her customers are looking for which she doesn't have.  Bélgica has owned her business for two years and it is doing well even though there are some things that she still lacks.

Bélgica decided to set up her own business, with her husband's support, because there isn't a nearby stationery store where she lives and pupils had to go to another village in order to buy their supplies.  She decided to support them so that they didn't have to travel far from their village.

Bélgica re-invests the profits that she makes back into her store since she often sells out of certain items and when her customers come to buy them she has to tell them that she doesn't have any.  She would like her stationery store to keep growing every day so that she can save up and get her two growing daughters ahead in life.  She would like them to receive a good education.

loans.use: To buy supplies to stock her stationery store

loans.name: Vitalina

texts.es: Vitaliana, de 72 años, vive en su casa que es propia, junto a su esposo Maximiliano de 74 años, vive en compañía de sus 2 hijos mayores de los 9 que tiene en total. Desde hace 20 años Vitaliana,  se dedica a la venta de gaseosa, agua mineral y cerveza fresca y helada, a un precio muy asequible. Desde entonces este negocio lo realiza en compañía de su esposo, mientras hace el mercado y las labores domésticas; solo así no pierde clientes. Le gusta mucho su negocio, por lo que atiende brindando un buen trato y a sus clientes, convirtiéndolo en el negocio más concurrido de su barrio, pese que este negocio lo desarrolla en el interior de su casa. Se siente muy contenta con su labor, y más aún cuando los fines de semana aumenta sus ventas. En adelante desea construir un local pequeño al costado de su casa, para vender variedad de productos. Es el 5to crédito con MFP, y como socia antigua se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente como hasta hoy. De obtener el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más gaseosa y cerveza al por mayor, para continuar realizando sus ventas.
texts.en:
Vitaliana is 72 years old and lives in her own home with her husband, 74 year-old Maximiliano, and their two eldest children.  She has nine children in total.

For the past 20 years, Vitaliana has been selling soda, mineral water and fresh and frozen beer at affordable prices.  She carries out her business together with her husband so that she can also do her shopping and household chores without losing customers.  Vitaliana enjoys her business a lot and  she always provides good customer service.  This has made hers the busiest business in the neighborhood, in spite of the fact that she carries out the business from her own home.

Vitaliana feels very happy in her work and she feels even happier on the weekends when her sales increase.  In the future, she would like to build a small premises next to her home so that she can sell a variety of products.

This is Vitaliana's 5th loan with MFP and, as a long-standing member, she pledges to keep making her repayments on time as she has up until now.  She will invest her loan money in buying more soda and beer wholesale, so that she can keep making her sales.

loans.use: To stock up with soda and beer

loans.name: Martina Esperanza

texts.es: Martina Esperanza tiene 62 años, su actividad es una pulpería. Hace más de 16 años que tiene este negocio, ella siempre se ha preocupado por mantener el negocio activo. Inicio con la ayuda de su Mama quien le enseño este negocio para que ella pudiera sacar adelante a su familia y logro hacerlo con mucho sacrificio y esmero. Con este préstamo que espera ella invertirá el dinero para aumentar el capital del negocio. Ella encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente.
texts.en:
Martina Esperanza is 62 years old and runs a small grocery store.  She has owned her business for more than 16 years and is always working to keep it running.  She started out with the help of her mom who taught her the business so that she could get her family ahead in life.  Through a great deal of sacrifice and care, she has succeeded in doing this.

Martina Esperanza will invest the loan that she hopes to receive in increasing her working capital.  She is grateful for the opportunity that she is being offered with this loan and she pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: San Nicolas Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama San Nicolás, se encuentra localizado en la comunidad de Tlalnepantla, en el estado de Morelos, México. está conformado por 5 integrantes mujeres que se conocen y son vecinas ellas son la señora Guadalupe Ávila M. va a comprar con su préstamo abono orgánico para fertilizar su producción de nopal, la señora Leticia L. C. va a comprar abono orgánico para fertilizar su nopal para que de mas producción, la señora Marquelia R. Díaz va a comprar perfumes de dama y caballero, cosméticos y compra de kid de cosméticos para surtir su negocio, la señora Herminia R. M. va a comprar frutas, chirimoya, níspero, aguacate para surtirse y vender su producto, la señora Guadalupe R. Ávila va a comprar penca de nopal y abono por bulto para iniciar su propia producción. La señora Guadalupe Ávila M. es la representante del grupo, ella tiene 56 años de edad, estudio hasta el 5º. Año de primaria. Ella es casada tiene 5 hijos 1 mujer y 4 hombres sus hijos son campesinos, su esposo se decida a la venta de leña se va al campo a traer leña para vender. la señora Guadalupe tiene su terreno donde siembra el nopal, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar abono  para su siembra de nopal y produzca mas nopales, ella inicio con el negocio hace 5 años, anteriormente sembraba maíz y frijol ya les repartieron a sus hijos terreno ellos también siembran nopal , ella aprendió este negocio desde pequeña su papa siempre se dedico a sembrar nopal y sus hermanos y ella trabajaban en el nopal deshierbándolo, des pencarlo, picarlo con ese nopal picado se tapa con tierra  para que sirva como abono, el nopal grueso se le quita, en la actualidad utilizan la renta de motocultor que va picando y quitando la hierba pero es cara la renta, el terreno donde siembra nopal lo compro, su papa le heredo la casa donde está viviendo, su  terreno está en el campo llega a su siembra de nopal caminando o en taxi la dejan a bordo de carretera y caminan para el terreno, su negocio es importante y especial porque en temporadas buenas si pagan bien el nopal, su parte favorita es trabajar en el nopal y se siente orgullosa cuando recibe buen dinero del nopal, sus clientes son  el que llegue primero a compra su nopal se ponen las camionetas y el que llega primero paga más se lleva el producto cada ocho días o quince día corta el nopal para vender y entrega el producto, los desafíos que enfrenta el negocio es que en tiempo de fríos no crece el nopal, su negocio es muy conocido por que el nopal se come del diario para acompañar a la comida y también es curativo, su negocio enfrenta la competencia de varias personas productoras de nopal pero cada quien es libre de vender su producto donde mejor le convenga, las ganancias del negocio las va volteando, se van invirtiendo en la siembra compra el abono para su nopal y para la comida. Le ayudan en el negocio su hija corta el nopal y su esposo cortan el nopal y saca las cajas de nopal. Tlalnepantla es un pueblo muy bonito porque aquí vivo el paisaje se ve verde se ven las siembras de nopal, se ve el volcán y el cL. es frio y templado. Su negocio ha ayudado a su familia económicamente cuando no tiene dinero van a cortar nopal para vender y ya tiene para los gastos para la comida o alga que falte en la casa. Ella quiere componer su vivienda ponerle loseta y pintarla para que se vea bonita, sus planes y sueños son tener una vida mejor tener dinero para hacer unas cosa más, hacer otro cuarto mas para los hijos de su hija porque es mama soltera y tiene dos hijos, las mejoras que desea para el futuro de sus hijos son dejarlos bien que tengan donde vivir y estén tranquilos, ella está muy contenta con este préstamo por que le va a ayudar mucho a su cosecha de nopal para que produzca mas y espera pagarlo bien para que le vuelvan a prestar. Las integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “Gracias por los préstamo que nos dan ya que nos ayuda mucho a realizar lo que uno piensa y crecer los negocios y las familias.”
texts.en:
This communal bank is called San Nicolás and it is located in the village of Tlalnepantla, in the State of Morelos, Mexico.  It has five female members who all know each other and are neighbors.  The members are as follows: Guadalupe Ávila M., who will use her loan to buy organic fertilizer to fertilize her 'nopal' (prickly pear) crop; Leticia L. C., who will buy organic fertilizer to fertilize her prickly pear crop and improve her production; Marquelia R. Díaz, who will buy men's and women's perfume, cosmetics and cosmetic kits in order to stock her business; Herminia R. M., who will buy fruit such as custard apples, loquats and avocados, to stock her business, and Guadalupe R. Ávila, who will buy prickly pear stalks and fertilizer in bulk, in order to start her own production.

Guadalupe Ávila M. is the group's representative.  She is 56 years old and studied up to the fifth year of elementary school.  She is married and has five children: 1 daughter and 4 sons.  Her sons are agricultural workers.  Guadalupe's husband sells firewood.  He goes out to the countryside and gathers firewood to sell.  Guadalupe herself has a plot of land where she grows prickly pears.  She has requested this loan to buy manure for her prickly pear crop so that she can produce more.  She started this business 5 years ago.  Previously, she used to grow corn and beans.  She provided her children with some land and they also grow prickly pear cacti.

Guadalupe learned her business as a young child.  Her father always used to grow prickly pear cacti and she and her siblings worked with him, weeding, removing the stalks and chopping.  They would cover the chopped prickly pear with soil so that it served as fertilizer and they would remove the fleshy pads.  These days, they hire a rototiller that chops the plants and removes weeds but it is expensive to hire.

Guadalupe bought the plot of land where she grows her prickly pear crop and her dad left her the house where she is currently living.  Her plot of land is in the countryside.  She either walks there or takes a taxi which leaves her on the edge of the road and she then walks to her plot of land.  Her business is important and special to her because in good seasons, if they pay her well for her produce, she enjoys working on her crop.  She feels proud when she receives good money for it.  Guadalupe's customers are those who arrive first in their trucks to buy her produce.  Those who arrive first and pay the most take the produce.  She cuts her prickly pear to sell every week or two weeks.

The challenge that Guadalupe faces in her business is that during periods of cold weather, the cacti do not grow.  Her business is very well known because people eat prickly pear every day with their meals and it also has healing effects.  Guadalupe faces competition from other people who produce prickly pear but everyone is free to sell their product wherever they most like.  Guadalupe re-invests some of the profits that she makes back into her business, investing in buying fertilizer for her next sowing season and she also buys food.  Her children help her in the business.  Her daughter and husband cut the cacti and her husband also carries the boxes of produce.

Tlalnepantla is a very pretty village.  The countryside is very green and covered with prickly pear cacti.  You can also see the nearby volcano.  The climate is cold and temperate.  Guadalupe's business has helped her family financially.  When they don't have any money they go and cut some prickly pear to sell and then have enough to cover their food expenses or anything else they might need at home.  Guadalupe would like to repair her home, laying floor tiles and painting it so that it looks nicer.  Her plans and dreams are to enjoy a better life and to have money so that she can do more things.  She would like to have another bedroom for her daughter's children as her daughter is a single mother and has two children.  The improvements that Guadalupe would like to make for her children's future is to ensure that they have somewhere to live and for them to be content.  She is very happy to be receiving this loan because it will help her a lot with her harvest.  It will help her to produce more and she hopes to pay it back properly so that she can access more loans in the future.

The members of this group would like to say to Kiva and Fundación Realidad "We thank you for the loan that you are giving us because it will help us a lot.  It will help our businesses and families to grow".

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her prickly pear crop

loans.name: G.s. Pablo Ii Group

texts.es: EL grupo solidario Pablo II está conformado por Gregoria y Petrona. Juntas tienen mucho tiempo de trabajar para sacar adelante su negocio, son personas muy humildes y responsables que disfrutan de su medio de vida. Gregoria se dedica a la venta y elaboración de repostería pues la mayoría de sus clientes llegan a solicitarle diferentes encargos. Petrona también se dedica a la venta y elaboración de repostería por lo que juntas han brindado un buen servicio y calidad en sus productos. El financiamiento que solicitan es para la compra de materia prima.
texts.en:
The Pablo II Communal Bank is comprised of Gregoria and Petrona.  They have spent a lot of time working together in order to get ahead in their business.  They are very humble and responsible people who enjoy their line of work.  

Gregoria makes and sells pastries.  Most of her customers come to request different orders.

Petrona also makes and sells pastries.  Together they have offered good service and good quality products.

The loan they are requesting is to buy ingredients.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve his house by putting down a floor and building a wall

loans.name: Aracelis Del Carmen

texts.es: Aracelis del Carmen tiene 40 años, su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más 11 años que tiene este negocio, inicio con muy pocos productos ya que no tenía suficientes ingresos para ofrecerles a sus clientes los productos que le solicitaban, pero con el paso del tiempo ha logrado obtener experiencia para atender a sus clientes. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de calzado, cosméticos, joyas entre otras cosas. Sueña con seguir adelante con este negocio y mantenerlo activo.
texts.en:
Aracelis del Carmen, age 40, sells general merchandise.  She has had this business for over 11 years.  She started with very few products because she did not have enough income to offer her customers the products they requested.

However, as time passed she managed to get experience in order to take care of her customers.

The requested loan is to buy footwear, cosmetics, and jewelry, among other things.  

She dreams of getting ahead in the business and keeping it active.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Emilio Enrrique

texts.es:
Don Emilio Enrrique D. S. trabaja como Colector de uno de los mercados de Managua desde hace 9 años.

El es soltero de 44 años de edad, con 4 personas a su cargo y menores de edad, el vive en Managua en el barrio San Judas desde hace 30años.

Es cliente “A” de CEPRODEL desde hace 6 años en los cuales ha pagado 8 créditos en tiempo y forma. Este último crédito lo solicita para Gastos de Consumo, como es cubrir los gastos escolares de sus pequeños. El se encuentra satisfecho con CEPRODEL, puesto que cada vez que él solicita un préstamo, CEPRODEL no se lo niega.
texts.en:
Enrrique D. S. has worked for nine years as a collector at one of the markets in Managua.  He is 44 years old and single.  He has four minors under his care.  He has lived in the San Judas neighborhood in Managua for 30 years.

He has been an “A” client with Ceprodel for six years.  During that time he has repaid eight loans in a timely fashion.  He requested this last loan to buy household consumer products and to cover the educational expenses for his little ones.  He is pleased with Ceprodel given that each times he requests a loan, Ceprodel does not turn him down.

loans.use: To buy household consumer products and to pay educational expenses

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: San Isidro Del Campo Group

texts.es: Esta foto fue tomada en L. casa D. Eva M. una integrante del grupo San Isidro del campo que está ubicado en L. comunidad D. Campo Chico en el Estado D. Veracruz en México. Eva se dedica a L. venta D. calzado que inicio hace 1 año. Solicita el préstamo para comprar mas mercancia en calzado y tener mas variedad para ofrecer. Sus vecinos y clietes L. conocen como una mujer trabajadora y dedicada a su familia. Al momento D. solicitar este Préstamo se siente satisfecha con su crédito. Tiene 34 años estudio hasta primaria es casada y en total tiene 3 hijos; 1 mujer y 2 varones. Quiere este crédito para comprar mas mercancia y tener mas clientes y D. esta forma incrementar sus ventas. Tambien espera realizar alguna reparaciones en su casa, asi como incrementar sus ventas y apoyar a sus hijos con sus estudios y mas adelante poder ampliar su casa.
texts.en:
This photo was taken at the home of Eva M., one of the members of the San Isidro del Campo Group which is located in the community of Campo Chico in the State of Veracruz in Mexico. Eva started selling shoes a year ago. She is requesting a loan to buy more shoes so that she will have a wider variety of merchandise to offer. Her neighbors and customers know her to be a hardworking woman who is dedicated to her family. Upon submitting her application, Eva said she was happy with the loan process. She is 34 years old and has an elementary school education. Eva is married and has three children, a daughter and two sons.

She wants this loan to buy more merchandise so that she can attract more customers and increase her sales. Eva also hopes to make a few repairs to her home as well as increase her sales and support her children with their studies. Later on she wants to expand her house.

loans.use: Purchase shoes to sell

loans.name: Adys Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama ADYS,  porque la hija de la señora que formo el grupo se llama Adriana y creen que ese nombre les traerá suerte al grupo, asi como le trajo bendiciones a su madre con su nacimiento. Este grupo se localiza en Tlaxcala, México; en una comunidad rural netamente Agricola, la mayoria de los habitantes de esa comunidad se dedican a la agricultura y además trabajan en las empresas localizadas en zonas industriales cercanas a la comunidad. Este grupo está integrado por 11 Mujeres trabajadoras, cuyo fin común es darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.La Señora Ana Bertha T. T., es una mujer que desde hace 3 años se ha dedicado a vender tortillas con eso se ayuda para el gasto de la casa y un poco para sus hijos, quiere el crédito para comprar otro comal, va a vender comida preparada para que crezca su negocio poco a poco con el préstasmo.
texts.en:
This group is called “Adys” because the daughter of the woman who founded this group is named Adriana and she believes it will bring luck to her group just as her daughter brought her blessings when she was born. The group is located in Tlaxcala, Mexico, in a rural farming community where most of the residents work for local businesses in nearby industrial areas.

This group consists of eleven hardworking women who have a common goal of providing a better quality of life for their children. Sra. Ana Bertha T. T. has been selling tortillas for three years to help cover her household expenses and provide a little bit of support for her children. She wants this loan to buy another tortilla griddle so that she can sell prepared meals and steadily grow her business.

loans.use: Purchase a tortilla griddle

loans.name: Salustiana's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Salustiana lives in the village of DCM, Mahayag Zamboanga del sur. She is 60 years old, married and in good health. She is the group leader of the four-member group loan offered by PMPC. The members help each other when one of them has difficulty with payments and have been good members of PMPC since the beginning. Salustiana has had a sari-sari (variety) store for six years to support her family's daily needs. She has gained a lot since she became a PMPC member and can access financial services. Salustiana is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP to buy chemicals for farming. It is her third loan.

About PMPC: PAGLAUM MULTIPURPOSE COOPERATIVE is a progressive cooperative in Northwestern Mindanao and reaches out to rural communities

loans.use: Farming

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma D. is from the village of Upper Dicayas. She is 49 years old, married and has four adult children. Wilma makes food, especially snacks known as "biko" made of malagkit rice and coconut milk, to sell. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Wilma joined PMPC to gain access to their financial services. She successfully repaid her previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC) and is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used as additional working capital and to purchase materials for housing repair.

This loan will be the 11th loan taken out by Wilma from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue from her business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase materials for housing repair

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma T. is from the city of Dipolog. She is 30 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. She has had a business selling fresh fish for over three years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month.

In 2009, Thelma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC and is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase additional fish to sell. This will be her third loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish

loans.name: Union Y Solidaridad Group

texts.es: Esta foto fue tomada en la casa de la señora Minerva Pérez, una integrante del grupo unión y solidaridad, que está ubicado en el estado de veracruz, en México. Minerva se dedica a la venta de artículos del hogar que inició hace 5 años. solicita el préstamo para adquirir mas mercancía, sus ventas han mejorado por lo que solicita el préstamo para invertir mas en sus productos. Ella tiene 29 años, estudió una C. comercial, y es madre de un varón de un año, espera obtener más ganancias y mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y su hijo. Silvia M. es la presidenta del grupo, tiene 35 años estudió hasta la secundaria, tiene 2 hijos. Silvia se dedica a la venta de zapatos por catálogo, que inicio hace 3 años. solicita el prestamo para la compra de zapatos por temporada de regreso a clases. Observaciones: se ve a las 11 mujeres del grupo en la foto, la señora que sólo sale su cabeza y parte de su torso se llama Socorro, la segunda de izquierda a derecha de las que estan atras.
texts.en:
This photo was taken at the home of Sra. Minerva Pérez, a member of the group “Unión y Solidaridad” (Unity and Solidarity) which is located in the State of Veracruz in Mexico. Minerva began selling household items five years ago. She is requesting a loan to acquire more merchandise. Her sales have improved, so she is requesting this loan to invest in more products. Minerva is 29 years old and studied for a business degree. She is the mother of a one year old son. Minerva hopes to generate more revenue and improve the quality of life for herself and her son.

Silvia M. is the group president. She is 35 years old and studied through high school. Silvia has two children. She began selling shoes through a catalog three years ago. Silvia is requesting a loan to buy shoes for the school year since students are returning to classes.

Note: Looking at the eleven women in the photo, the woman whose face and torso are partially obscured is named Socorro. She is standing at the back, second to the left.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to sell

loans.name: Edelyn

texts.en: To make a living, Edelyn R. owns and operates a retail business selling different products in her community. She is 24 years old, married with only one child who is in school. They are from the village of Dicoyong. In 2010, Edelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Edelyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to add to her capital and inventory. This will be her second loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy additional products for sale

loans.name: Luz

texts.en: Luz M. owns and operates a store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in her community. She is 57 years old, widowed and has four school-aged children. They are from the village of Camul, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte. Luz has been in her business for over four years and earns approximately 3,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Luz joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Luz has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC which was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Luz is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be her third loan from PMPC. She plans to use additional income to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en: To make a living, Maricel D. works in a family member's business planting and harvesting rice for sale. She is 27 years old, married and has three school-aged children. They are from the village of Lumbayao, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte. Maricel has been in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Maricel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC which was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young plants to raise. Maricel is requesting a new loan of 14,500 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be her fifth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty A.'s main source of income comes from harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in her community. She is 43 years old, married and has five school-aged children. They are from the village of Mulos, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte. Betty has been in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Betty joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC which was used to purchase a fishing boat. Betty is requesting a new loan of 14,500 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her fourth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Decesaria

texts.en: Decesaria M.'s main source of income comes from harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in her community. She is 55 years old, married and has seven school-aged children. They are from the village of Camul, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte. Decesaria has been in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Decesaria joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC which was used to purchase additional fish to sell. Decesaria is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This will be her third loan from PMPC. She plans to use additional income to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Sor

texts.en: Sor S., age 62, is a mother blessed with six children. Most of her children are employed in various jobs and they always contribute their profit to her to use for the family expenses. Her husband is highly skilled at building stone and wooden houses at the mobile place, Kompong Thom Province. Sor S. currently generates an income of approximately $2 per day by selling Khmer cake in the village. Besides selling Khmer cake, Sor S. has been in the farming business for a long time. This is the good time for planting her dry-season rice field, but her old cow doesn't support her field work. That is the reason why Sor S. would like to request a loan from Kiva to buy a new cow to replace the old one.

loans.use: To buy a new cow to replace the old one.

loans.name: Las Manzanitas 1 Group

texts.es: Esta foto fue tomada en la casa de Isabel G. L., una integrante del grupo de Manzanitas I, que esta ubicado en el estado de Veracruz en México. Se ve a las 11 integrantes del grupo en la foto. Ella se dedica a la venta de antojitos,que inició hace 25 años. Solicita este prestamo para adquirir, sillas y mesas para su puesto de memelas ( sopes ) en el nuevo mercado de orizaba. Sus ganacias han aumentado por la nueva ubicación que tiene el negocio de la señora. Al momento de solicitar este prestamo se siente satisfecha y muy contenta por el nuevo prestamo.Tiene 40 años estudio hasta primaria, es madre y  tiene 6 hijos, 3 hombres y 3 mujeres. Quiere este credito para comprar sillas y mesas para su nuevo puesto en el mercado orizaba. Tambien espera obtener ganancias para terminar de construir su casa y tener mejor calidad de vida. Observación: la segunda señora de izquierda a derecha, que carga un bebe, pero no se ve ella bien se llama Rosa P..
texts.en:
This photo was taken at the home of Isabel G. L., a member of the group “Las Manzanitas I” (The Little Apples I), which is located in the State of Veracruz in Mexico. There are eleven group members who appear in the photo. Isabel began selling snacks 25 years ago and is requesting a loan to acquire chairs and tables for her soup stand at the new market in Orizaba. Her earnings have increased since starting her business in this new location. Upon submitting her request, Isabel felt satisfied and happy to be receiving a new loan. She is 40 years old and studied through elementary school. Isabel is the mother of six children, three sons and three daughters. Isabel wants his loan so that she can buy chairs and tables for her new stand at the Orizaba Market. In addition, she hopes to earn money to finish the construction of her house and have a better quality of life.

Note: The woman standing second to the left and holding a baby is Rosa P., but she cannot be seen very well.

loans.use: Purchase tables & chairs

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Mrs. Perla E. is 57 years old, married to a fisherman and has three adult-aged children. She lives in Lobogon barangay within the municipality of Aloran, Misamis Occidental province of the Mindanao islands. Perla sells a variety of fish to the local community, earning 4000 PHP a month.

Perla is glad that she's been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative since 2007. She was able to get financial assistance from PMPC as well as other benefits available to members. Perla needs additional working capital for her fish sales business and is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan.

In the future Perla wants to own a stall in the public market where it would be easier to sell her fish. She would be happy if all her children could be stable and happy in their own families.

loans.use: As working capital for her fish sales business

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria D. is 53 years old, married and has two adult children. She is from the village of Lower Lamac outside of Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental province on the Mindanao islands. Gloria operates a general store from which she sells a variety of different products to the local community. She is also newly into the RTW (ready to wear clothing) business. She sells her RTW to the local community and earns a 20% margin on every item sold.

In 2010, Gloria joined PMPC to gain access to its financial services. She successfully repaid two previous loans from PMPC. Gloria is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP that will be used to purchase more products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to supplement her family's income.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita M. is 63 years old, married and has two adult-aged children. She is from the city of Oroquieta in the province of Misamis Occidental on the Mindanao islands. Carmelita runs a "sari-sari" (variety) store from which she sells an array of different products to the local community. Carmelita has been in business for over three years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Carmelita joined PMPC to gain access to its financial services. She has successfully repaid six loans from PMPC. Carmelita is now requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en: Elvie M. is from the village of Mohon. She is 40 years old, married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Elvie owns and operates a sari-sari store. Her main source of income comes from selling a variety of different products in her community. Elvie has been in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2008, Elvie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Elvie is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her fourth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Las Rositas De Novillero Group

texts.es: Esta foto fue tomada en casa D. L. señora Celia, una integrante del grupo Rositas D. Novillero,que está ubicado en novillero chico,colonia del estado D. veraC., L. señora Celia tiene una panadería que inicio hace 4 años,solicita el prestamo para L. compra D. materia prima para su negocio,sus compañeras y vecinas L. catalogan como una persona emprendedora,al momento D. solicitar este prestamo se siente muy contenta,tiene 35 años,estudio hasta L. primaria,vive en unión libre y tiene 2 hijos un hombre y una mujer,tambien espera que su negocio crezca mas asi como su clienteL.. El grupo esta conformado por 11 integrantes.
texts.en: This photo was taken at the home of Sra. Celia, a member of the group “Rositas D. Novillero”, which is located in Novillero Chico, a subdivision in the State of VeraC..  She has a bakery that she started four years ago.  Celia is requesting a loan to buy supplies for her business.  Her colleagues and neighbors consider her to be an enterprising individual.  Upon apply for her loan, Celia felt very happy.  She is 35 years old and has an elementary school education.  Celia is in a common law marriage and has two children, a son and a daughter.  She hopes that her business will grow as well as her customer base.  The group consists of eleven members.

loans.use: Purchase supplies

loans.name: Cleo Ann

texts.en: Cleo Ann S. owns and operates a sari-sari store selling a variety of different products in her community. She is 34 years old, married and has two school-aged children. They are from the village of Upper Langcangan. Cleo Ann has been in her business for over six years and earns approximately 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2006, Cleo Ann joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Cleo Ann has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Cleo Ann is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This will be her 11th loan from PMPC. She plans to use additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Fedilita

texts.en:
Fedilita S. is from the village of Dolipos Alto. She is married and has three adult children. Fedilita owns and operates a "sari-sari" (general) store selling a variety of products in the local community. Fedilita has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Fedilita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Fedilita has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. 

Fedilita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional stock and to provide working capital. This will be the third loan taken out by Fedilita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock and to provide working capital

loans.name: Ma. Belen

texts.en:

To make a living, Ma. Belen makes and sells fried foods in the local community. Ma. Belen has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Ma. Belen joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Ma. Belen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 50,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. 

Ma. Belen is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Ma. Belen from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About PMPC:

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia V. is married and has four adult children. 

To make a living, Cecilia owns and operates a "lapida" (epitaph) making business, providing tombstone engraving services to local community members. Cecilia has been in business for more than ten years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2004, Cecilia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. 

Cecilia is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP, which will be used as additional working capital. This will be the 11th loan taken out by Cecilia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Ly U., 51, is married and resides with her child in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. 

U. sells Cambodian noodles and grows rice, earning an income of US $6 per day. Her child is employed at the factory, earning an income of US $3 per day to help cover the family expenses. 

Each month, the family has to spend US $40 on food and  $10 on the other necessary expenses. U. is requesting a loan of US $400 to purchase a plot of farmland to expand the farming business. 

In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a plot of farmland to expand the farming business

loans.name: Som

texts.en:
Som D., 23, is married and resides with his wife and child in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. 

D. is a construction worker, earning an income of US $3 per day. His wife sells fried frog, earning an income of US $3 per day to help cover the family expenses. 

Each month, the family has to spend US $70 on food and US $18 on the other necessary expenses. D. is requesting a loan of US $500 to repair his house. This will be his first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To repair his house

loans.name: Ganzorig

texts.en:
Ganzorig is 45 years old and lives with his wife and three children in the Arhangai province of Mongolia in his own house and fence. His youngest two children attend a local secondary school while the oldest son and wife help with his business. 

Ganzorig started a raw materials trading business in 2003 and ran it for several years. In 2009 he changed his trading business into a carpentry business, which has more demand and brings more profit. He produces ger wooden parts, such as wooden doors, floors, and walls and delivers them to his customers with his own truck. (A "ger" is a traditional Mongolian house tent.) 

Ganzorig is an honest and hardworking businessman. He is requesting a 3,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more materials for his carpentry business.

loans.use: To purchase more materials

loans.name: Shova

texts.en:
This is 42-year-old Shova Thapa.  She is married and has two children, age 20 and 16.  In 2010, she established her tea shop business.  Working seven days a week and seven hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid one loan from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy food supplies for her shop.  In the future, Shova plans to raise the economic conditions of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

Whether on the streets of Kathmandu or in the villages outside of the capital, tea shops are places of business and meeting in Nepal.  Called a chiya pasal, these tea shops make a sweet, milky tea that can be purchased for a few cents a cup.  With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to keep their store shelves stocked while increasing their profit margins by buying in greater volume. 

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007.  Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering micro-credit and business training programs to low-income women.  In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.  

For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates:  BPW Partner Page     

Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team

loans.use: to buy food supplies

loans.name: Ma. Vilma

texts.en:
Ma. Vilma A. is from the village of San Pedro. She is 44 years old. Ma.Vilma is married and has four school aged children. To make a living, she raises pigs in her backyard. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $139 a month for these activities.

In 2006, Ma.Vilma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC.

She is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase piglets and feeds. This will be her 9th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and feed for them

loans.name: Norbeto

texts.en:
Norbeto T. has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative since 2007. He is a resident of Upper Loboc, Oroquieta City. Norberto is 58 years old, married and has three adult children. He sells fresh eggs in the local community, whereby he earns approximately $115 monthly. 

Norberto is happy that he was able to borrow money from Paglaum Multi-purpose Cooperative because it helped make his egg business successful. Now, he wants to take out a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase additional eggs to sell. He wants to have additional capital in order to sustain his operation.

Norberto plans to own a stall in the market where he can display his fresh eggs. He also wants to see all his children successful in their chosen careers.

loans.use: to purchase additional eggs to sell

loans.name: Tep

texts.en: Tep N. T. is a 65-year-old married woman who currently lives with her family members in a small house in Kompong Thom Province. She earns her living by cultivating a rice crop on her farmland. Tep N. T. has many years of experience in the field and she always gets great results from her farming, both dry season and rainy season. She has another financial supporter in her husband who works in the construction field as a building worker. This couple has only one child who sells a few items in front of her house. Due to the fact that the rice-harvesting season is coming, Tep N. T. has decided to seek a loan from Kiva for capital to buy more rice when prices are low for future sales, and to use the rest for the whole family to eat.

loans.use: To buy more rice for future sales and for the whole family to eat.

To make a living, she owns and operates a "sari-sari" store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. loans.name: Hourt

texts.en:
Hourt M., 29, is married and resides with her husband and child in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. M. sells motorbike spare parts, earning an income of about $5 per day. Her husband is a motorbike repairman, earning an income of $7 per day to help cover the family's expenses. Each month, the family has to spend $70 on food and $40 on the other necessary expenses. 

M. is requesting a loan of $1,000 to buy more motorbike spare parts to resell. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her 1st loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more motorbike spare parts to resell

loans.name: Sarantuya

texts.en:
Sarantuya, 33, is married and lives with her husband, father-in-law and two children in their own ger, a traditional nomadic housing tent, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her husband works as a mechanic for the military base, her children attend a kindergarten, and her father-in-law helps to take care of the children. 

She began her clothing business in 2008 from a rented stall in a crowded shopping center. As her business expanded, she opened a second stall at another location in the same shopping center. Her daily average sales are between $41 and $82, and her working capital is now 1,000,000 MNT. Sarantuya is an open-minded and hardworking businesswoman. She is planning to buy a car that would be helpful in her business. 

She is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to purchase a wider variety of goods in order to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase a wider variety of goods

loans.name: Reth

texts.en:
Reth S., 40, is married and resides with her three children in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for its palm products. S. sells fish, earning an income of about $5 per day. Her husband is a fisherman, earning an income of around $5 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend $70 on food and $47 on the other necessary expenses. 

S. is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase a motorbike so that her husband can start a new business as a motor-taxi driver. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her husband to start a new business as a motor-taxi driver

loans.name: Shanta

texts.en:
This is 42-year-old Shanta T..  She is married and has 3 children ages 23, 20 and 15.  In 2005, she established her grocery store business.  Working 7 days a week and 9 hours a day, she supoorts her family.

She has already received and successfully repaid one loan from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy grocery goods for her shop. In the future, Shanta plans to boost the economic condition of her family and she thanks you for your support.

In the Kathmandu Valley, small grocery stores, called pasals, are an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margains.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase their profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 square feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner microfinance institution, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007.  Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women.  In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.  For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates, or join our BPW Lending Team.

loans.use: to buys grocery goods for her shop

loans.name: Ernesta

texts.en: Ernesta M. is from the village of Binakalan, Gingoog City. She is 53 years old, married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Ernesta owns and operates a business venture in the food sector operating a mini-restaurant, serving a variety of different meals like adobo, afritada and caldereta to customers in the local community. She also buys and sells feed for pigs. Ernesta has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2010, Ernesta joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ernesta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional ingredients and for working capital. Ernesta is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase food and drinks for the restaurant and a stock of feed. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Ernesta from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase food and drinks for the restaurant and a stock of feed
