He sold his livestock to purchase a car, which enabled him to start operating his transportation business in 2006. For the future, he plans to continue running this business with stable operation to save more money so that he can marry. He is requesting a 500,000 Mongolian tugriks loan to repair his car engine as well as to buy medicine for his mother, who is under bad health conditions.

loans.use: To repair his car

loans.name: Mauwa

texts.en:
Mauwa is a married woman with five children, three of whom attend school while the others are still too young for school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For over 10 years, she has operated a business selling lesos/khangas (traditional African cloth) from home to her neighbors. In addition, she has real-estate houses for rent, which contributes to her other source of income. Mauwa faces a major challenge of competition from other cloth sellers. She hopes to increase stock and get more profit in the future.

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase a bale of lesos/khangas for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her livelihood.

loans.use: To purchase a bale of lesos/khangas (traditional African cloth) for resale

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en:
Thirty-one-year-old Jerry B. is a duck raiser. His wife is a receptionist in a certain establishment in their area. Jerry has been raising ducks for 20 years. He sells ducks eggs to his community. He also tends a corn farm. Jerry gets a share of the harvest from the farm. He sells his harvest to the market.

Jerry would like a loan so that he can have more ducks to raise. He applied for the amount of 12,000 Philippines pesos. Jerry is hopeful that this loan will help immensely in building his business.

loans.use: To buy more ducks to raise

loans.name: Bolormaa

texts.en: Bolormaa is 39 years old and lives with her husband and four children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She lives with her family in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Her husband repairs tires for the local car repair center to supplement his family's income. Her oldest daughter attends a vocational training course as a hairdresser, and her youngest daughter attends a primary school. Bolormaa's middle two sons both have incurable illnesses. In 2008, she received some help from a Japanese man who paid all related costs for her sons' diagnosis in Japan. Bolormaa operates a business out of her home making woolen slippers. She started her business in 2009 after attending a training course conducted by a Japanese person. She purchases her main product, wool, at 5,000 MNT and sells her final products at 17,000 MNT. She is very worried for her two sons because neither has much time to live. Bolormaa is a very kind and modest person and says with tears in her eyes, "All I want is to provide a decent life for my two sons while they are alive." She is requesting a 229,000 MNT loan to purchase wool in order to make more woolen slippers.

loans.use: To purchase wool

loans.name: Naomi Wanjiku

texts.en:
Naomi has practiced mixed farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last four years. She is 21 years old, married to Ezekiel N. and they have two children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend and this will be her second loan. She paid for her 1st loan of KES 10,000 well and in good time. She plans to use the loan amount to buy a dairy cow.

In future, Naomi hopes to be supplying milk in Ndunyu Njeru in large quantities. She also is planning to buy a lorry to help her in milk supply.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This lender is 52 years old and lives with her husband and five of her children in the Kampong Cham province. She is a farmer who works for less than 1 USD per day, while her husband is a construction worker building houses. On average, he is able to make about 6 USD each day. Three of their children work in construction, and two are in school. She needs a loan to expand her business. She is asking for a loan of 1200 USD to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to school and to purchase a plot of farmland to grow yams. She hopes this loan will help her family grow more yams, and therefore, earn more income.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike and farmland

loans.name: Mwanayuma

texts.en:
Mwanayuma is a married woman with eight children. Two of her children attend school, and six have already graduated. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated an open air market for the past six years, selling food items to her neighbours and passersby. Mwanayuma faces a major challenge of competition from other food market operators. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

With the 20,000 KES loan she wants to purchase sacks of beans, wheat flour, rice and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her livelihood.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of beans, wheat flour, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Sin

texts.en:
Sin S., 38, lives with his wife in the Kampong Cham province. Since 1993, they have been working in construction and are able to make about $5 each per day. 

Sin S. is asking for a loan of $700 to purchase a motorbike to commute to work. This will allow the family to reduce their transportation expense and save much more than before. 

Sin S. is pictured with his wife at home.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to commute to work

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria N. lives in the Kawempe neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has three children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (her sister's children).    

Victoria has a retail shop. She has been in this business for less than one year, and she works seven days out of every week. Victoria has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more merchandise, like bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and jerrycans of cooking oil. 

She also generates additional income through selling second-hand clothes. The main business challenges for Victoria include seasonality and transportation. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a wholesale shop and also to build her own house.   

Victoria lives in a home that she rents; she doesn't have access to electricity or piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include food, rent and medication.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of soap, cartons of salt, jerrycans of cooking oil and bags of sugar

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Sam S., 39, is a farmer who lives with two young children and her husband in the Kampong Cham province. She typically makes $1 each day, while her husband, working as a Khmer teacher, makes $5 per day. 

The weather conditions have been difficult in Cambodia this past year and inflation has also been out of control. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Sam S. included. She is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase farmland and fertilizer for the farm, increasing her current profits and prospects for the future. 

Sam S. is pictured with her husband and her young daughter.

loans.use: To purchase farmland

loans.name: John Njigua

texts.en:
John has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 13 years. He is 32 years old, married to Grace Wangui and they have one child.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his third loan. He has serviced all his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy fertilser and potato seedlings for planting.

In future, John hopes to buy more land and practice large scale farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and potato seedlings for planting.

loans.name: Mauwa

texts.en:
Mauwa is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a school for the past five years, while also teaching pupils in that school. Her major customers are children from the neighboring community. Mauwa faces a major challenge in the lack of enough classrooms to accommodate pupils in her school. In the future, she hopes to construct and expand her school.

With the 10,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase stationery for the school. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her school.

loans.use: To purchase stationery for the school

loans.name: Lisa Jane

texts.en: Liza Jane R. is from the village of Silucap, Liloy, Zamboanga Del Norte. She is 40 years old. Liza Jane is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Liza Jane operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste. Liza Jane has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2009, Liza Jane joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Liza Jane has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Liza Jane is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Liza Jane from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en: Mrs. Juvy F. is 40 years old. She is married and a resident of Dullan, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She has five adult children. Juvy sells tuba (a native wine from coconut) to different stores in the nearby barangays (neighborhoods). Her husband is very supportive of her, helping her all the way. Juvy joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in October 2008 to access financial assistance for her small business. She has taken loans several times already. Today, she applies for a 25,000 Philippines pesos loan for house renovation. Juvy wishes that she will someday be able to own a comfortable house and to see her children successful in their chosen careers.

loans.use: For house repair

loans.name: Umedjon

texts.ru: Мирзоев Умедчон проживает в районе Яван. Ему 31 год. Женат. Имеет 4 детей. Живет вместе с родителями. Его брат находится на заработках в России. Сам Умедчон занимается растениеводством и садоводством. Рядом с домом имеет земельный участок, где выращивает овощи и сажает фруктовые деревья. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже два года. Кредит берет для покупки семян и саженцев.
texts.en: Umedjon M. lives in the Yavan Region. He is 31 years old. Married, with four children. His parents live with him. His brother is temporarily working in Russia. Umedjon grows vegetables and fruits. He has a land plot near his house, which is where he grows vegetables and plants fruit trees. He has been doing this work for two years. He is taking out a loan in order to buy seeds and saplings.

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and saplings

loans.name: Ny

texts.en: Ny P., 30, is married and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province. She opened a pharmacy in her village in 1995 and is able to make about US $7 of profit each day. Her husband is a local doctor. On average, he earns US $11 per day. This couple has two young children living at home to support. Ny P. needs a loan to buy more medicines.

loans.use: To buy more medicines

loans.name: Adeles

texts.en:
Adeles H. runs a general store selling a variety of different products in her community. She is 44 years old, married and has two school-aged children. They are from the village of Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur. Adeles has been in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

 In 2009, Adeles joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She is an individual member of PMPC. Adeles is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This  will be her third loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

loans.use: For additional capital

loans.name: Micheki Mirithu

texts.en:
Micheki has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 10 years. He is 51 years old, married to Felista Nduta and they have five children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his fouth loan. He has paid for all his previous loans well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount to to buy fertilzer and seedlings for planting.

In future, Micheki plans to buy more land and practice large scale farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings for planting.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth T. owns and operates a general store selling a variety of different products in her community. She is 55 years old, married and has three school-aged children. They are from the village of Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur. Ruth has been in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,800 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. 

In 2009, Ruth joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Ruth is an individual member of PMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This will be her second loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

loans.use: For additional capital

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.en:
Consuelo L. is from the village of Olingan, Dipolog City. She is 55 years old. Consuelo is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Consuelo operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste. Consuelo has been engaged in this business for over a year.

In 2010, Consuelo joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She successfully repaid her previous loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP). 

Consuelo is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the second loan taken out by Consuelo from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional goods for her sari-sari (variety) store

loans.name: Hoar

texts.en:
Hoar H., 59, is married and lives with her husband in the Kampong Cham province. To earn a living, she buys and sells cashew nuts in her village and is able to make about $1 each day. Her husband works recharging batteries. On average, he is able to make about $19 in revenue per day. 

This couple has two children; one is in school and one is employed.

loans.use: To buy cashew nuts to sell

loans.name: George Mutahi

texts.en:
George Mutahi N. is 52 years old, married to Joyce Wambui, and they have one child. He has farmed in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last ten years.

George was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend. This will be his second loan; he paid his first loan of 40,000 KES well and in good time. He plans to use his loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings for planting.

In the future, George plans to buy more land and practice large-scale farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings for planting

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bitter-balls (eggplant), beans, salt, seasoning, pepper, rice, etc.

loans.name: Charles Wambua

texts.en:
Charles Wambua N. is 33 years old, married to Margaret Nyambura, and they have one child. He has been selling timber in the town of Ndunyu Njeru for the last two years.

Charles was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend. This will be his fourth loan; he has paid all his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use his loan to add to his stock of timber for sale in his lumber yard.

In the future, Charles hopes to grow his business and become a leading supplier of timber in Ndunyu Njeru.

loans.use: To buy more timber to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Suon

texts.en:
Suon S. is a 39-year-old farmer who lives in Kompong Cham Province. Suon S. is married to Chim Chamroeun, age 39. This couple, who works together in the farming business, have three children, all of whom are single. 

One of Suon S.'s children is a horse cart driver in and around his community. Presently, his horse cart business is not doing well because the horse he uses is getting old and can no longer continue to provide the service.  To help her son, Suon S. is requesting a loan to buy a horse to replace his old one. 

Suon S. and her son are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To buy horse for son's business

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married woman with five children, three of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water and her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For over ten years, Saumu has operated a food stall, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. Her major business challenge is competition from other food stall operators. Saumu decided to join Yehu to access loans and improve her livelihood. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 KES to purchase wheat flour and sacks of sugar. In the future, Saumu hopes to increase her sales to earn more profits.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour and sugar

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana K. is 42 years old.  She is married and has two children. After graduating from school in Panfilovka village, Svetlana went to law school in Russia and started work as a lawyer in Barnaul town (Russia). There, she met her husband, who is also a citizen of Kyrgyzstan.  In 1988, they were married.  In 1991, they decided to come back to their native village in Kyrgyzstan, and with the money they saved, built a house and a small barn. 

In order to find a means of subsistence for her family, Svetlana decided to start a business in animal breeding and land cultivating.  With the initial capital of 1,500 KGS, Svetlana bought piglets to fatten and resell. Today, thanks to a persistent personality, Svetlana has a farm with two bull-calves and fifteen pigs, and cultivates barley and clover which is used as forage for her animals. With the aim of developing her farm, Svetlana took her first loan from Bai-Tushum and repaid it without any delay.
 
Svetlana has applied for another loan of 100,000 KGS to purchase more livestock. With the revenues generated, she plans to further increase the number animals on her farm. In the future, Svetlana dreams of opening a shop selling different kinds of meat products. 

About Bai-Tushum: 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase wheat and maize flour, rice, beans, and sugar.

loans.name: Samuel A.'s Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of the SLMWBO School, in Mayawlaw village, near Magburaka town in northern Sierra Leone. This school was founded in 1982 by the SLMWBO Mission to provide education to the children of this community. 

This is the first loan that the members of this institution are accessing from Kiva lenders through SMT. With the help of this loan, some members of staff will start a small business and those who are already running small businesses will invest the loan into their business. Some of the staff members will be using the loan to buy pieces of furniture, others to pay either for their children in their education or pay for themselves to pursue further studies. Others will use their loan in home building projects.  

Samuel A. K. is the leader of this group of teachers. Age forty-two, Mr. K. is a husband and also father to five children. A native of Maraka village, Mr. K. has been in the teaching profession for twenty-eight years now. He has requested for this loan in order to improve his life. He will invest part of the loan in business and use the rest to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: For business investment and to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: This is Ibrahim. He is married and has 3 children, aged 2, 6 and 8. He has two additional dependents who live with him because they are his sister's children and he helps to raise them. In 2000, Ibrahim established his used clothing business. He began his business because he wanted to be self supportive. Working seven days a week and nine hours a day, he earns about SLL 1,672,440 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000 in order to buy additional used clothes. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately SLL 334,488. In the future, Ibrahim plans to continue adding more inventory to his business so that he can earn more. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy additional used clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more electrical goods.

loans.name: David L.'s Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of the SDA Primary School in Mayeberie village in northern Sierra Leone. This school was opened in 1983 by the Seven Days Adventist Church Mission (SMD Mission), to give formal education to the children of Mayeberie village. Presently, this school is staffed with eight teachers and 160 pupils. 

This is the second loan that these teachers have requested from SMT/Kiva lenders. Having repaid their previous loan successfully, they now want a new loan in order to further improve of their standard of living. 

David L. K. is the head teacher and leader of this group. Mr. K. has taught for 35 years now. Born in 1951 in the village of Makump, Mr. K. is married to a businesswoman and the couple has seven children who are attending primary and secondary schools. Mr. K. has requested for a loan of SLL 1,000,000 from Kiva partner in order to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Saidu

texts.en: This is 20 year-old Saidu K.. He is married and has one four year-old child. In 2007, Saidu established his telephone accessories business because he wanted to support his family. Working seven days a week and eight hours a day, he earns about SLL 340,000 every month. He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,500,000. Saidu has already received and successfully repaid one loan and now requires a new loan in order to buy more stock for his shop. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately SLL 350,000. In the future, Saidu plans to open another shop and to hire workers. He would also like to purchase a generator and land upon which to build a house. He is serious and determined and thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy modern phone accessories.

loans.name: Chynar

texts.en: Chynar D. is a 45-year-old single mother of two daughters. She was born in the south of Kyrgyzstan and after finishing school, she moved to the neighboring country of Kazakhstan. After graduating from college in Kazakhstan, she worked as a cashier at the railway station. In 1986, Chynar got married and soon became the mother of two children. Unfortunately, her family life wasn’t happy and she decided to return to Kyrgyzstan. In order to find means of subsistence, Chynar used her initial capital of 20,000 Kyrgyzstan soms (KGS) to start her business of reselling bathroom equipment. She has been selling the past five years and has become known as a reliable supplier of high-quality goods. She worked hard and managed to develop her business, which today brings profit about 9,000 KGS in a month. To expand her business, Chynar borrowed one loan from Bai-Tushum and Partners, which was used as intended and repaid without any delays. Now Chynar plans to use this loan of 20,000 KGS to broaden the assortment of goods and increase her floating capital. With the revenues, she plans to hold her younger daughter’s wedding and give a good dowry to her. About Bai-Tushum: Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To broaden the assortment of goods

loans.name: Alice Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Alice” group. They are small-scale businesspeople based in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently, improve on their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Fatmata K.. Fatmata is age 25; she was born in Magburaka town, where she is currently residing together with her husband and four children. Her husband is a teacher and her children are attending primary school. For 10 years now, she has been selling cooked rice, palm oil and uncooked rice. With this loan, Fatmata will buy rice, palm oil, peppers, etc., to improve on her business size and quality.

loans.use: Buy rice, palm oil, peppers, etc., to improve on her business size and quality

loans.name: Niyasbek

texts.en:
Niyasbek D. is a 55-year-old farmer who lives in the north of Kyrgyzstan. He is married and has two children. 

Niyasbek has been engaged in cattle breeding for 23 years. He started this activity with the initial capital of only 1,500 KGS, which he used to purchase three sheep.  Owing to his persistent and hardworking personality, Niyasbek has managed to multiply his investments. Today, his farm brings in 20,000 KGS per month in profit through the sale of meat and milk products. With the revenues from his business, he has been able to give his children a good education. 

Niyasbek plans to use this loan of 70,000 KGS to increase the number of cattle to fatten and resell.  

About Bai-Tushum and Partners
Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Set Mot Group

texts.en:
Aminata K. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Aminata was born in Yele village 36 years ago. She is married to a civil servant and the couple has five children, four of whom are attending primary schools and one in secondary school. For four years now, Aminata has been selling groundnuts, rice, palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), etc. 

This is the first loan that Aminata and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently, improve on their living conditions. 

Aminata will use her share of the loan (500,000 Sierra Leone leones) to expand her business; she will buy groundnuts, rice and palm oil on a wholesale basis to add to her business.

loans.use: Buy groundnuts, rice and palm oil wholesale to add to her business

loans.name: Tawopsu Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “Tawopsu” group from Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of 500,000 Sierra Leone leones each. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently, improve their living conditions. 

Mariatu T. is the leader of this group. The 40-year-old is married to a businessman and they have four children who are attending secondary school. Mariatu has been a businesswoman for 10 years now; she sells toothpaste, toothbrushes, cigarettes, pepper, palm oil, etc. With her share of this loan, she will buy the aforementioned items at wholesale prices to add to her current stock.

loans.use: Buy toothpaste, toothbrushes, cigarettes, pepper, palm oil, etc., at wholesale prices to add to her current stock

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine K. D. is 43 years old. She is married to a driver and has two children, aged 13 and 14 years old. Her business is located at Magongo estate in Mombasa, Kenya. Mombasa is the coastal region of Kenya and is well-known for its many tourist-attraction sites, not forgetting the Indian Ocean's white beaches. 

She owns a beauty salon and has been providing services to the local women. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is insufficient funds. However, she works very hard from early morning to late evening to keep her business doing well. 

She is using her loan of 60,000 Kenyan shillings to buy cosmetics and hair additions to sell to the customers to grow her business and meet the demands of her customers. She hopes to grow her business and give her children a good education to the university level. She describes herself as customer friendly.

loans.use: Cosmetics

loans.name: Félicité

texts.fr:
Maman Fely exerce son commerce dans la boucherie /poissonnerie au abord du marché plateau. Mariée,  mère de 3enfants, elle a commencée au marché sur un étalage à vendre des poulets à bouillir en détail il ya 10ans.

Avec le prêt passé, elle à réaliser des revenus qui lui ont permis de rembourser sans difficultés car elle avait renforcé son stock.

Le prochain prêt, va encore contribuer à l’amélioration de son stock, elle va acheté 2cartons de viande arrière, 2carton des tripes, 3cartons des cuisses des poulets, 3cartons des poule à bouillir, 2catons de tige de saucissons, 1cartons des ailes de poulets, 1cartons des ailes de dindes, 1catons de foie de bœufs, 1carton de pieds de porcs.
Avec tous ces produits, elle pourra vendre et épargner pour atteindre ses objectifs :
Continuer avec HOPE, apporter son aide  en assistant son mari pour la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
Maman Fely carries out her business in the butcher's/fishmonger's shop on the side of the Plateau market. She is married and mother to three children and she began selling chickens for boiling on a retail basis on a stall in the market ten years ago.

With the previous loan she was able to build up her stock and thus made an income which allowed to repay the loan without any difficulty. 

The next loan will again contribute to building up her stock, as she is going to buy two cartons of backside meat, two cartons of tripe, three cartons of chicken thighs, three cartons of chicken for boiling, two cartons of sausage links, one carton of chicken wings, one carton of turkey wings, one carton of ox liver and one carton of pigs' feet.

She will be able to sell all these products and save enough money to achieve her objectives, which are to continue collaborating with HOPE and to help her husband cover the children's schooling costs.

loans.use: Purchase of cartons of chicken thighs, backside, pork, sausages and fish.

loans.name: Jaffar

texts.en:
Jaffar M. is a married man with eight children between the ages of 22 and 6 years old. He describes himself as kind and smart. His business is located in Likoni estate in Mombasa, Kenya. Mombasa is in the coastal region of Kenya and is well known for its many many tourist attraction sites – not forgetting the Indian Ocean's white beaches. 

Jaffar supplies water to local people. Besides that, he owns some rental houses. He has been in business for 20 years now. He says that his business is profitable and his major challenge is financial constraint. Nevertheless, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to diversify into a transport business by buying a motorbike. He hopes to grow his business and improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for a transport business

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a married man with two children, both of whom attend school. He lives at a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is rent.

He has operated a retail business for the past four years, selling at the market to his neighbors and passerby. Hassan faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in his business. He hopes to establish a retail shop in the future.

With the 40,000 Kenyan shillings, he wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sacks of sugar for sale. He decided to join Yehu because it offers good services.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sacks of sugar for sale

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria vive en casa propia en la zona Villa Nuevo Potosí, de la ciudad de La Paz, es soltera y tiene un hijo menor de edad, la señora realiza trabajos de cocinera para eventos particulares,  con los ingresos que obtienen se mantienen.
El crédito será utilizado para la construcción, refacción de las gradas de su casa en dos tramos. 
Es la primera vez que presenta una solicitud de créditos.

Por su estudio socio económico califica para obtener un nuevo crédito
texts.en:
Maria lives in her own home in Villa Nuevo Potosí neighborhood, in the city of La Paz.  She is single and has one dependent child.  Maria works as a cook, preparing food for private events.  She uses her income to support herself and her child.  She will use this loan to build and remodel her house steps in two flights.

This is the first time that Maria has requested a loan.  The socio-economic analysis we have carried out qualifies her to receive a loan.

loans.use: To build and remodel her house steps

loans.name: Amin

texts.en:
Amin is a married man with two children, both of whom are still too young for school. He lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is rent.

He has operated a shoe-vending business for the past two years, selling in a shop to his neighbors, especially women. Amin faces a major challenge of paying the rent for his shop in his business. He hopes to establish his own shop in the future.

With the 40,000 Kenyan shillings, he wants to purchase a bundle of shoes for resale. He decided to join Yehu because it is located near his area of operation.

loans.use: To purchase a bundle of shoes for resale

loans.name: Tania Judith

texts.es: El señora Tania dedicada a la venta de ropa en el mercado de la zona donde ella vive, durante los días de feria es que la señora Tania sale a vender su mercadería  con la ayuda de su esposo y junto a sus dos pequeños, ya que ellos son la razón por la que La Sra. Tania y su esposo trabajan,  el motivo de la solicitud de este crédito es para la compra de mercadería por docena y así incrementar su capital de trabajo,  para poder tener mas ingresos dentro su familia y mejorar la calidad de vida, la Sra. Tania es una mujer muy trabajadora y esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Tania works selling clothes in her local market.  On market days, she goes out to sell her merchandise with her husband's help and together with her two little ones since they are the reason she and her husband work.

Tania is requesting this loan so that she can buy merchandise in bulk and thereby increase her working capital.  This will provide her family with more income and improve their quality of life.  Tania is a very hard-working woman and she is grateful to the institution for the support they have offered her.

loans.use: To buy clothes in bulk

loans.name: Said

texts.en:
Said is a married man with four children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees.

He has operated a second-hand clothes business for the past two years, selling at the market to his neighbors. Said faces a major challenge of theft in his business. He hopes to establish a shop to sell clothes in the future.

With the 40,000 Kenyan shillings, he wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. He decided to join Yehu because it is near his place of operation.

loans.use: To purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio es transportista publico;  está casado, tiene dos hijos de 16 y 10 años respectivamente y vive en su casa propia ubicada en la zona Villa Huayna Potosí de la ciudad de El Alto.
El crédito será utilizado para la compra de equipo de GNV (gas Natural Vehicular) para la transformación de Gasolina a GNV para su movilidad. De esta manera abaratará los costos de combustible en por lo menos un 40% y mejorará sus ingresos.

 Es el primer crédito con IMPRO y el primero via Kiva.
texts.en:
Antonio is a public transporter. He is married, has 2 children, 16 and 10 years of age respectively, and lives in his own house, located in the Villa Huayna Potosi zone of the city of El Alto.

His loan will be used for buying equipment from BNV (Vehicular Natural Gas) to transform his vehicle from gasoline to natural gas as a new source of power. In this way, he will save on fuel costs by at least 40% and also, improve his income.

This is his first loan with IMPRO and also, his first via Kiva.

loans.use: TO PAY THE COST OF EQUIPMENT AND CONVERTING HIS PASSENGER TRANSPORTATION VEHICLE FROM GAS TO NATURAL GAS

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en: Rashid is a single man who lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food. He has operated a garage business for the past two years and also drives matatus (a public motor vehicle), which contributes to his other source of income. His potential customers are motorcycle operators and car owners. Rashid faces the major challenge of competition in his business. He hopes to open another garage in the future. With the 40,000 Kenyan shillings, he wants to purchase a spraying machine to expand his garage. He decided to work with Yehu after being introduced to Yehu by his friends.

loans.use: To purchase a spraying machine to expand his garage

loans.name: Sudi

texts.en:
Sudi is a married man with three children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is security bills.

He has operated his retail shop for the past two years, selling to his neighbors and passersby. Previously, he was selling newspapers at the market. Sudi faces a major challenge of theft in his business. He hopes to expand his shop and establish a wholesale operation.

With the 40,000 Kenyan shillings, he wants to purchase sacks of sugar for sale at his retail shop. He decided to join Yehu because of its good customer relations.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of sugar for sale at his retail shop

loans.name: Yaya

texts.fr:
Monsieur Yaya D. est un homme de 20 ans et sans enfants. Il vit chez son père dans le quartier Torakabougou de Bougouni.
N’ayant pas fréquenté le système scolaire, à son jeune âge il suivait les animaux c’est à dire l’activité du berger auprès de son père au village.
Quelles années plus tard il décida  de quitter le village pour Bougouni afin d’apprendre le commerce notamment la vente  d’articles divers de boutique auprès de son frère.
 Avec 3 année d'expérience, il maîtrise cette activité.
 Pour le renforcement de son commerce, monsieur Yaya D. décide de prendre un prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso pour acheter des articles divers pour sa boutique. Il est à son premier prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso.
 Il s’approvisionne à Bougouni et à Bamako. Sa clientèle est composée de la population locale.
 Avec ce prêt, monsieur Yaya D. compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 25 000 FCFA.
 Avec ce bénéfice il envisage toujours agrandir sa boutique.
texts.en:
Mr. Yaya D. is a 20-year old man, without children. He lives in his father’s home in the Torakabougou district of Bougoni. Not having gone to school, he started guarding animals from an early age on, that is to say, he worked as a shepherd together with his father in the village. Some years later he decided to leave the village for Bougouni in order to learn how to run a small business, learning from his brother how to operate a general store. Now, with three years of experience, he knows his work well. 

In order to bolster his business, Mr. Yaya D. had decided to take out a loan from Soro Yiriwaso in order to purchase miscellaneous items for his store. He is on his first loan with Soro Yiriwaso. He stocks up in Bougouni and in Bamako. His customers come from the local area.

With this loan, Mr. Yaya D. plans to achieve a monthly income of 25,000 West African Francs. He plans to use this income in order to expand his store further.

loans.use: Purchasing miscellaneous items for his store

loans.name: Los Peregrinos Group

texts.es: El Banco de Emprendimiento LOS PEREGRINOS es un banco que ya está en su tercer ciclo y el Banco está conformado por 8 Integrantes 7 Mujeres y 1 Varón y las señoras se dedican al comercio y venta ropas y otros, y la Sra. LUZ es la presidenta del Banco le eligieron por su responsabilidad y solidaridad con sus compañeras esta separada de su esposo, cuenta que fue un momento dificil para ella pero salio adelante por el bienestar de sus tres hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar y ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda Mano en la feria de Yungas y también viaja a distintas ferias, vive  en casa familiar, y su deseo es tener su casa propia y esta ahorrando para conseguir este deseo, con el préstamo a lograra comprar más mercadería y así incrementar su capital de trabajo de esta manera mejorara sus ingresos y su calidad de vida, es una persona muy trabajadora y esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Los Peregrinos (The Pilgrims) Investment Bank is already in its 3rd loan cycle and is composed of 8 members, 7 women and 1 man. The women are dedicated to commerce and sell clothing, among other things.

Luz is the president of the bank. She was elected because of her responsibility and solidarity with her companions. Luz is separated from her husband. She says it was a difficult moment for her but she has forged ahead for the benefit of her 3 children, all of whom are school age. Luz sells second-hand clothing at the fair in Yungas and also, travels to distant fairs. She lives in her family's house, and her desire is to have her own house. Luz is saving to achieve her desire.

With this loan, she will buy more merchandise and thereby increase her working capital. In this manner, her income and quality of life will be improved. Luz is a very hard-working person and is very grateful to the institution for the help it affords.

loans.use: TO BUY MERCHANDISE (NEW AND SECOND-HAND CLOTHING) AT WHOLESALE

loans.name: Masudi

texts.en:
Masudi is a widowed man with six children, all of whom are adults. He owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food.

He has operated a vegetable stall business for the past four years, selling in a shop to his neighbors and passersby. Masudi faces the major challenge of seasonality in his business. He hopes to own a shop in the future. 

With the Kshs 40,000, he wants to purchase sacks of vegetables for sale. He decided to join Yehu because of its low interest rates.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Tièssiri (Le Courage) Group

texts.fr:
Tièssiri est un regroupement de femmes du quartier Hamdallaye de Koutiala qui se et qui  vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 34 ans, sont toutes mariées et mères d’au moins 3 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels, les habillements,  les fruits et légumes,  les jus de fruits, etc. 
 Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a 3 ans. Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt de groupe et tous les prêts précédents  ont été bien remboursés. 
Fanta S. est un membre du groupe Tièssiri qui vend des jus de fruits de toutes sortes, bien glacés. Elle se fait aider par un employer et quelques fois par ses enfants.  
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, des sacs de sucre, du jujube, des arômes, du dah rouge et toutes sortes d’ingrédients rendant agréables les jus. Elle se procure  de ces ingrédients au grand marché de Koutiala. Elle vend les jus, bien glacés, à la maison,  au marché de Koutiala, devant l’école publique (pendant la recréation),  auprès des gendarmes sur la route de Sikasso. Elle a une clientèle diverse et variée. 
Tandis que les membres du groupe Tièssiri comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 160 000FCFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Fanta S. compte réaliser 200 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
“Tièssiri [courage]" is the name of a group of women from the Hamdallaye district of Koutiala, all of whom live in traditional extended families with their husbands, children and other family members. They are on the average 34 years old, are all married and have at least three children each. The group members sell various items, such as clothing, fruits and vegetables, fruit juice etc.

In order to expand their business, three years ago the group members decided to participate in the credit program of Soro Yiriwaso. They are on their fourth group loan, and all prior loans have been duly repaid.

Fanta S. is one of the Tièssiri group members who sells all kinds of fruit juices, properly chilled. She is helped by a hired assistant and sometimes by her children. She plans to use her loan to purchase bags of sugar, jujube, red bissap [hibiscus], flavors, and various other ingredients that improve the taste of the juice. She sells the juices, properly chilled, out of her home, at the market of Koutiala, in front of the public school (during recess), to the policemen patrolling the road of Sikasso. She has a very diverse and varied customer base. While other members of the Tièsseri group plan to achieve a monthly income of 160,000 West African Francs after this loan, Fanta S. plans to earn 200,000. Apart from repaying the loan, the group members will use part of their revenues towards everyday family expenses.

loans.use: Purchasing ingredienst for preparing fruit juices

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor is a married man with two children, both of whom attend school. He lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

He has operated his restaurant business for the past five years. His potential customers are his neighbors and passersby. Victor faces a major challenge of the high cost of municipal council fees. He hopes to expand and have a big hotel in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000, he wants to purchase furniture for his restaurant to accomondate his customers. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase furniture for his restaurant to accomondate his customers.

loans.name: Lolo Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq membres du groupe LOLO (3 mariés et 1veuve) ont en moyenne 26 ans, 3 enfants et vivent la plupart dans des familles monogames, au quartier BABEMBA, un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur sixième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle, les prêts passés ont été remboursés dans de bonne condition. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de tissus   tel AFOU T.. 
AFOU T.  compte acheter avec son  prêt,  35  pièces de pagnes  wax.
Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Sikasso et à Bamako .
Les pagnes  wax sont revendus au  marché de MEDINE à Sikasso et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 95.000 FCFA utilisée pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
The five members of the Lolo group (3 married women and one widow) average 26 years of age, with three children, and live mostly in monogamous families in the Babemba district of the city of Sikasso (the third administrative region of Mali).

They are on their sixth collaboration cycle with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, their goal being to meet customer demand. The previous loans have been well repaid. This women’s group sells fabrics, as, for example, Afou T. does. 

Afou T. plans to use her loan to purchase 35 sets of traditional “pagnes wax” fabric. She stocks up at the big market of Sikasso and in Bamako.
She resells the “pagnes wax” fabrics  at the Medine market in Sikasso and out of her home, for cash, to a customer base composed of women and men. She plans to achieve an average monthly income of 95,000 West African francs, to be used towards everyday family expenses.
Her goal is to increase her sales volume and better meet customer demand.

loans.use: Purchasing traditional "pagnes" fabrics

loans.name: Djiguisseme  (L’Espoir) [Hope] Group

texts.fr:
Djiguisseme  est un regroupement de femmes du premier quartier de la ville de Koutiala qui vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne  40 ans, sont mariées et mères d’au moins 6 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels, les légumes, les condiments, des poissons fumés et séchés, la restauration, etc. 
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a 3 ans. Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de groupe et tous les prêts précédents  ont été bien remboursés. 
Sineni D. est un membre du groupe qui fait de la restauration et la vente de légumes. Elle prépare du riz, des pâtes alimentaires et de la viande dans un restaurant aménager non loin de son domicile matin et soir. Les ingrédients sont achetés au grand marché de Koutiala et Sineni est très sollicitée. Quand aux légumes, ils sont achetés à Koutiala  et environs et revendus à Bamako au fur et à mesure que la quantité achetée s’épuise. 
Tandis que Les membres du groupe comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 160 000FCFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Sineni D.  compte réaliser 190 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
“Djiguisseme [hope]” is the name of a group of women from the first district of Koutiala, all of whom live in traditional extended families with their husbands, children and other family members. They are on the average 40 years old;  all are married,  with at least six children each. The group members sell various items, such as vegetables, condiments, smoked and dried fish, cooked dishes, etc.

In order to expand their business, three years ago the group members decided to participate in the credit program of Soro Yiriwaso. They are on their fifth group loan, and all prior loans have been duly repaid.

Sineni D.,  one of the  group members, cooks food for sale and also sells vegetables.  She cooks rice, pasta and meat in a diner near her home, mornings and evenings. She buys her ingredients at the big market of Koutiala, and her business is very popular. As to the vegetables, they are bought in Koutiala and in nearby areas and resold in Bamako little by little, until the stock is exhausted. While other members of this group plan to achieve a monthly income of 160,000 West African Francs after this loan, Sineni D. plans to earn 190,000. Apart from repaying the loan, the group members will use part of their revenues towards everyday family expenses.

loans.use: Purchasing vegetables and ingredients for cooking

loans.name: Zadi

texts.es: Zadi, de 40 años, tiene dos hijos que viven con su padre. puesto que es separa y actualmente convive con otra persona.  Durante los dos años de su nueva relación, Zadi se dedica en vender galletas y gaseosa en el cafetín del colegio que se encuentra cerca de su casa. Hoy los alumnos están de vacaciones, es por ello que se dedica en confeccionar polos y prendas deportivas en cantidad, para cuando se inicien las clases poder venderlo, ya que son prendas que necesariamente los alumnos deben comprar. Por ahora este trabajo lo esta desarrollando en el taller  de su amiga; con ello espera aumentar sus ganancias e invertir en el cafetín. A ella le gusta afrontar nuevos retos, por ello piensa a futuro instalar una guardería en casa de su madre, espera poco a poco mejorar su calidad de vida. Es el noveno crédito con MFP, y no quiere dejar de pagar sus cuotas, por ello ve la forma de generarse mayores ingresos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará telas en numerosas cantidades para confeccionar más polos y buzos, para cuando se reinicie las clases.
texts.en: Zadi is 40 years old and she has 2 children and they live with their father. She is separated and she lives with another person. During the two years with her new relationship, Zadi sold cookies and soft drinks from a canteen in a school near her house. Currently students are on holidays and so she makes polo shirts and active wear in bulk, so that when classes resume she will be able to make her sales.  These items of clothing are required to be purchased by students. For now she has used her friend's sewing shop. She will be able to increase her earnings and invest in her canteen.  She likes to set new goals so in the future she wants to set up a day care in her mother's house, with the hopes of improving her life. This is her ninth loan through MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and she won't let her payments go unpaid, which is why she is always looking for better earnings. The loan she requests will be used to purchase large quantities of fabrics to make more polo shirts and jackets for when classes start.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics.

loans.name: Filimon

texts.es: Filimon tiene 53 años, su actividad es brindar el servicio de soldadura y radio técnico. Hace más de 7 años que tiene este negocio, pues con el paso del tiempo ha logrado aprender este medio de vida. El empezó porque tenía que sufragar los gastos del hogar y de sus 2 hijos que están a su cargo, después observo que el negocio era rentable y empezó a trabajar por su propia cuenta. Este crédito solicitado por el señor será invertido en la compra de materiales necesarios en su negocio tiene varios pedidos que necesita suplir, además que su negocio que ha crecido bastante por lo que necesita mayor inversión.
texts.en: Filimon is 53 years old and he provides soldering and radio technician services. He has had this business for more than 7 years. With the passage of time he has learned this trade. He started out because he needed to provide for the needs of his household and those of his 2 children who are in his care. Later he saw that the business was profitable and started to work independently. The loan that was requested will be invested in the purchase of materials he needs for his business. He has a number of orders that he needs to fill and his business has grown significantly, needing a larger investment.

loans.use: To use as working capital.

loans.name: Felix

texts.es: El señor Félix nacido en la ciudad de Chuquisaca soltero se dedica a la agricultura tiene sus tierras en Surutú a 40 km del Torno. Tiene tierras en la provincia Cordillera donde también se dedican a la agricultura ellos siembran en esas tierras maní en cantidad y compro una motosierra para hacer madera para carpintería y así poder ofrecer sus productos a los carpinteros de la localidad, el dinero del crédito comprara una motocicleta para poder transportarse ya que le será de mucha utilidad ya que el estado malo de la carretera no le permite transportarse en auto, es una persona joven con muchas ganas de superación y esta profundamente agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Felix was born in the city of Chuquisaca. He is single and he is an agriculturist who has land in Surutu, about 40 km from Torno. His land is in the province of Cordillera where other agriculturists also harvest the land. He purchased a chainsaw to make wood for carpentry and to be able to offer his products to the carpenters in the region. The funds from this loan will be used to purchase a motorcycle for transportation. It will be very useful for him because the rugged conditions of the roads will not permit vehicles. He is a very young person with a great wish for self-improvement. He is profoundly thankful to the organization for the support given to him.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Amahoro Group

texts.en: Josiane owns a foodstuffs business. She is married to a farmer and they have two children who are between two and five years old. None of her children attend school yet because they are still young. Josiane is the leader of a borrowing group called Amahoro in Kinyarwanda, which means “The Peace” in English. Josiane sells foodstuffs such as beans and sorghum. She has had this business for two years. She will use the loan to add more foodstuffs to sell. With the profits, she will build a house as well as buy cattle to raise. She would like to have 500,000 RWF as a loan amount in the future.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Rosa Elia

texts.es:
la sra. Rosa Elia M. tiene 55 años de edad, vive en la colonia Sagastume de la ciudad capital y se dedica a la venta de zapatos, lociones, cremas, perfumes, ropa de cama y otros productos para dama, su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitacion ahi llegan sus clientes a comprarle, así mismo vende por las mañanas ambulantemente en las colonias vecinas y cuenta con clientes de diferentes empresas privadas y gubernamentales a quienes les da el producto al crédito.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de productos ya que en estos momentos tiene poco inventario.
las ganancias las necesita para cubrir los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosa Elia M. is 55 years old and lives in the Sagastume subdivision within the capital city. She sells shoes, lotions, crèmes, perfumes, bed sheets, and other products for women. Her business is located in her home where her customers come to buy her products. She also sells as a traveling merchant in the neighboring subdivisions and has customers at different private businesses and government entities to whom she offers her products on credit.

This loan will be used to buy products since she has little inventory at the moment. She needs her income to cover her household expenses.

loans.use: Purchase shoes, crèmes, deodorants, perfumes, lotions, bed sheets, and face powders

loans.name: Dativa

texts.en: Dativa is 31 years old. She has three children. The youngest is two years old and the eldest is seven years old. Dativa has a shop where she sells different things like beans, potatoes, tomatoes and many more. She is requesting this loan in order to buy more beans and complete her house repayments. She plans to buy food for her family and renovate her house from the profits she hopes to obtain from this business.

loans.use: To buy more beans and complete her house repayment.

loans.name: Esperance

texts.en: Esperance is 25 years old. She is married and her husband works with her. She has three children; the youngest is one and a half year old  and the eldest is five years old. Two of her children goes to school and one has not begun school yet. Esperance has a butcher and her husband helps her search for goats for sale. Esperance is requesting a loan in order to buy more goats for slaughtering and sell skewered meats. The profits will be used to reinvest in her business of goats.

loans.use: To buy  more goats for slaughtering to sell skewered meats.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es: La señora Cristina tiene 29 años,  posee un hijo menor a su cargo. La señora es dueña de un negocio de venta de ropa nueva, los cuales distribuye de manera ambulante, pese a que también en su casa ofrece la mercadería. Ella inicio con este negocio primeramente trabajando con muy pocos productos, allí comenzó a venderles a sus compañeras de trabajo las mercaderías de ropa hasta que se dio cuenta que el negocio era rentable y decidió dedicarse solamente a esto. Ella viaja a Managua, a comprar las mercancías para distribuirlas luego. Trabaja por pedidos, es decir que cuando tiene una buena cantidad de pedidos es que viaja a comprar. Ella actualmente está solicitando este crédito para invertirlo en la compra de ropa nueva, con el objetivo de ofrecer nueva mercancías y capitalizar su negocio. Su sueño, es que a través de las ganancias ofrecidas por el negocio pueda brindarle una educación universitaria a su hijo.
texts.en: Cristina is 29 years old and she has a young son in her care. She is the owner of a business from where she sells new clothing, distributing her merchandise itinerantly; although she also sells form her house. She started out this business with very few products. But she started out selling to her colleagues at work and soon she discovered that it is a very profitable business. She decided to dedicate her time exclusively to this business. She travels to Managua to purchase merchandise for later resale. She takes orders and when she has accumulated enough orders she travels to make her purchases. The loan she requests will be invested in the purchase of new clothing, with the goal of selling new articles of clothing and to capitalize in her business. It is her dream to provide a university education to her son with the earnings from her business.

loans.use: To use as working capital.

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en: Rukia was born in 1972. She has five children. The youngest is four months old and the eldest is 18 years old. Rukia sells goats and she is requesting a loan to buy more goats. She plans to pay her children’s school fees with the profits she hopes to make.

loans.use: To Buy more goats to sell.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 35 years old. She has seven children; the youngest is seventeen months old, and the eldest is fifteen years old. She is married, her husband is a farmer, and they are proud of meeting their family's needs.

Mariam has a hair salon and has been in this business for four years. She is requesting a loan in order to buy more hair products. She hopes to use her profits to buy food for her family and pay her children school fees.

loans.use: To buy more hair products to sell

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 72 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo y su 3 hijos,  de los 6 que son en total. Después de haberse dedicado varios años a la atención en su tienda de productos comestibles, tuvo que cerrar el negocio; pues ya no le era rentable. Desde entonces empezó con la comercialización de artefactos electrodomésticos con la ayuda de su hijo mayor. Sin embargo la desalojaron y desde ahí trabaja de manera ambulatoria en una avenida céntrica de su distrito. Ahora le va muy bien y para obtener mayores ganancias, compra su mercadería en un mercado informal, pues les ofrecen a precios más accesibles, así es como gana mayores utilidades por cada artefacto. Lo que más le gusta de su negocio son las buenas ganancias que percibe, pero le incomodo la incomodidad de vender en la calle, por ello anhela comprarse su propio puesto en algún mercado. Es el 34avo crédito con MFP, como es socia antiguo de su grupo comunal, se siente agradecido por todo el apoyo que recibe, así como también de las personas que hicieron posible en brindarle el préstamo, aporte que le permite continuar trabajando sin problemas. De obtener el crédito que solicita, comprará ollas arroceras, ollas a presión, licuadoras y planchas, para bastecer los pedidos pendientes.
texts.en:
Rosa is 72 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and three of her six children. After devoting several years to managing a grocery store, Rosa decided to close this business because it was no longer profitable. From that point she began selling household appliances with the help of her oldest son. After being evicted, she began selling as a street vendor along the central avenue of the district. Rosa is now doing very well and able to generate more income. She buys her merchandise at an informal market because the prices are more affordable, which allows her to make more profit on each item. What she enjoys most about her business is the good revenue she is able to generate, but selling on the street can be uncomfortable so she hopes to acquire her own post at a market.

This is her 34th loan with MFP since she is a longtime member of her Communal Bank. Rosa feels grateful for the all the support she has received and expresses her gratitude to everyone who made this loan possible, which allows her to continue working without problems. With the requested loan she will be able to buy rice cookers, pressure cookers, blenders, and irons so that she can fulfill her outstanding orders.

loans.use: Purchase household appliances

loans.name: Clemantine

texts.en:
Clemantine has five children; ,the youngest is two years the oldest is eight years old. All of her children are in school, and her husband is a motorcyclist.

Clemantine sells spare parts for bicycles. she has been in this business for two years.She plans to use the loan to buy more bicycle spare parts to sell.  Her business has helped make it possible for her children go to school and for her to make savings from the profits she obtains from her business.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es: El señor Daniel se dedica al transporte de servicio publico trabaja en una  línea de taxi trufi, vive en casa de sus padres tiene un hijo de meses de edad el señor anteriormente trabajaba en un radio taxi con el dinero dle credito comprara llantas para vehículo y mantenimiento del vehículo, y ahora se compró una línea de taxi y con esta herramienta genera ingresos para el y su familia su esposa tiene una tienda de barrio en su domicilio y de alguna forma también ayuda a la manutención de su familia,  en  un futuro no muy lejano esta familia pretende comprarse un lote y hacer construir su casita propia para independizarse de sus papas y de esta forma vivir solos, es un joven con muchas ganas de superación y esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sr. Daniel works as part of a taxi fleet providing public transportation services. He lives at his parents’ house and has a son who is a few months old. This gentleman previously worked with a radio taxi and used the money from a loan to buy tires for the vehicle and pay for maintenance. He now has a fleet taxi that he bought and uses the vehicle to generate income for himself and his family. His wife has a neighborhood store in their home and also helps with supporting their family. In the near future, this family intends to buy a lot and build a house so that they can become independent from his parents and live by themselves.

Daniel is a young man who is eager to improve and grateful to Emprender for the support that has been provided.

loans.use: Purchase tires & pay for vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
la sra. Veronica L. E. tiene 38 años de edad, vive en la colonia sagastume de la ciudad capital y se dedica a la elabracion de vestidos, pantalones, blusas, sacos, trajes, etc. pero su fuerte es la fabricacion de vestidos para 15 años y vestidos para bodas, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitacion.
tiene muchas clientes fijas que les elabora Trajes formales para trabajar, Veronica es muy conocida en su colonia y muchas clientes por el buen acabado de sus prendas la recomiendan.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de materiales para la fabricacion de las prendas.
las ganancias las necesita para cubrir los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Sra. Veronica L. E. is 38 years old and lives in the Sagastume subdivision of the capital city. She makes dresses, trousers, blouses, jackets, suits, and other garments. Her specialty is making dresses, which she has done for 15 years, including wedding dresses. Veronica’s business is located in her home. She has several established customers for whom she makes formal suits for work. Veronica is well-known in her subdivision and has many customers who recommend the good design of her garments.

This loan will be used to buy materials for making garments. She needs the income to cover her household expenses.

loans.use: Purchase fabric, thread, lace, trimming, veils, decorations, buttons, sponges, and cardboard

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Kare Amandi

texts.es:
la sra. Kare Amandi G. tiene 27 años de edad y se dedica la fabricacion de collares, pulseras y aritos.
su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitación en la colonia Sagastume. Kare elabora aritos, cadenas, pulseras con materiales de plata, acrílico, piedras de rio y piedras finas, tiene tres distribuidoras a quienes les elabora el producto y ellas se encargan de venderlo, así mismo cuenta con clientes fijos.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de materiales, accesorios, plata, perlas.
las ganancias las necesita para salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Kare Amandi G. is 27 years old and makes necklaces, bracelets, and earrings. Her business is located in her home in the Sagastume subdivision. Kare makes earrings, necklaces, and bracelets out of silver, acrylic, river stones, and precious stones. She has three distributors who make the product and are responsible for selling them. Kare has established customers.

This loan will be used to buy materials, accessories, silver, and pearls. She needs the income to move her family forward.

loans.use: Purchase materials, accessories, silver, and pearls

loans.name: Karla Vanessa

texts.es:
la sra. Karla M. es una mujer muy responsable, honrada y dedicada a su trabajo propio, el cual es la elaboracion y venta de rosquillas, vende su producto a varios negocios de su misma comunidad ya que le hacen pedidos todas las semanas y tambien hace entregas en la frontera del Espino, ahi tiene una gran cantidad de  
personas que le compran sus rosquillas, esto hace que su negocio tenga muy buena demanda.
Karla todos los dias se levanta a las 3 de la mañana para poder sacer todos los pedidos que le hacen durante todas las semanas, cuenta con el apoyo de su mama para la elaboracion de las rosquillas.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de maiz, leña, queso y manteca para tener una mayor produccion de rosquillas y asi tener mas ganancias las cuales las necesita para salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Karla M. is a very responsible and honest woman who is dedicated to her work of making and selling cookies. She sells her product to various businesses in her community that place orders every week. Karla also makes deliveries along the Espino border where there are a great number of people who buy cookies, creating great demand for her business.

Karla wakes up every day at 3am so that she can move forward with all of the orders that she must complete throughout the week. She has the help of her mother with making the cookies. This loan will be used to buy corn, firewood, cheese, and butter so that she can increase her production of cookies and generate more income needed to move her family forward.

loans.use: Purchase corn, cheese, butter, and firewood

loans.name: Blanca Azucena

texts.es:
la señora Blanca M. tiene 44 años de edad, vive en el Barrio San Francisco de San Marcos, Blanca se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas, actividad que realiza en su casa de habitacion.
Blanca vende su producto a todas las personas de su barrio en donde vive y al mismo tiempo le entrega a varios comedores del centro de la ciudad de San Marcos.
Blanca todos los dias se levanta muy temprano para poder producir toda la demanda que tiene y quedar bien con todos sus clientes.
su meta es seguir de esta manera e ir creciendo como microempresaria y poder sacar adelante a su hogar.
texts.en:
Sra. Blanca M. is 44 years old and lives in the neighborhood of San Francisco de San Marcos. Blanca produces and sells tortillas, a business that she runs out of her home.

She sells her products to everyone in the neighborhood where she lives. At the same time, she delivers to different diners located in the central part of the city of San Marcos. Blanca wakes up early every day so that she can produce enough to meet demand and keep all of her customers happy.

Her goals include keeping her small business growing and moving her household forward.

loans.use: Purchase corn, firewood, lime, water, and matches

loans.name: Camino Seguro Group

texts.es:
Liz Verónica, con 30 años D. edad, soltera, forma parte del grupo “Caminos Seguro” formado por 10 integrantes todos ellos residentes del distrito D. Comas.
Hace tres meses se dedica a  la venta D. productos farmacéuticos en su propia botica. Inició el negocio animada por una hermana D. la iglesia. Gracias a éste  negocio y con  mucho trabajo, esfuerzo y sacrificios,  llego a tener su propia Botica llamada “Santa María”. 
Sus metas son: tener su propia casa, crecer profesionalmente, ser una empresaria D. éxito y salir adelante en su negocio. 
El préstamo solicitado lo invertirá en la compra D. medicamentos para aumentar su stock. 

Observacion: La foto pequeña corresponD. a la Señora Carmen G. Z.

Una D. las socias va acompañada D. un familiar, es el señor D. camiseta blanca que se encuentra en la parte posterior.
texts.en:
Liz Verónica, 30, is single and a member of “Camino Seguro” (Safe Road) group which has 10 members, all residents of Comas district.

She has been selling pharmaceuticals in her own drug store for the last three months.  She started the business encouraged by a sister at church.  Thanks to the business, with much work, effort and sacrifice, she has managed to own her own drug store called “Santa María.”

Her goals are:  to have a house of her own, to grow professionally, to be a successful businesswoman and to have her business succeed.
 
She will use the loan to buy medicines to increase her stock.

One of the members is accompanied by a family member.

loans.use: To buy medicines for her business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María tiene 28 años, hace pocos meses se ha casado, ahora vive con su esposo en casa de sus suegros. Ella tiene como profesión la de docente de nivel primaria, pero desde hace 2 años ha visto conveniente elaborar trabajos didácticos que son vendidos a sus alumnos y al de otras aulas. Es así que su tiempo lo distribuye, por la mañanas se dedica a la docencia y por la tardes se dedica a la venta de estos materiales didácticos. Le gusta este negocio, pues le ha generado buenas rentas, sin mayor esfuerzo, además que le gusta mucho armar figuras y cuanto más grandes es mejor su trabajo. En estos dos años de experiencia; ya es muy conocida por los alumnos y en adelante desea construir su casa propia, ya que se ha comprado su terreno. Es el 8avo crédito con MFP, y se ha comprometido en  pagar sus cuotas puntualmente pues quiere acceder posteriores ayudas para continuar progresando. Mary tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de materiales que necesita como: corrospum, tecnopord, pinceles y plumones, que necesita para continuar en su negocio sin problemas.
texts.en:
María is 28 years old and was married a few months ago. She now lives with her husband at the home of her in-laws. María is an elementary school teacher by profession, but for the past two years she has been making educational materials that she sells to her students and to other schools. Her time is devoted to teaching in the mornings and then selling educational materials in the afternoons. She enjoys this business because it has generated good profits without great effort. In addition, she likes assembling large figures which is the best part of the job. With two years of experience, María has become well-known among the students and would like to move forward by building her own house since she has already purchased the land.

This is her eighth loan with MFP. She promises to submit her payments on time because she wants to access subsequent loans so that she can continue making progress. María plans to invest the loan in the purchase of materials such as craft plastic, Styrofoam, brushes, and markers because she needs to continue her business without problems.

loans.use: Purchase craft plastic, Styrofoam, brushes, and markers for making educational materials

loans.name: Ruth Mercedes

texts.es: Ruth tiene 36 años, Su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general, hace más de 6 años que tiene este negocio. Tiene 3 hijos a su cargo menores de edad, Ruth ha demostrado ser una persona muy trabajadora. Esta no es la primera vez que realiza un financiamiento pues son de mucha ayuda para sacar adelante su negocio y así proporcionarles a sus clientes lo que ellos le solicitan. El crédito que solicito es para la compra de calzado, ropa en general, cosméticos y otros productos.
texts.en:
Ruth is 36 years old and has been selling general merchandise for more than six years. She has three young children. Ruth has proven that she is a hard worker. This is not the first time she has received funding since it has been a great help in moving her business forward and providing her customers with what they request.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy shoes, general clothing, cosmetics, and other products.
