loans.use: Operating capital to buy merchandise

loans.name: Teodoro Silvestre

texts.es: Teodoro tiene 53 años con 3 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. Su actividad es venta de productos lácteos, por lo que él siempre está buscando la forma de salir adelante ya que tiene una familia que mantener, cuando el inicio este trabajo no tenía suficiente capital de trabajo, pero con la ayuda y la confianza que ha logrado alcanzar sus objetivos. Es así que decide realizar un financiamiento destinado para la compra de cuajada, crema, leche, queso y leche agria. Su deseo es seguir trabajando duro para proporcionarles a sus hijos estudios.
texts.en:
Teodoro is 53 years old and has three dependent children in his care. He engages in the sale of dairy products and is always looking for ways to get ahead since he has a family to support. When he started working he did not have enough operating capital, but with help and trust Teodoro has been able to achieve his goals.

He has decided to use this loan to buy curds, cream, milk, cheese, and sour milk. Teodoro hopes to continue working hard so that he can provide for his children’s education.

loans.use: Purchase curds, cream, milk, cheese, and sour milk

loans.name: Guillermo Jose

texts.es: Guillermo casado, hombre trabajador de oficio técnico en cocina, sus hijos le ayudan enviándole mensualmente una mesada, la infraestructura de su vivienda es unos de los principales planes a corto plazo que realizara gracias al apoyo que tiene de Afodenic, recibe pensión mensual. El prestamos era invertido en la compra de materiales de construcción como. Cemento, hierro, arena, piedra, piedrín entre otros materiales para la construcción de una pared la cual se obtendrá seguridad y protección.
texts.en:
Guillermo is married.  He’s a hard working man employed as a kitchen helper.  His children help out sending him a monthly allowance.

His dwelling’s infrastructure is one of his main short term plans that he will accomplish thanks to the help he gets from Afodenic.  He receives a monthly pension.

The loan will be invested in the purchase of building materials like: cement, iron rods, sand, stone and gravel among other materials to build a wall that will provide security and protection.

loans.use: To buy materials.

loans.name: William Xavier

texts.es: William tiene 33 años. Se dedica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 5 años que tiene experiencia en su negocio, por lo que es un hombre muy responsable y disfruta de su actividad. William sabe que tiene que levantarse temprano para ofrecerles a sus clientes una gran variedad de productos, el recorrido que realiza es de manera ambulante ya que es así que obtiene mas ganancias. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de  calzado, cosméticos, ropa en general entre otras cosas.
texts.en:
William is 33 years old and has been selling general merchandise for more than five years. He is a very responsible gentleman who enjoys his work. William knows that he must wake up early so that he can offer his customers a wide variety of products. He travels a route as a street vendor so that he can generate the most income.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy shoes, cosmetics, general clothing, and other items.

loans.use: Operating capital to buy merchandise

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” AHORRO ES PROGRESO – SAYLLA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Saylla, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Eufemia; ella tiene 62 años de edad, casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia tiene su negocio de  chicharronería plato hecho a base de chancho, la socia lleva años en este negocio ya que mediante este la socia saca a su familia adelante hasta el día de hoy y se siente feliz ya que mediante este trabajo le trae muchas satisfacciones una de ellas económicas, la socia es una persona bien alegre y con muchas ganas de seguir adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de más insumos para su negocio como mote, papa, aceite, carne de chancho entre otros más.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the Ahorro es Progreso - Saylla Communal Bank. The bank is located in the Saylla District, which is part of the province and department of Cusco.

Eufemia is 62 years old, married, and has three children. She has a ‘chicharronería’, a place selling pork-based dishes. She has been in this business for years and it is how she gets her family ahead in life, including now. She is happy because the job brings her a great deal of satisfaction, including financial satisfaction. She is very cheerful person who has a lot of desire to continue moving forward.

She is requesting the loan for the purchase of more food items for her business like corn, potatoes, oil, pork, and other products.

She is happy for the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: To purchase more food items for her business like corn, potatoes, oil, pork, and other products

loans.name: El Zapote 3 Group

texts.es:
el grupo el zapote 3 esta integrado por 4 mujeres las cuales tienen mucho tiempo de conocerse, son amigas y vecinas de la misma comunidad, a continuacion se detallan las diferentes actividades que ellas realizan:

doña Angela O. se dedica a la venta de granos basicos (frijoles, maiz, arroz) en su casa de habitacion en el caserio el Zapote del Triunfo Choluteca, tiene 5 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad.
ademas cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo y trabajan duro para sacar adelante su familia,  Angela es madre de 3 hijos y en sus tiempos libres visitan la iglesia.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de granos basicos.
 
la joven lizhet del Carmen O. se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas en su casa de habitacion, es soltera y cuenta con la ayuda de sus padres.
Lizhet todos los dias se levanta a las 4 de la mañana para elaborar sus ricas tortillas, las que vende en su comunidad. en sus tiempos libres visita la iglesia.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de maiz, leña, cal y agua. para tener una mayor produccion de tortillas.

doña Blanca Luz O. se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular tiene una pequeña pulperia en su casa de habitacion.
Blanca es madre de 4 hijos, junto con su esposo trabajan duro para sacar adelante a su hijos.
en sus ratos libres cria gallinas y cerdos.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar abarroteria para surtir su pulperia.

doña Deysi Isabel V. tiene una pulperia en su casa de habitacion, Deysi es madre de 5 hijos los cuales 
los tiene estudiando en la escuela de su comunidad, sus tiempos libres lo dedica a visitar a su demas familiares.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia para surtir su pulperia.
texts.en:
The 'El Zapote 3' group has 4 female members who have known each other for a long time.  They are friends and also neighbors who live in the same neighborhood.  Below we will provide details about the different business activities that they carry out:

Angela O. sells basic grains (beans, corn and rice) from her home in the village of Zapote del Triunfo, Choluteca.  She has been in this business for 5 years.  She also has her husband's help and they both work hard to get their family ahead.  Angela has three children and in their spare time they go to church.  She will use her loan to buy basic grains.

Young Lizhet del Carmen O. makes and sells tortillas from her home.  She is single and able to count on help from her parents.  Lizhet gets up at 4.00am every day in order to prepare the delicious tortillas that she sells in her neighborhood.  In her spare time she goes to church.  She will use her loan to buy corn, firewood, lime and water in order to produce more tortillas.

Blanca Luz O. sells convenience store items from her small grocery store which is located in her home. Blanca has 4 children and, together with her husband, she works hard to get her children ahead.  In her spare time she raises hens and pigs.  She will use her loan to buy groceries for her grocery store.

Deysi Isabel V. owns a small grocery store which is located in her home.  Deysi has 5 children who attend a local school.  In her spare time she visits other family members.  She will use her loan to buy merchandise to stock her grocery store.

loans.use: To buy beans, rice, sugar, butter, oil, soup, pasta, soft drinks, juice, corn, firewood, lime, water, wheat flour, soap, batteries, candles and matches.baterias, candelas, fosforos,

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Hilda Maria

texts.es:
Hilda madre soltera trabajo como domestica con mucho esfuerzo ha ido mejorando su vivienda pero le falta algunas partes de la casa ya que por falta de financiamiento no ha podrido construirlas y mejorarlas. 
El préstamo lo está solicitando para la compra de materiales de construcción como: cemento, hierro, piedra, bloque, arena, piedrín, clavo de acero, estribos, alambre de amarre entre otros materiales.  Agradece a la financiera por su apoyo al desarrollo social y el  beneficio que obtendrá de seguridad y comodidad.
texts.en:
Hilda is a single mother and is a domestic worker. With a lot of effort she has been improving her housing but still needs to work on parts of the house. For lack of financing she has not been able to build and make improvements to those sections.
The loan she is requesting is to buy construction materials, such as cement, iron, stone, cinderblock, sand, gravel, steel nails, supports, wire and others materials. She is grateful to the financial institution for supporting social development and for the benefit she will receive in security and comfort.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Miguel Guillermo

texts.es:
El señor Miguel Guillermo T. R. vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos, ellos tienen 16 años de vivir en si hogar. El señor Miguel Guillermo labora en una agencia aduanal en el puesto de despachador, el ya tiene un poco mas de diez años trabajando ahí y percibe muy buenos ingresos los cuales son necesarios para mantener a su familia.
Don  Miguel Guillermo está solicitando un préstamo para terminar los acabados del exterior de la casa   
Estas mejoras a su vivienda permitirán que el señor Miguel Guillermo y su familia puedan vivir más cómodamente.
Esta agradecido por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual podo terminar el cuarto y el baño de sus hijos.  Espera contar nuevamente con su cooperación en este préstamo.
texts.en:
Miguel Guillermo T. R. lives with his wife and two children.  They have lived in their home for 16 years.  Miguel Guillermo works for a customs agency as a dispatcher.  He has been working there for a little over ten years and he makes a very good wage which he needs to support his family.

Miguel Guillermo is requesting this loan to finish off some work to the outside of his home.  These home improvements will allow him and his family to live more comfortably.  He is grateful for Kiva lenders' cooperation in his previous loan which allowed him to finish off his children's room and bathroom.  He hopes that he will be able to count on your cooperation again with this loan.

loans.use: To finish off some work to the outside of his home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To meet immediate business expenses, such as payroll etc.

loans.name: Patrick Gerald

texts.en:
Patrick Gerald A. is fifty-one years old and married. He owns a tailoring shop in which he makes and repairs clothes for ladies, gents, and children. His business is located at Ondieki Estate near Kisumu Social Hall and is well-known as Lucky Tailoring.

Patrick has been in business for fourteen years now and has two employees. His business is profitable, but his major challenge is financial constraints. He works very hard to keep his business doing well. He plans to use his loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy more materials and a sewing machine so he can grow his business and meet the demands of his customers. He also sees himself opening a college to impart skills to others. He describes himself as very focused, determined, and innovative.

loans.use: To buy materials and a sewing machine

loans.name: Rosa  Maria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” AHORRO ES PROGRESO – SAYLLA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Saylla, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Rosa María; ella tiene 43 años de edad, viuda y tiene 2 hijos; La socia tiene su negocio de un hostal ,la socia lleva poco tiempo en este negocio pero le va muy bien , a la vez la socia es profesora del nivel primario en el Colegio Nacional Miguel Grau en Cusco ella trabaja de lunes a viernes desde las 07:00 am hasta las 02:00pm , la socia está feliz ya que tiene otro negocio aparte de su trabajo eso le hace sentir bien ya que mediante estos dos trabajos ella saca a su familia adelante  

La socia solicita el préstamo para la implementación de su hostal como colchones y camas para así poder brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Rosa María, 43, is a member of the ”AHORRO ES PROGRESO – SAYLLA” (Savings Mean Progress-Saylla) communal bank located in Saylla district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

She is a widow and has two children.  She has a boardinghouse.  She’s been in this business a short time but is doing well.  At the same time, she is an elementary school teacher at Cusco’s Colegio Nacional Miguel Grau.  She works Monday through Friday from 7am until 2pm.  She is happy because she has an additional business besides her employment and this makes her feel good because the two jobs allow her to support her family.

She is asking for funding to equip her boardinghouse with mattresses and beds to provide better customer service.

She is happy about the loan and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To equip her boardinghouse with items like mattresses and beds to provide better customer service.

loans.name: Concepcion Del Socorro

texts.es:
Concepción soltera, mujer emprendedora estudio como carrera técnica la costura así se ha ido superando al pasar de los años tiene su propio negocio es un taller de costura y vende ropa y accesorios, tiene como planes mejora la infraestructura de su vivienda.  Encuentra dificultades en el campo laboral cuando se enferma ya que baja el trabajo e igual los ingreso.  
Alcanzado clientes de diferentes puntos de la capital por su excelente trabajo. El préstamo que solicita será invertido en la compra de materias primas como: tela, hilos, botones, chinelas, copas, zipper entre otros materiales. Aumentado sus ingresos mejorando su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Concepcion, an enterprising single woman who studied the technical career of dressmaking, has been forging ahead over the years. She has her own business, a dressmaking shop where she sells clothes and accessories. Among her plans are improvement of the infrastructure of her home. Concepcion has encountered work difficulties when she fell ill and her work diminished as did her income. 

Concepcion has reached customers in different parts of the capital by means of her excellent work. The loan she requests will be invested in buying primary materials, such as cloth, thread, buttons, slippers, cups, among other materials. Augmenting her income will better her standard of living.

loans.use: TO BUY PRIMARY MATERIALS FOR MAKING SCHOOL UNIFORMS

loans.name: Haydee

texts.es: Haydee, es una mujer tímida pero trabajadora de 31 años; junto a su esposo Hernán, cuidan de sus 2 hijos: Hilder y Melina, en armonía, ellos viven en su casa propia ubicada en el caserío de Patay. El trabajo al que se dedica, es la agricultura, sus principales sembríos constan de arveja, papa y flor, por lo que tiene 12 años de experiencia en este rubro. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cortar las flores de papa, ya que es señal de una pronta cosecha. La dedicación que le brinda a sus terrenos agrícolas le permiten obtener buenas ganancias en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma, lugar donde comercializa sus productos; pero las flores de gladiolo los vende en el mercado central de la capital del país. Sus planes son sembrar flor de gladiolo y mantener en buenas condiciones su plantación de habas para que le proporcione buenos frutos en la temporada de cosecha. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los Picaflores de Patay”, y esté es el séptimo crédito con MFP, donde obtiene buenas experiencias para la mejora de sus sembríos. Haydee, cosechó flor de gladiolo, por ello con el dinero del préstamo desea comprar una bolsa de semilla de arveja, los cuales esparcirá en sus terrenos agrícolas.
texts.en:
Haydee is a timid but hard working, 31 year old, woman who together with her husband, Hernán, cares for their two children, Hilder and Melina, in harmony.  They live in their own house located in Patay.

She is a farmer.  Her main crops are pea, potato and flowers.  She has 12 years’ experience in this line of work.  What she likes best is cutting the potato flowers because this is a sign that harvest is near.  The care she gives to her fields allows her to obtain good profits at the city of Tarma’s wholesale market, the place where she sells her products.  However, she sells the gladiolas at the central market in the nation’s capital city. Her plans are to plant gladiola flowers and keep her lima bean crops in good conditions so that good results will be produced during harvest time.

She is a member of the “Los Picaflores de Patay” (Patay Hummingbirds) communal bank and this is the 7th loan with MFP where she obtains good experiences to improve her crops.  Haydee harvested gladiolas and wants to use the loan money to buy a sack of pea seeds to spread among her fields.

loans.use: To buy a sack of pea seeds.

loans.name: Dolores Aleyda

texts.es:
Dolores madre soltera, mujer emprendedora de profesión maestra y tiene ventas de fritanga en su casa, su planes es que su hijo se prepare. Requiere de mejoras en su vivienda ya que la seguridad es de prioridad. Ha tenido dificultades para lograr que la infraestructura de su casa este completamente. Con el préstamo será invertido en compra de materiales de construcción: cemento, hierro, laminas de zinc, tabla, alambre de amarre. Para la construcción de un cuarto, cambio de zinc y reforzar las paredes.
Agradece a la institución por fomentar el desarrollo de oportunidades para mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Dolores is a single mother.  She’s an enterprising woman who is a teacher by profession.  She also sells fast food from home.  Her plan is that her son prepares himself.

Her home is in need of some repairs because safety is a priority.  She has had some difficulty in completing her house’s infrastructure.

The loan will be invested in buying building materials and supplies:  cement, iron rods, zinc metal sheeting, lumber and fastening wire to build a room, replace the zinc metal and strengthen walls.

She thanks the institution for encouraging development of opportunities to improve living standards.

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Bersella

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” AHORRO ES PROGRESO – SAYLLA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Saylla, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Bersella; ella tiene 31 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja en una chicharroneria hace ya un par de años atrás, ahora la socia desea poder aperturar su propio negocio de venta de chicharrones plato hecho a base de chancho ,la socia ya aprendió la sason y la administración y desea ahora hacerlo ella misma con su propio negocio para de esta manera poder darle una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo y familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la implementación de su propio negocio de venta de chicharrones.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Bersella, 31, is a member of the "AHORRO ES PROGRESO–SAYLLA” (SAVINGS MEAN PROGRESS-SAYLLA) communal bank located in Saylla district which belongs to Cusco province, Cusco department.

She has a live-in spouse and a son.  She has worked in a chicharronería (fried pork rind shop) for a couple of years now and she’d like to open her own chicharrón, a product based on pork, sales business.  She’s learned how to season and prepare it and how to run the business so now would like to do it herself with her own business to provide a better quality of life for her son and family.

She needs the loan to set up her own chicharrón sales business.

She is happy with the loan and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To start her own business selling fried pork rinds.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
la joven Margarita E. H. es una mujer emprendedora que se dedica a la fabricacion de  ropa casual y  ropa escolar, todos los dias se levanta a las 5 de la mañana para ponerse a fabricar su ropa, Margarita es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos bien pequeños, nada mas cuenta con la ayuda de sus papas.
su negocio lo tiene instalado en su casa de habitacion en la colonia Sagrado Corazon.
sus tiempos libres se los dedica a jugar con sus hijos y visitar la iglesia.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de materiales de fabricar los uniformes y trajes, ya viene la epoca escolar y necesita estar preparada para poder cubrir con todos los pedidos que le hagan.
texts.en:
Margarita E. H. is an enterprising young woman who manufactures casual and school clothes. 

She rises every morning at five to start making her clothes.  Margarita is a single mother of three, very young children.  She gets help only from her parents.

Her business is in her home which is in the Sagrado Corazón neighborhood.

During her free time she plays with her children and goes to church.

She will use the loan to buy materials to make uniforms and outfits.  The school term is approaching and she needs to be prepared to fill all the orders she will get.

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread, lace, foam, buttons, zippers, rulers and sewing machine parts.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “AHORRO ES PROGRESO - SAYLLA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Saylla, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Miguel; el tiene 26 años de edad y es conviviente  y tiene 1 hijo; el socio trabaja en una chicharroneria hace una par de años atrás el cual le gusta mucho y  le brinda varias satisfacciones y alegrías pero ahora el socio desea independizarse abriendo su propio negocio de venta de chicharrones( plato a base de chancho) y de esta manera el poder crecer más como negociante y poder trabajar para el mismo y así poder tener un poco mas de ingresos para su familia el socio es una persona bien alegre y de esta forma el saca a su familia adelante.

El socio solicita el préstamo para la implementación de su propio negocio venta de chicharrones como mesas, sillas, e insumos para la preparación de los chicharrones.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Miguel belongs to the “Ahorro Es Progresso – Saylla” (Saving is Progress - Saylla) Communal Bank.  The bank is locted in the Saylla district, which is in the Cusco province, Cusco department.

Miguel, age 26, is in a common-law-marriage and has one child.  He has worked in a “chicharroneria” (restaurant that serves pork) for a couple of years.  He likes it a lot, and it gives him much satisfaction and joy.  But, he now wants to become independent by opening his own business selling chicarrones (a pork based dish). 

This way he will be able to grow more as a business man, and he will be able to work for himself.  That way he will have a little more income for his family.  He is a very happy person, and that is how he gets his family ahead.

He is requesting the loan to buy things for his new business of selling chicharrones.  He will buy things like tables and chairs.  He will also buy supplies for making the chicharrones.

He is very happy about the loan, and he pledges to make all of his payments.

loans.use: To set up his own business selling chicharrones.  He will get things like tables, chairs and supplies to make the chicharrones

loans.name: Manos Forjadoras Group

texts.es:
América, tiene 54 años D. edad, viuda, tiene 5 hijos, vive en la zona D. Puquio, distrito D. Comas. Hace 8 meses forma parte del grupo “Manos Forjadoras”, formado por 10 integrantes. 
Se dedica a la venta D. comida, DesD. muy joven ha sido muy trabajadora.
Inicio su negocio por sí sola, con pequeñas ventas que hacía en su casa, y así con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio ha logrado tener su propio restaurant, y pagar los estudios D. sus hijos. 
Su anhelo es ser una empresaria  exitosa, que su negocio sea reconocido y sus hijos sean profesionales D. éxito. 
Con el préstamo solicitado desea invertir en su negocio en la compra D. insumos y  menaje.
texts.en:
América, 54, is a widow with five children.  She lives in the Puquio zone, Comas district.  She has been a member of the “Manos Forjadoras” (Forging Hands) group, which has 10 members, for 8 months.

She sells food.  She has been very hard working since a very young age.  She started the business on her own with small sales from home.  Thus, with much effort and sacrifice she has managed to have her own restaurant and pay for her children’s education.

Her wish is to be a successful businesswoman, that the business is well known and that her children become successful professionals.

She will use the requested loan to invest in the business buying ingredients and kitchenware.

loans.use: To buy ingredients and kitchenware.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” AHORRO ES PROGRESO – SAYLLA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Saylla, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maribel; ella tiene 35 años de edad, casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en una chicharroneria cerca de su casa a la socia le gusta mucho este tipo de negocio el cual ya sabe cómo administrarlo a raíz de eso es que la socia desea a perturar su propio negocio trabajar para ella y no para otros desea empezar ahora y de esta manera seguir haciendo lo que le gusta pero de forma independiente para así poder brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos y familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la implementación de su propio negocio como mesas y sillas y otras cosas más  que le faltan.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Maribel, 35, is a member of the “AHORRO ES PROGRESO-SAYLLA” (Savings Means Progress-Saylla) communal bank located in Saylla district which belongs to Cusco province, Cusco department.

She is married and has three children.  She works in a chicharronería (fried pork shop) near her house.  She likes this type of business very much and already knows how to run it.  Because of this she wants to open her own shop so that she can work for herself and not for others starting now to do what she likes but independently to provide a better quality of life for her children and family.

She requests the loan to set up her own business with tables, chairs and other items she needs.

She is happy with the loan and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: She needs the loan to set up her own business with tables, chairs and several other items she needs.

loans.name: Alida

texts.es: Alida, es una mujer trabajadora de 23 años, que convive con Percy. Ambos tiene 3 hijos: María, Cris y Yamile. En armonía ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Patay. Hace 5 años y en compañía de su esposo, comenzó a incursionar en la agricultura, su principal actividad económica, es así que desde las primeras horas del día, Alida cuida de sus cultivos de papa, arveja y flor de gladiolo. Lo que más le gusta a ella son los momentos de la merienda, pues ahí puede pasar un tiempo agradable con su familia; pero lo que más le satisface es vender su producción en el mercado mayorista de Tarma. Por otro lado, se dedica también al arado de la tierra con ayuda de 2 toros que poseen, pero ahora desea mejorar sus sembríos, pues los planes que tienen es sembrar arvejas en gran cantidad. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Picaflores de Patay”, y esté es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde gusta compartir momentos de aprendizaje en cada reunión que asume con su asociación. Alida, cosechará flor de gladiolo, puesto que dentro de poco empezará las festividades, es por ello que con el crédito comprará varios sacos de abono orgánico, para esparcirlos entre sus sembríos y así obtener una buena producción.
texts.en:
Alida is a hard-working 23 year-old woman who lives with her partner Percy.  They have 3 children: María, Cris and Yamile, and they live together peacefully in their own home which is located in the village of Patay. 

Five years ago, together with her husband, Alida started working in agriculture as her main business activity.  Starting very early in the morning, Alida cares for her potato, pea and gladioli plants.  Alida's favorite time of day is tea time as this is when she is able to spend a pleasant time together with her family.  What also makes her happy is selling her produce in the wholesale market in Tarma.

Alida plows her land with the help of two oxen that she owns.  Right now, however, she would like to improve her crops.  She has plans to sow peas in large quantities.

Alida belongs to the "Picaflores de Patay" (Patay Hummingbirds) community bank and this is her fourth loan from MFP.  Alida likes spending time learning in each of the association's meetings she attends.  She will harvest her gladioli flowers soon since festivities are due to start shortly.  For this reason, she will use her loan money to buy several sacks of organic fertilizer to spread on her crops, thereby ensuring a good production.

loans.use: To buy sacks of organic fertilizer

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MUJERES EN ACCION”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Anta, perteneciente a la provincia D. Anta y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Gregoria; ella tiene 61 años D. edad y es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. venta D. queso y también se dedica a la agricultura, la socia tiene un pequeño terreno donD. cultiva maíz, papa y verduras, la socia el queso y los productos agrícolas los venD. en las diferentes ferias que existe en el distrito D. Anta, por medio D. estos pequeños negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere mejorar y ampliar el negocio D. venta D. quesos y agricultura. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar queso y mejorar las tierras D. cultivo.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota.
texts.en:
Gregoria, 61, is a member of the “MUJERES EN ACCION” (Women in Action) communal bank located in Anta district which belongs to Anta province, Cusco department.

She is married and has four children.  She alternates her daily chores with cheese sales.  She also is a farmer.  She has a small plot where she grows corn, potato and vegetables.  She sells the cheese and the various agricultural products at the various farmers’ markets occurring in Anta.  Through these small businesses she’s able to support her children.  She wants to improve and expand the cheese sales business and the farming.  She is asking for the loan to buy cheese and to improve her farmland.

She is happy with the loan and commits to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy cheese and to improve her farmland.

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es: María casada, tiene su propio negocio de venta de productos de cosméticos por catálogos y pedidos, también recibe remesas familiares por parte de familiares. Tiene en sus proyectos la mejora de su vivienda ya que necesita construir los muros de la propiedad. Inicio su negocio por medio al financiamiento que le hemos ofrecido, en este ciclo de préstamo será invertido en la compra de materiales de construcción como: Cemento, hierro, estribos, tabla, malla, anticorrosivos y otro productos. Construyendo el muro del frente, obteniendo la protección, seguridad y comodidad que requiere.
texts.en:
María is married.  She has her own catalogue and special order cosmetics sales business.  She also receives family stipends from relatives.

Among her projects is home improvement because she needs to build walls on the property.

She started her business with help from loans we gave her.  In this cycle, though, it will be invested in purchasing building materials and supplies like: cement, iron rods, braces, lumber, mesh, rust retardants and other products to build the front wall thus obtaining protection, security and the comfort she requires.

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Frida

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” AHORRO ES PROGRESO – SAYLLA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Saylla, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Frida; ella tiene 58 años de edad, casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia tiene su propio negocio de venta de chicharrones ella vende en su misma casa ya hace varios años atrás la socia es una persona bien alegre y optimista y con muchas ganas de seguir adelante, la socia está feliz con su negocio ya que le trae muchas satisfacciones tanto económicas como bonitas ella desea poder continuar con este su negocio y de repente en el futuro abrir otra chicharroneria.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la implementación de su propio negocio de venta de chicharrones y para comprar algunos insumos que le faltan.       

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Frida, 58, is a member of the “AHORRO ES PROGRESO-SAYLLA” (Savings Means Progress-Saylla) communal bank located in Saylla district which belongs to Cusco province, Cusco department.

She is married and has four children.  She has her own chicharrón (fried pork skin) sales business at home; she’s had it for several years.  She is quite a cheerful, optimistic person who very much wants to get ahead.  She is happy with her business because it provides much satisfaction both financial and beautiful.  She would like to stay in business and perhaps in the future open another chicharronería.

She is requesting the loan to equip her chicharrón sales business and to buy some ingredients she still needs.

She is happy with the loan and commits to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To start her own chicharrón sales business and to buy some ingredients she still needs.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” AHORRO ES PROGRESO – SAYLLA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Saylla, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Mercedes; ella tiene 26 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 4 hijos; La socia  se dedica a la venta de animales menores como cuyes, gallinas y pollos la socia vende en especial a sus clientes que son los restaurantes y personas que viajan hasta el mismo Saylla para comprar sus animalitos, la socia está feliz con su negocio ya que le brinda muchas satisfacciones una de ellas económicas y de esta manera la socia saca a su familia adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de alimentos para sus animalitos como pasto, maíz entre otros más.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Mercedes, 26, is a member of the “AHORRO ES PROGRESO-SAYLLA” (Savings Means Progress-Saylla) communal bank located in Saylla district which belongs to Cusco province, Cusco department.

She has a live-in spouse and four children.  She sells small farm animals like guinea pigs, chickens and chicks especially to restauranteurs and to people who travel all the way to Saylla to buy her little animals.

She is happy with her business because it provides her with much satisfaction only one of which is financial; this is how she supports her family.

She is requesting the loan to buy feed, like grass, corn and others, for her little animals.

She is happy with the loan and commits to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy feed, like grass, corn and others, for her little animals.

loans.name: Ivania Patricia

texts.es:
Ivania madre soltera, ya que su esposo murió, mujer emprendedora tiene a sus hijos estudiando y su plan es que ellos se profesionalicen, trabaja como conserje en una empresa privada, tiene como proyecto la construcción completa de su vivienda, para cumplirlo se le ha presentado dificultades de falta de financiamientos. El préstamo será utilizado para la compra de materiales de construcción: cemento, hierro, laminas de zinc, bloques, arena, clavos y otros materiales. Así construir un cuarto que obtendrá seguridad y protección para su familia.
Agradece a la financiera por la oportunidad del crédito ya que fomenta el desarrollo al nicaragüense.
texts.en:
Ivania is a single mother because her husband died.  She is an enterprising woman and she has her children in school.  Her plan for them is that they become professionals.  She works as a caretaker in a private firm.  Her project is to finish building her house but this has been difficult for lack of funds.

The loan will be used to buy building materials and supplies like: cement, iron rods, zinc metal sheeting, concrete blocks, sand, nails and other materials to build a room that will provide security and protection for her family.

She thanks the financial institution for the opportunity of credit because it fosters Nicaraguan development.

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Maximo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “AHORRO ES PROGRESO - SAYLLA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Saylla, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Máximo; el tiene 35 años de edad y es conviviente  y tiene 4 hijos; el socio trabaja en las diferentes obras que le solicitan él es maestro constructor  y de esta manera el saca  a su familia adelante siendo esta la única actividad que realiza por el momento el socio es una persona bien optimista y con muchas ganas de seguir adelante por su familia y por el mismo el socio desea poder tener su propia casa  y espera algún día poder conseguirlo con esfuerzo y dedicación.

El socio solicita el préstamo para la adquisición de su propio terreno que tanto desea.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Máximo, 35, is a member of the “AHORRO ES PROGRESO-SAYLLA” (Savings Means Progress-Saylla) communal bank located in Saylla district which belongs to Cusco province, Cusco department.

He has a live-in spouse and four children.   He is a master builder and works at various jobs where he is required.  This is how he supports his family and it is the only activity he’s engaged in at the moment.  Being a very optimistic person with much desire to get ahead for his family and himself he wants to own his own house and hopes one day, through effort and dedication, to attain this.

He requests the loan to buy his own piece of land that he so desires.

He is happy with the loan and commits to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy his own plot of land that he so desires.

loans.name: Mujeres Al Triunfo 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Dorca is the coordinator of her group, Mujeres al Triunfo 1 & 2 (Women to victory), and her story is representative of both her group and Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients in general. Her group is located in one of the poorest areas around Santo Domingo city, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their five children.

Dorca is excited to be seeking her second loan with Esperanza. Notably, she has already successfully repaid her previous loan, which enabled her to expand her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business. She operates a little drugstore, sometimes by walking or at her home, where she sells primary medicines to relieve pains like headache, fever, flu, stomach pain, body aches and others. Her new loan will be invested to purchase those drugs. She will use the profits to build her house in a better structure and to save. She thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: To buy primary medicine

loans.name: Hilda Margarita

texts.es:
la joven Hilda Margarita H. es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable, se dedica a la venta de
abarroteria en general, tiene una pequeña pulperia en su casa de habitacion.
sus producto los vende a personas que viven en su comunidad y a varias personas que trabajan en las empresas meloneras y la azucareras.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia y asi surtir mas su negocio, su meta es poder hacer crecer su negocio cada dia mas y mas hasta tener una mercadito en donde tenga muchos productos y variedad que ofrecerles a sus clientes
texts.en:
Hilda Margarita H. is a hard working, responsible young woman.  She is a grocer and has a small grocery store installed in her house.

She sells her products to people living in her community and to several persons who work in the melon and sugar processing plants.

She will use the loan to buy merchandise to stock her store.  Her goal is to make her store grow daily so that later on she can have a small market with lots of products and variety to offer her customers.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, beans, lard, oil, margarine, soft drinks, snacks, cereal, oatmeal, soap, toilet paper, soups, pastas, noodles, candles, matches, batteries, salt and condiments.

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Elena M. tiene ya mas de diez años dedicándose a la venta de ropa usada y nueva, afuera de su casa. 
Al negocio le esta haciendo falta mas variedad de mercancía como ropa de verano, pero no cuanta con el dinero necesario para la inversión. Es por eso que esta solicitando un préstamo y así comprar la mercancía que necesita para tener más inventario. 
Este negocio es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para ella y su hijo quien esta estudiando.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa Elena M. has been selling used clothing outside her house for over ten years now.

The business is lacking a variety of merchandise like summer clothes but she doesn’t have enough money to make this investment.  This is why she’s asking for a loan to buy merchandise she needs to have more inventory available.

This business is the source of income for her and her son who is studying.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Yusett De Los Angeles

texts.es: Yusett De Los Angeles tiene 27 años, su actividad es la venta de comida y refrescos los días de semana. Hace más de  años que tiene esta actividad pues siempre busca la forma de diversificar su actividad ella tiene 2 hijos y quiere proporcionarles los estudios correspondientes a sus hijos, ya siempre lucha y se esfuerza por ellos. Es por eso que solicita este financiamiento como una oportunidad para salir adelante con su actividad. Desea ampliar su negocio lo suficiente para que pueda ser rentable.
texts.en:
Yusett De Los Ángeles is 27 years old.  She sells food and refreshments during the week.   She has had this activity for several years and is always looking for ways to diversify it.  She has two children and wants to provide the corresponding schooling for them; she is always struggling and making an effort for them.

This is why she’s asking for a loan as an opportunity to get ahead in her business.  She wants to expand the business enough to make it profitable.

loans.use: For working capital.

loans.name: Sucy Missel

texts.es:
la joven Sucy C. tiene 22 años de edad, vive en la aldea el Carrizo Marcovia y se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo diario, tiene una pequeña pulperia en su casa de habitacion, tambien se dedica a la venta de gallinas.
tiene 3 años de tener su negocio y con la venta de gallinas lo hace en Choluteca ahi vende a varios clientes los cules tienen comedores.
Sucy trabaja duro para sacar adelante a su hija y al mismo tiempo que su negocio crezca.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia y asi surtir su pulperia.
nos comento que se siente muy feliz ya que tiene su negocio con el cual obtiene ganancias para poder darle lo necesario a su hija.
texts.en:
Sucy C. is 22 years old.  She lives in the village of Carrizo Marcovia and sells daily use items.  She has a small grocery store in her house.  She also sells chickens.

She has had her store for three years and she sells the chickens in Choluteca to several customers who have eateries.

Sucy works hard to support her daughter and to grow her business.

She will use the loan to buy stock merchandise for her grocery store.

She commented to us that she feels very happy because she has her business with which she obtains profits to be able to provide her daughter with everything she needs.

loans.use: To buy wheat and corn flour, beans, rice, sugar, toilet paper, soups, pastas, sauces, lard, oil, eggs, salt, condiments, bread, cookies, soft drinks, juices, sweets, margarine and shampoo.

loans.name: Emiliano

texts.es:
Emiliano, casado, agricultor tiene planes de mejorar las habitaciones y el servicio de agua potable, por falta de apoyo financiero no ha podido realizarlo, con la cosecha ha tenido problema de plagas.
Inicio desde muy joven y con esfuerzo propio poco a poco ha logrado tener su finca con producciones, el cliente tiene como planes renovar plantas vivas. El préstamo será invertido en la compra de insumos y fertilizantes. Obteniendo productos de calidad y ganancias.
texts.en:
Emiliano is a married farmer with plans to improve his living quarters and potable water service.  However, lack of financial help has prevented him doing so.  His crops have suffered from infestations.

He started out very young and through his own efforts gradually got his farm to be productive.  His plan is to renovate his live plants.  The loan will be to buy supplies and fertilizers leading to quality production and profits.

loans.use: To buy supplies and fertilizers.

loans.name: Jose Francisco

texts.es:
el señor Jose Francisco G. es una persona trabajadora y muy dedicado a su familia, el se dedica a la reparacion de llantas y venta de llantas usadas, actividad que realiza desde hace año y medio en su casa de habitacion, su establecimiento es muy visitado ya que se encuentra en un lugar de facil acceso para todas las personas que vienen de la frontera del Espino, esta ubicado a orillas de la carretera panamercana.
Jose es bien honrado y muy responsable, trabaja mucho para poder crecer en su negocio, el da servicio las 24 horas del dia.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de llantas, neumaticos, parchos, pegamento, limas etc.
con las ganancias que obtenga desea darles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. José Francisco García is a hard working person who is very dedicated to his family.  He repairs tires and sells used tires, a business he’s been in for a year and a half and which is located at home.  His establishment is popular because it’s located in an accessible spot for everyone who’s coming from the border at El Espino.  It’s located along the Panamerican Highway.

José is quite honest and very responsible.  He works a lot so that his business will grow.  He provides services 24 hours a day.

He will use the loan to buy tires, inner tubes, patches, adhesive, files, etc.

With profits obtained he wants to provide a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: To buy used tires, inner tubes, patches, adhesive, oil and files.

loans.name: Teresa Del Carmen

texts.es:
Tereza casada su esposo trabaja de albañil, mejorar las condiciones de vida es unas de las metas. De professión agricultora, desde muy joven inicio con el negocio de familia  ha tenido problemas de plagas y enfermedades ya superadas. Planes a corto plazo tiene hacer trabajo de conservación en el suelo y obtener mejores y mayores cantidades de productos.  El préstamo que solicitad será invertido en la compra de insumos y fertilizantes para el suelo y así obtener una cosecha de frutos de calidad.
Agradece a ala financiera por su apoyo en el desarrollo de su finca y bienestar social.
texts.en: Tereza is married and her husband is a mason. One of her goals is to improve her living conditions. She is a farmer and started in the family business when she was very young. She has had problems with pests and diseases but has overcome them. Her short-term plans are to do some work on soil conservation and to produce better and greater quantities. The loan she requests will be used to buy materials and fertilizer for the soil in order to attain a better quality fruit harvest. She is grateful to the financial institution for supporting both the development of her farm and social well-being.

loans.use: Buy fertilizers for her crops

loans.name: Carlos Gonzalo

texts.es:
el señor Carlos Gonzalo C. tiene 59 años de edad, vive en el barrio San Jose en San Marcos de Colon, Carlos se dedica a dar el servicio de moler maiz, tiene un motor adaptado para moler maiz y brinda este servicio a todos los habitantes de su comunidad, Carlos se levanta todos los dias a las 3 de la mañana para lograr salir con todos sus clientes.
Carlos trabaja muy fuerte para poder darle lo necesario a su familia.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de unos repuestos para darle mantenimiento a su molino que es el alma de su negocio.
texts.en:
Mr. Carlos Gonzalo Cárcamo, 59, lives in the San José neighborhood in San Marcos de Colon.  He provides corn grinding services.  He has a motor modified to grind corn and he provides this service to all the residents of his community.  He rises every day at 3am in order to take care of all his customers.

Carlos works very hard to provide for his family’s needs.

He will use the loan to buy some replacement parts and to provide maintenance to his mill which is the soul of his business.

loans.use: To buy bands, sand paper, discs, oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To stock his store with paper goods and school supplies.

loans.name: Karen Margarita

texts.es: Karen Margarita es una joven de 25 años que trabajaba en un almacén y  quedó sin empleo,  teniendo que abandonar sus estudios universitarios, por eso decidió emprender su propio negocio como comerciante de ropa, productos de belleza y útiles escolares, cada producto de acuerdo a la temporada en que se encuentre. En esta oportunidad ha solicitado un crédito de capital de trabajo, para trabajar con más flexibilidad, conseguir buenos precios y sobre todo comprar de contado, pues con él comprará  útiles escolares a propósito de la temporada escolar que se avecina y su entorno, pues tiene muy cerca instituciones educativas que ya ingresan a clases después de unas largas vacaciones. Ella manifiesta que esta es la razón por la cual  su inversión será exitosa, pues es muy buena  la demanda de estudiantes de las mercancías que ella vende, entre útiles escolares, bisutería, lindos detalles para obsequios y estos productos le genera un margen  de ganancia de 25%. Su sueño es continuar estudiando a partir del aumento de sus ingresos generados por la venta variada de sus artículos y eso si por su disciplina y la aplicación de todo sus esfuerzos a esta actividad.  En la actualidad vive son su cónyuge  en el municipio de San Juan Nepomuceno y se prepara como empresaria, esposa y madre, para cuando vengan sus hijos brindarles las mejores condiciones de bienestar posible.
texts.en:
Karen Margarita, 25, is a young woman who used to work in a store but lost her job and had to abandon her university studies.  Because of this she decided to start her own business selling clothes, beauty products and school supplies, each product according to the season she was in.

On this occasion she has requested a loan for working capital to work with more flexibility, get good prices and above all to pay cash because with it she will buy school supplies precisely for the approaching new school term and taking advantage of her location which is very near schools which are about to reopen after long vacations.

She states that this is the reason why her investment will be successful because of the high demand from students for the merchandise she sells including school supplies, costume jewelry and lovely gift items.  These products generate a 25% profit margin.  

Her dream is that her profits, generated thanks to her work discipline and all her efforts in this activity, will allow her to continue with her studies.

She currently lives with her spouse in the San Juan Nepomuceno municipality and she is preparing herself to be a businesswoman, wife and mother so that when children come she will be able to provide them with the best conditions of wellbeing possible.

loans.use: Will buy school supplies: appointment books, notebooks, pencils, ball point pens, erasers and paper goods in general.

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.es:
la señora Maria de Jesus D. tiene 60 años de edad, vive en el Barrio la Venita San Marcos de Colon y se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo diario, tiene una pequeña pulperia en su casa de habitacion, distribuye su mercaderia en su misma comunidad.
Maria trabaja muy fuerte todos los dias para cubrir con los gastos de su hogar.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia y asi surtir su pulperia, con las ganancias que obtenga desea tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. María de Jesús Díaz, 60, lives in San Marcos de Colon’s La Venita neighborhood.  She sells basic need items to her community in a small grocery store she has in her home.

María works very hard every day to cover household expenses.

She will use the loan to buy merchandise to stock her grocery store.  What profits she obtains she wishes will provide a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy beans, rice, sugar, lard, soups, pasta, toilet paper, water, snacks, margarine, bread and cookies.

loans.name: Liliana Patricia

texts.es:
Liliana Patricia es una joven  mujer de 22 años, habitante  del Carmen de Bolívar, Municipio  ubicado  al pié del valle denominado “Montes de María”, en el centro del Departamento de Bolívar, que es la tierra de Lucho Bermúdez, el compositor e interprete musical más representativo e insigne de la música colombiana, que popularizó ritmos como el bolero, la cumbia, el porro y el merecumbé. Es este el ambiente cultural en el que se desenvuelve el negocio de Liliana, mediante el cual comercializa variedades,  pulseras, aretes, prendas de vestir, refrescos como bolis (Jugos congelados de frutas naturales) dulcería y en general útiles escolares.  
En términos de prepararse para la jornada escolar que inicia en le mes de Enero, Liliana Patricia está solicitando su primer credikiva a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar útiles escolares, calzado colegial, dulcería y prendas de vestir,   porque su capital de trabajo se encuentra rotando entre sus clientes y alguna que otra mercancía está pendiente de vender. Su inversión en el negocio sería exitosa por la gran afluencia de estudiantes que circundan y viven en este sector escolar y de los padres de familia que son sus principales clientes, pues le encargan a Liliana  los útiles escolares para sus hijos pues no tiene el dinero de contado para comprarlo y a ella se lo pagan  a crédito. Liliana es una joven persistente en todo lo que hace, terminó su bachillerato e inició en la universidad una carrera pero se le dificultó el pago de sus estudios, se retiró, empezó a trabajar independientemente en su negocio y en la actualidad se reintegró a sus estudios de administración de empresas en la universidad y está muy contenta porque allí también encuentra clientes a quien venderle sus productos. En la actualidad el margen de contribución de los productos es de 34% y por eso proyecta su crecimiento personal y familiar en convertir su negocio en  una gran empresa.
texts.en:
Liliana Patricia, 22, is a young woman living in Carmen de Bolívar, a municipality located at the foot of a valley known as “Montes de María” in the center of Bolívar department, which is the birthplace of Lucho Bermúdez, the most representative composer and singer of Colombian music, who popularized rhythms like the bolero, cumbia, porro and merecumbé.    This is the cultural environment in which Liliana’s business unfolds.  She sells general merchandise: bracelets, earrings, clothing, bolis (frozen fruit juice treats), candy and school supplies.

In order to get ready for the new school term that starts in January, Liliana Patricia is asking for her first Kiva loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to buy school supplies, school shoes, candy and clothes because this is the working capital she rotates for her customers as well as a few other items still unsold.

Her investment in the business will be successful because of the large number of students that circulate and live around this school sector as well as the parents who are her main customers.  They order school supplies from Liliana for their children because if they lack cash she gives them to them on credit.

Liliana is persistent in everything she does.  She finished high school and started a university career but ran into difficulty paying for her courses.  She dropped out and started working independently in her business and has just reenrolled in the university majoring in Business Administration.  She is very happy because she gets customers there too to sell her products to.

Her current profit margin is 34% so she is projecting personal and family growth as well as turning her business into a great firm.

loans.use: To buy school supplies, school shoes, candy and clothes.

loans.name: Silsa Isabel

texts.es:
Silsa García mujer D. 54 años, vive con su esposo y tiene 3 hijos en las edades D. 27 a 35 años,  en   su natal San Jacinto, población del departamento D. Bolívar reconocida por sus artesanías, especialmente   hamacas, mochilas, sombreros y accesorios. Allí  Silsa  tiene varios negocios autóctonos D. su tierra: fabricación D. masa y D. bollos o amasijos D. maíz preparados artesanalmente, venta D. hamacas, mochilas gorros y bolsos tejidos con hilo y/o hilaza en telar vertical y productos D. belleza mediante guías especializadas, pues ha ganado mucha clientela en las artesanias, que también le solicitan estas mercancias para realzar su imagen.
DesD. muy joven Silsa se dedicó a estas actividades, aprendidas por tradición familiar y así mismo las transmite haciendo participes en su negocio a su hija y su nieta, que tambien aprendieron a tejer y apoyan su gestión;  porque su mercado está en  San Jacinto y en la ciudad D. Bogotá, capital D. Colombia, donD. vive su hijo que la ayuda, consiguiendo los contactos  para la comercialización D. sus productos.
Este es su segundo financiamiento y  requiere una parte para comprar, diez libras D. hilo fino para  mochilas escolares, doce paquetes D. hilazas D. algodón y dos paquetes D. pitas para fabricar hamacas que le han encargado; otra parte la utilizará para comprar 20 bultos D. maíz y preparar masa y bollo, aprovechando que aumentan los vendedores en las jornadas escolares que se avecinan y que son sus principales clientes, en especial los D. la  masa  preparada; el resto del crédito lo invertirá en la compra D. un molino D. motor, para facilitar y hacer mas efectivo  su tarea  D. molienda  D. maíz y comprará productos D. belleza, igualmente encargados por sus clientes.
Silsa sabe invertir muy bien y por eso recibe los frutos D. su trabajo, su rentabilidad sobre las ventas es D. un 23% y con ellas ha logrado  comprar   electrodomésticos varios, una vitrina para el negocio, dos lavadoras que alquila, generando otro ingreso y todo esto le genera un gran entusiasmo para ayudar a su esposo en las labores del campo e invertir sus utilidades y generar  bienestar para su hogar porque ella es una excelente miembro D. familia.
texts.en:
Silsa García, a 54 year old woman, lives with her husband.  She has three children whose ages range from 27 to 35.  She is from her native San Jacinto, a town in Bolívar department known for its crafts, especially hammocks, backpacks, hats and accessories.  Silsa has several businesses there that are typical of her birthplace:  she makes artisanal corn dough and bread rolls, sells hammocks, backpacks, caps and bags woven from thread and/or yarn on her vertical loom and sells beauty products from specialized catalogues.  She has gathered many customers through her crafts who also ask for these products to improve their appearance.

Since very young Silsa has been in these activities which she learned as part of her family tradition which she now passes on to her daughter and granddaughter who also learned to weave and help her with the business.  Her market is in San Jacinto and in the city of Bogotá, capital of Colombia, where her son lives and also helps her getting contacts to sell her items.

This is her second loan and she needs part of it to buy ten pounds of fine thread for the school backpacks, 12 packages of cotton yarn and two packages of cordage to make hammocks she has on order.  She will use the other part of it to buy 20 bundles of corn to make dough and rolls taking advantage of the increase in salespeople the start of the approaching school term will produce, especially with regard to the prepared dough.

The rest of the loan will be used to buy a motorized mill to facilitate and make her corn grinding more efficient.  She will buy beauty products which her customers have ordered also.

Silsa is very good at investing and that’s why she reaps fruits from her labor.  Her profit margin on sales is 23% and her profits have maD. it possible for her to purchase several home appliances, a display case for the business, two washing machines she leases out generating additional income.

All of the above produces much enthusiasm for her to help her husband with his work in the fields and to invest her profits generating wellbeing for her home because she’s and excellent family member.

loans.use: For fine thread for school backpacks, packages of cotton yarn, packages of cordage to make hammocks, bundles of corn, a motorized mill and beauty products.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: La señora Ana cliente nueva  oriunda D. la ciudad D. Santa Cruz provincia Camiri D.,  vive en la localidad D. la guardia zona quebrada seca hace 12  años. su actividad es la venta D. comida  en la zona D. quebrada seca fuera D. su domicilio como segunda actividad cuenta con la actividad D. agricultura siembra D. papa, su estado civil es viuda hace 5 años no cuenta con ningún hijo a su poder porque todos sus hijos son mayores D. edad. El Destino del crédito para la compra D. sillas plásticas para su negocio y el resto para la refacción D. un cuarto.  La señora  se sienten muy agradecida por haber depositado la confianza en ella  y haber agilizado el crédito cuando ella mas lo necesitaba.
texts.en: Señora Ana is a new client from the city of Santa Cruz in the province of Camiri. She has lived in the area of La Guardia, in the zone of Quebrada Seca for 12 years.  Her work is selling food in the Quebrada Seca zone, outsiD. of her home.  As a second activity she works in agriculture, growing potatoes.  Her civil status is a widow.  She hasn't had any children in her care for 5 years as all her children are adults.  The loan is destined for the purchase of plastic chairs for her business, and the rest to make a room.  La  señora feels very grateful for the confidence entrusted in her and for having had a loan mobilized when she most needed it.

loans.use: Working funds and the purchase of plastic chairs for Ana's business

loans.name: Freddy Raul

texts.es:
Freddy M.  está renovando su credito que es el tercero  que hace con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo pero es su segundo CrediKiva, con el cual  comprará vidrios de diferentes  diámetros,  para tener existencia y poder cumplir de forma puntual con los clientes;  esta inversión augura éxito porque es una temporada en que la construcción se reactiva, debido a que muchos clientes utilizan sus cesantías para el arreglo o remodelación  de sus viviendas y por eso Freddy estará con sus materiales listos para responder a la temporada una vez tenga disponible su credikiva. El finaciamiento anterior le sirvió para comprar materiales e hizo muchas ventanas y puertas y compró muchos vidrios y espejos, que le ayudaron a aumentar su capital de trabajo.
Freddy saluda respetuosamente a sus financiadores y les pide que sigan prestando dinero a mas personas trabajadoras, para que puedan aumentar sus ingresos y se mejore el nivel de vida de todas las poblaciones Colombianas y en el mundo.
Si usted quiere conocer la historia de Freddy ingrese al siguiente enlace:http://kiva.org/lend/180570
texts.en:
Freddy M. is renewing his loan, which is the third that he has had with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, but that is his second Kiva loan.  With this loan he will buy windowpanes of different sizes in order to have business and to be able to service his clients punctually.  This investment will bring success because it is the season in which construction gets going, as many clints use their pensions for the fixing or remodeling of their homes, and so with his materials Freddy will be ready to respond to the season once his Kiva Credit is available.  His prior financing served to buy materials and he made many windows and doors and bought many windows and mirrors, which helped him to grow his working capital.  

Freddy respectfully greets his financiers and asks that they continue lending money to more hardworking people, in order so they may increase their incomes and improve the quality of life of all the towns in Columbia and in the world.

If you would like to know Freddy's history, click on the following link:  http://kiva.org/lend/180570

loans.use: To buy windowpanes of different sizes

loans.name: San Francisco De Asis Group

texts.es:
SAN FRANCISCO D. ASIS

Graciela pertenece al grupo D. Alcancía Comunal “SAN FRANCISCO D. ASIS” reciente tiene el cargo D. presidenta del grupo el grupo esta recientemente formado y esta compuesto por 7 persona.
Graciela tiene 46 años D. edad es madre soltera D. 4 hijos los cuales tienen la edad D. “22, 19, 16,7” Graciela tiene hace 4 años una tienda en su casa venD. lo que es cerveza y 3 años trabajando en lo que es ser  promotora D. Esalud   y Graciela piensa usar el dinero del préstamo para poder agrandar el ingreso D. productos a su tienda y su sueños D. Graciela es poner un minimarket en su casa esperemos que lo logre.
texts.en:
Graciela belongs to the San Francisco D. Asis communal savings group. She has just been named president of the group, which was recently formed and has 7 members.
Graciela is 46 years old and a single mother with 4 children, who are 22, 19, 16 and 7. For the past 4 years Graciela has had a store in her home where she sells beer and for 3 years she has been working as a promotor for Esalud. Graciela plans to use her loan to expand the selection of products in her store. Her dream is to set up a mini-market in her home and we hope she achieves that.

loans.use: Buy merchandise.

loans.name: Rosalba

texts.es:
La señora Rosalba G. está muy agradecida por su gran cooperación en el anterior préstamo en cual les pudo pagar a sus hijos las colegiaturas y exámenes y así sus niños pudieron terminar ese ciclo escolar. 
Nueva mente está solicitando su cooperación para un nuevo crédito ya que tiene que pagar la colegiatura y comprar los libros de su hijo, que esta estudiando la universidad y ella desea que tenga una carrera profesional para su futura. 
Planea pagar el crédito con sus ingresos como empleada de una fabrica, ya que los gastos familiares se cubren con la pensión alimenticia que les reciben sus hijos de su papa.
texts.en:
Señora Rosalba G. is very grateful for your enormous help with her previous loan, by which she was able to pay for school fees and tests, and so her children were able to finish that school year.

Currently she is asking for your help with a new loan as she already has to pay school fees and buy books for her son, who is studying at university and she wants him to have a professional career in the future.  She plans to repay the loan with the family's income from a factory job, as the family expenses are covered by a nutrition pension that her children get from their father.

loans.use: School fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a sack of rice, a sack of sugar, two 5 gallon cans of oil, one large and one small box of sardines, toilet paper, disposable diapers, soda, toothpaste and general sweet treats

loans.name: Bety Belky

texts.es:
la sra. Bety Belky M. tiene 25 años de edad, vive en el barrio San Francisco de la ciudad de Choluteca, Bety se dedica a la venta de queso seco, semi seco, ahumado y quesillo, tiene su negocio en su casa de habitacion, aqui vienen muchas personas a comprarle sus productos, este tipo de comida es muy bien vendida ya que se utiliza para dos tiempos de comida que es el desayuno y la cena, Bety tiene muchos clientes ya que el sabor de su queso es muy rico y el precio que vende la libra es accesible para las personas de la comunidad.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mas queso y quesillo, ahora las ventas han subido y se le termina el queso muy rapido, desea manejar un inventario mas grande.
las ganancias las necesita para cubrir los gastos de su hogar.
texts.en:
Sra. Bety Belky M. is 25 years old and lives in the neighborhood of San Francisco in the city of Choluteca. Bety sells dried, semi-dried, smoked, and fresh cheeses. Her business is located in her home. Many people buy her products. This type of food sells very well since it is served during two meals, such as breakfast and dinner. Bety has many customers because her cheese has a very rich flavor. The cheese is sold by the pound at a price that is affordable for the people in her community.

This loan will be used to buy more dried and fresh cheeses. Now that her sales have increased and she quickly runs out of product, Bety would like to manage a larger inventory. She needs the income to cover her household expenses.

loans.use: Purchase more cheeses

loans.name: Mujeres Bendecidas 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Dolores is the coordinator of her group, 'Mujeres Bendecidas' 1, 2 & 3 (Women Blessed), and her story is representative of both her group and Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients in general. Her group is located in one of the poorest area around Santo Domingo city, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their two children.

Dolores is excited to be seeking her first loan with Esperanza. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business. She operates a fried food stall at her home, and she will invest in her business by buying a gas tank, six chairs and a table. She sells especially breakfast and dinner. She will use the profits to save and in the short term, she plans to buy a plot of land to start building her house. Her most difficult challenge has been studying. She likes to work and her future plan is to have her own house. She thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: to buy a gas tank, 6 chairs, and a table

loans.name: Eliel

texts.es: Eliel, es un joven soltero y trabajador, que se independizó de sus padres hace algunos años Ahora él vive en la ciudad de Lima. Desde muy joven se dedico a la siembra de papa, en tanto su mamá lo ayuda a vender en el mercado central de la ciudad de Tarma, pero cuando el precio de compra de la papa está muy bajo lo lleva a Lima, para poder procesarla y dejarla lista para ser vendida a las polleria o restaurante de la capital. Según menciona, diariamente mueve un capital de S/. 1500 nuevos soles; obteniendo una ganancia mensual neta de 2 mil nuevos soles. Por el éxito que está obteniendo, es que desea en adelante intensificarse en ese negocio. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Picaflores de Patay”, y esté es el quinto crédito con MFP, donde es un socio responsable y muy agradecido. Eliel necesita este crédito poder invertir y comprar varios kilos de papa, aprovechando el buen precio que tiene en el mercado, ya que aún no esta lista este tubérculo para ser cosechado.
texts.en:
Eliel is a hardworking young man who has been independent from his parents for a few years. He now lives in the city of Lima. From a young age, he has been growing potatoes while his mother helps him with selling them at the central market in the city of Tarma. When he is able to buy the potatoes for a very low price, he brings them to Lima to be processed and sold to chicken shops or restaurants in the capital. According to Eliel, he moves 1500 PEN worth of capital each day and earns a monthly net income of 2000 PEN. As a result of the success he has achieved, Eliel wants to move forward with his business.

He is a member of the Communal Bank “Picaflores de Patay” and is receiving his fifth loan from MFP. Eliel is a responsible and grateful member. He needs the loan to invest and purchase several kilos of potatoes so that he can take advantage of the good prices at the market while the tubers have yet to be harvested.

loans.use: Purchase several kilos of potatoes to meet customer demand

loans.name: Alcanzando Nuestras Metas Group

texts.es:
Karina Evelyn, tiene 24 años D. edad, soltera,  tiene un hijo, vive en la zona D. Chacracerbo, distrito D. Comas , hace 8 meses forma parte del grupo “Alcanzando Nuestras Metas”, formado por 8 integrantes, por su responsabilidad y muchas ganas D. trabajar la eligieron como Tesorera del grupo. 
Hace 1 año se dedica a la venta D. bisutería y catálogos D. Dyclass,  gracias al negocio ha llegado a independizarse y tener más ingresos para la compra D. materiales y los gastos D. su hijo. 
Su meta a lograr es comprar su propia casa y que sus hijos sean profesionales. 
Con el préstamo solicitado desea invertir en materiales.
texts.en:
Karina Evelyn, 24, is single and has a son.  She lives in the Chacracerbo zone, Comas district.  She's been part of the "Alcanzando Nuestras Metas" (Meeting our Goals) group, which has 8 members, for the last 8 months. Because of her responsibility and eagerness to work she was elected group Treasurer.

For the last year she has been selling costume jewelry and Dyclass catalogues.  Thanks to the business she has managed to become independent and have more income to buy materials and for her son's expenses.

Her goal is to manage to buy her own house and that her children become professionals.

She will use the requested loan to invest in materials.

loans.use: To invest in materials.

loans.name: Heidy Lucia

texts.es:
Doña Heidy Lucía Martínez A. es trabajadora de un Centro de Capacitación, desempeñando el cargo de Secretaria Ejecutiva, desde hace 2 años y 3 meses.

Es Soltera, de 24 años de edad, no tiene personas a su cargo, vive en la ciudad de Managua en Las Américas número dos.

Este es el primer crédito con CEPRODEL lo solicita para invertir en gastos médicos propios y de su familia, ponerse unas piezas dentales, hacerse ultrasonidos y comprar unos lentes. Agradece a CEPRODEL por ayudarle con este préstamo en estos momentos que tanto necesita el dinero.
texts.en:
Doña Heidy Lucía Martínez A. works at a training center as an executive secretary. She has been in this job for two years and three months.

Heidy is 24 years old, single, and does not have any dependents. She lives in the city of Managua in Las Américas #2.

This is the first loan she has requested from CEPRODEL. She will invest the funds in personal medical expenses for herself and her family including dentures, ultrasound exams, and eyeglasses. Heidy is grateful to CEPRODEL for helping her with this loan at a time when she needs the money.

loans.use: Personal & family medical expenses

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es: Wilfredo, es un hombre soltero y trabajador de 31 años, que vive en compañía de sus padres Lucia y Alejo, a los que ama mucho. En armonía familiar ellos viven en su casa propia ubicada en el caserío de Patay. Siendo joven, él tiene muchas ambiciones; estudió Farmacia en un instituto reconocido de la localidad; pero sus deseos son consolidarse en un negocio propio, por ello hace 4 años comenzó a dedicarse a la agricultura. Desde entonces trabaja en los terrenos de sus padres, donde siembra una variedad de productos como: arveja, papa y flor de gladiolo a gran escala. Asimismo, posee una pequeña botica, que vende a los pobladores de su localidad cuando se sienten enfermos. En todo este tiempo le fue muy bien, tanto así, que logró obtener un auto propio con el que también hace trasporte público. Ahora desea aprovechar el buen precio que tiene sus productos agrícolas que quiere venderlos en el mercado central de la ciudad de Tarma, asimismo mejorar la calidad de su cosecha. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Picaflores de Patay”, y este es el quinto crédito con MFP, donde se siente realizado, ya que el apoyo económico y las constantes charlas que recibe la ayudan a progresar. Wilfredo dentro de muy poco cosechará arveja y flor de gladiolo, para poder sembrar sin perdida de tiempo, así que invertirá el crédito otorgado en la compra de una bolsa de semilla de arveja.
texts.en:
Wilfredo is a hardworking young man who is single and 31 years of age. He lives with his parents, Lucia and Alejo, who he loves very much. They live in harmony in their own home in the village of Patay. Being young, Wilfredo has many ambitions. He studied pharmacology at a well-known local institute, but his hopes are all consolidated into his own business. Four years ago he began farming. Since that time, he has been working the land owned by his parents where he grows a variety of products: peas, potatoes, and gladiolas on a large scale. At the same time, he operates a small drugstore where he sells to the local villagers whenever they become ill. Throughout this period he has done very well and was able to obtain his own car which he uses for providing public transportation. Now he wants to take advantage of the good prices offered for agricultural products sold at the central market in the city of Tarma. He also wants to improve the quality of his harvest.

Wilfredo is a member of the Communal Bank “Picaflores de Patay” and receiving his fifth loan from MFP. He is satisfied with the financial support and frequent seminars conducted to help him make progress. Wilfredo will soon harvest his peas and gladiolas so that he can plant his next crop without delay. Therefore he will invest this loan in the purchase of a sack of seeds for planting peas.

loans.use: Purchase a sack of seeds for planting peas

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: El señor Juan nacido el 31 de Enero en  Cordillera Santa  Cruz, casado con la Sra.
