Rosalin nacida en Sombrerito a 5 km de la Guardia, ambos se dedican a la agricultura  en Sombrerito tienen su parcela para trabajar, pero el trabaja en tierras de su suegra ayudándola porque no tiene quien trabaje agricultura, el dinero del crédito es para la compra de semillas y para los gastos que ocasiona el preparado de la tierra ellos siembran maíz, papa, arroz pero mas se dedican al achachairu, el sr. Juan es una persona muy trabajadora esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sr. Juan was born January 31st in Cordillera Santa Cruz. He is married to Sra. Rosalin who was born in Sombrerito at Km5 of La Guardia. Both of them are farmers in Sombrerito where they have a parcel of land in which they work, but they also work the land of his mother-in-law since she does not have anyone to maintain it.

The money from this loan will be used to buy seeds and pay for the expenses associated with preparing the land for growing corn, potatoes, and rice. However, what they grow most is “achachairú”. Sr. Juan is a hard worker who is grateful to Emprender for the support that has been provided.

loans.use: Purchase seeds & pay to prepare the land

loans.name: La Nueva Luz Group

texts.es:
Sara María, tiene 38 años D. edad, casada, tiene 2 hijos, vive en el Distrito D. Comas, hace 2 años que integra el grupo “L. Nueva Luz”, formado por 8 integrantes, quienes L. eligieron tesorera del grupo. 
Hace 10 años Sara María se dedica a L. venta D. diferentes productos: golosinas, lácteos, se inicio con una pequeña bodega, poco a poco fue invirtiendo hasta lograr tener una bodega y librería llamado “Sarita”; ubicado en L. zona D. Miguel Iglesias distrito D. Comas.Una D. las socia va acompañada D. un familiar. 
Gracias al negocio llegó a tener estabilidad comercial. Una D. sus metas es progresar comercialmente en L. venta D. su negocio. 
Con el préstamo solicitado desea invertir en L. compra productos para su negocio.
texts.en:
Sara Maria, 38, is married and has 2 children.  She lives in the Comas District.  
Two years ago the group “L. Nueva Luz” (the new light) formed with 8 members who elected her group treasurer.  For the past 10 years Sara Maria has been selling different foods: candies and dairy products.  She started with a small store, and little by little she invested some money until she had a grocery store and bookstore called “Sarita”.  It is located in the Miguel Iglesias district of Comas.  One of the members is a relative.  Thanks to the business she now has financial security.  One of her goals is to increase the sales in her business.

With the loan she wants to buy more products for the store.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: German

texts.es:
El Senor German M. C., habita en la ciudad de Esteli, actualmente soltero, 60 anos de edad, tiene 2 hijos, se dedica a la agricultura, con mas de 40 anos de experiencia.
Inicio en las actividades agricolas con ayuda de sus padres; hace unos 30 anos, comenzo en sociedad con un amigo que tenia mas experiencia en estas actividades, otro motivo que lo obligo a trabajar en sociedad, fue que no contaba con el capital suficiente como para trabajar por si mismo.
El Comenta que en aquellas epocas que el sembraba, este negocio era mucho mas rentable de lo que es ahora.
Anteriormente el trabajaba en el area de servicio de transporte, lo que le permitio recoger un poco de dinero y comezo a dedicarse a la siembra; al inicio hizo una mezcla de ambas actividades y le permitio independizarse, es decir ser dueno de su propio negocio.
Actualmente convina varias actividades como Comercializacion de Granos Basicos y Ganaderia.
Realizo este credito para Capital de Trabajo, para sembrar Tomate; espera obtener buenas ganancias para posteriormente mejorar sus condiciones de vida y le gustaria mejorar su negocio, buscar tecnologia para se mas eficiente y mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda y su finca.
Dentro de sus proyectos tambien esta abrir una pulperia, con precios justos.
texts.en:
German M. C. lives in the city of Esteli.  He is 60 years old, has two children, and is currently single.  He works as a farmer and has more than 40 years experience.

German started out in farming with his parents' help.  Thirty years ago he started working with a friend as his friend had more experience in this line of work.  Another reason that led him to work with his friend was that he didn't have enough capital to work alone.  German comments that back then this line of business was a lot more profitable than it is now.

German used to work providing transport services, which allowed him to make a little money, and he also started working in agriculture.  At first, he worked in both businesses and this allowed him to become independent, that is to say, he was able to become the owner of his own business.

German currently works in a number of other business activities such as selling basic grains and livestock farming.  He is requesting this loan to use as working capital for sowing tomatoes. He hopes to make good profits so that he can improve his standard of living and also improve his business, introducing technology that will make it more efficient.  He would like to improve his housing conditions and the condition of his farm.  German also plans to open a small grocery store with fair prices.

loans.use: To sow tomatoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Pay for home improvements & family expenses

loans.name: Maribel Yobana

texts.es:
CREDITO INDIVIDUAL KIVA

Maribel tiene 41 años de edad es madre casada tiene 2 hijos de edad (19, 9)los dos son dependientes tiene 10 años trabajando con Edaprospo-Prosperidad  tiene 3 años trabajando en una tienda de abarrotes en el mercado de su localidad y tanbien tiene ya 4 años trabajando vendiendo balones de gas  Maribel invertirá este préstamo en arreglar su casa y tanbien invertir en su tienda de venta de gas y puesto de abarrote si Maribel tuviera un capital de dinero su sueño seria poner un minimarket o poner una panadería y esperemos que lo logre con la ayuda de Edaprospo-Prosperidad.
texts.en:
Maribel is a 41 year old married mother of two children (ages 19 and 9) who are dependents. She has been with EDAPROSPO-Prosperidad for ten years and managed a grocery store at the local market for three years. In addition, she has been selling tanks of gas for four years.

Maribel will invest this loan to remodel her house and invest in her gas and grocery businesses. If she has the capital, Maribel dreams of opening a mini-market or a bakery which she hopes to accomplish with the help of EDAPROSPO-Prosperidad.

loans.use: Remodel her house & purchase merchandise for her two businesses

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda, es una mujer luchadora de, 48 años, que vive junto a su esposo Antonio, ambos han logrado darles una buena educación a sus 3 hijos, de los cuales solo vive con uno de ellos en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Patay. Su esfuerzo y dedicación, hicieron que su familia sea su mayor orgullo; la agricultura, su principal actividad económica desde hace 20 años, hizo posible que pagará los estudios superiores de sus hijos, quienes ya independiente la visitan constantemente. Sus principales cultivos, son: gladiolo, arveja y papa, los que constantemente los cuida y fertiliza; pues sabe que de eso depende que los productos sean vendidos en el mercado mayorista de Tarma y el de la capital; por el cual asegura buenas ganancias. Ahora ha sembrado semillas de gladiolo de las cuales espera que pronto brote estas flores. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Picaflores de Patay”, y esté es el quinto préstamo que tiene con MFP, donde es responsable y honesta con el desarrollo de su banco. Yolanda, tiene sembrado arveja y flor de gladiolo, por ello con el crédito está pensando comprar varios sacos de abono orgánico, para que su próxima cosecha sea todo un éxito.
texts.en:
Yolanda is a hard-working, 48 year-old woman who lives with her husband Antonio.  Together they have managed to provide their three children with a good education.  Only one of their children still lives with them in their own home which is located in the village of Patay.  Through their hard work and commitment, their family has become their biggest source of pride.  The couple's main business activity for the past 20 years has been farming, through which they have been able to pay for their children's higher education.  Their children are now independent and they visit their mother constantly.

Yolanda's main crops are gladioli, peas and potatoes and she is constantly tending to them and fertilizing them as she knows that her crops depend on this level of care if they are to sell in the wholesale markets in Tarma and the capital.  This is a way of ensuring good profits.  Yolanda has recently sown gladioli seeds and she hopes that the flowers will come up soon.

Yolanda belongs to the "Picaflores de Patay" (Patay Hummingbirds) community bank and this is her fifth loan from MFP.  She is a responsible and upright member of her community bank.  Yolanda has sown peas and gladioli and she plans to use her loan money to buy several sacks of organic manure so that she has a really successful harvest.

loans.use: To buy several sacks of organic manure

loans.name: Aracelly Esther

texts.es:
Doña Aracelly Esther Z. J. es trabajadora de una Empresa de Acueductos y Alcantarillado, desempeñando el cargo de Gestora Colectora, desde hace 10 años.

Es Casada de 31 años de edad, con Tres personas a su cargo dos de estas están en edad escolar. Ella vive en la ciudad de Managua, Municipio de Tipitapa desde hace 13 años.

Este es el primer crédito con CEPRODEL, el que solicita para Mejora de vivienda, agradece a CEPRODEL por brindarle este préstamo y darle la oportunidad de brindarle a su familia una vida mejor con una vivienda digna.
texts.en: Doña Aracelly Esther Z. J. has been managing collections at a water and sewerage company for the past ten years.   She is 31 years old and married.  She has three dependents, two of whom are school age.  For 13 years she has lived in the city of Managua in the municipality of Tipitapa.  This is her first loan with CEPRODEL which she is requesting for home improvements.  She is grateful to CEPRODEL for providing her with this loan and giving her the opportunity to give her family decent housing and a better life.

loans.use: Home improvements

loans.name: Emergildo

texts.es: Emergildo, es un hombre responsable y muy dedicado, de 41 años; que junto a su esposa Deysi, cuidan de su hijo Nelvis, con amor y mucho cariño. En armonía, ellos viven en su casa propia ubicada en el caserío de Patay. Todas las mañanas, desde muy temprano se dirige a sus terrenos agrícolas, donde siembra diversos productos como: arvejas, papa, y flor de gladiolo, por lo que ya tiene 10 años dedicándose a ello. Pero como buen esposo, hace muy poco abrió una tienda de abarrotes para que su esposa Deysi, se dedique a un negocio propio y de esa manera se sienta realizada. Pero según afirma, en cada cosecha ella lo apoya a trasladar la papa, arveja o flor al mercado mayorista de Tarma, donde comercializa lo cosechado. Los planes de esta hermosa familia, son mejorar su negocio y su producción, de esa manera apoyar en los estudios superiores de su hijo. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Los Picaflores de Patay”, y esté es el quinto crédito con MFP, donde es un asiduo e incansable trabajador. Emergildo muy pronto cosechará papa, por ello con el crédito solicitado comprará varios sacos de abono orgánico, asimismo planea comprar 2 bolsas de semilla de arveja.
texts.en: Emergildo is a very dedicated, responsible man.  He is 41 years old and lives with his wife Deysi. Together, they are raising their son Nelvis with lots of love and affection.  They live in harmony in their own home in the settlement of Patay.   He has been going every morning, very early, for the past 10 years to his plot of farmland to plant various products such as peas, potatoes and gladiolus flowers.  Being the good husband that he is, a short time ago, he opened a grocery store so that his wife Deysi could have her own business and feel a sense of accomplishment.  However, he says, she helps transport every harvest of potatoes, peas and flowers to the wholesale market in Tarma, where they sell their crops.  This lovely family's plans are to make improvements to their business and production and support their son's higher education.  He works constantly and untiringly for his communal bank "Los Picaflores de Patay" [The Hummingbirds of Patay].  This is his fifth loan with MFP.  Emergildo will harvest potatoes very soon and is requesting a loan to purchase several sacks of organic fertilizer and 2 bags of pea seeds.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of organic fertilizer and two bags of pea seeds

loans.name: Con Dios Adelante Al Progreso 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Maritza is the coordinator of her group, 'Con Dios adelante al progreso' 1, 2 & 3 (Forward Progress with God), and her story is representative of both her group and Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients in general. Her group is located in the rural area of San Pedro de Macoris, surrounded by sugar cane fields, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their two children.

Maritza is excited to be seeking her 8th loan with Esperanza, four years after she started doing business and taking out loans. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business. She sells miscellaneous products such as cosmetics, beauty items, shoes, clothing, etc. She will use the profits to start rebuilding her house as a safer structure. Her most difficult challenge is living in her community. She likes to work and her future plan is attending church. She thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: to buy miscellaneous products

loans.name: Teodosia

texts.es: Teodosia, es una luchadora mujer de 42 años, que en compañía de su esposo Medardo, cuidan de sus 2 hijos. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Patay. El trabajo al que se dedica es la agricultura; desde hace 10 años se dirige a los campos de cultivo donde cuida de sus plantaciones de arveja, papa, flor de gladiolo, habas y maíz. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder disfrutar de la tranquilidad del trabajo en el campo; “también me gusta comercializar mi cosecha, pues veo concretado tanto esfuerzo”, menciona. Ahora tiene pensado renovar sus plantaciones de flor de gladiolo, ya que se acerca la temporada donde las flores tienen mayor demanda. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Picaflores de Patay”, y esté es el quinto crédito con MFP, donde es una socia responsable y comprometida con los pagos que hace a su asociación. Teodosia muy pronto cosechará papa, por ello con el crédito solicitado, comprará varios sacos de abono orgánico el que piensa esparcir entre sus sembríos, de esa manera obtener una buena producción. Asimismo desea comprar semilla de arveja.
texts.en: Teodosia is a strong woman of 42 who takes care of her two children with her common -law husband, Medardo.  They live in their own house, in the village of Patay.  She has been farming for the past 10 years planting beans, potatoes, gladiolus flowers, lima beans and corn in her fields.  What she likes the most  is the tranquility of working in the fields.  “I also like to sell my crops since I see the results of so much effort”, she says.  Now she is planning on replanting   her fields of gladiolus since the seasonis coming when there is much demand.  She belongs to the communal bank “Picaflores de Patay” and this is her fifth loan with MFP.  She is a responsible and committed member with the payments that she makes with the association.  Teodosia will harvest her potatoes very soon and that is why she is requesting the loan.  With it she will buy some bags of organic fertilizer that she will scatter among the plants, and thus have a higher yield.  She also wants to buy seeds of pea plants.

loans.use: To buy some bags of organic fertiizer and been plant seeds

loans.name: Aurelio

texts.es: El señor Aurelio se dedica al transporte de servicio publico trabaja en una  línea de taxi llevando pasajeros de el Torno a la Ciudad de Santa Cruz, vive en casa de sus padres tiene su taxi hace poco y con esta herramienta genera ingresos para el y su familia,  con el dinero del crédito comprara llantas y realizara el mantenimiento de su vehículo es  un joven con muchas ganas de superación y esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Aurelio works in public transport for a taxi line, taking passengers from the Torno to the city of Santa Cruz. He lives in his parent's home. He has had his taxi for a short time and with this means he generates income for himself and his family. With the money from the loan he will buy tires and get some maintenance done on his vehicle. He is young with a great desire to succeed and he is grateful to the institution for the support offered.

loans.use: Purchase tires and vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “AHORRO ES PROGRESO - SAYLLA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Saylla, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Alfredo; el tiene 32 años de edad y es casada  y tiene 2 hijos; el socio trabaja en las diferentes obras que le solicitan él es maestro constructor  y de esta manera el saca  a su familia adelante siendo esta la única actividad que realiza por el momento el socio es una persona bien optimista y desea comprar materiales de trabajo ya que algunos de sus materiales lo perdió y desea reponerlo ya que sin sus materiales él no puede trabajar de manera optima el socio desea seguir trabajando ya que mediante este trabajo el saca  a su familia adelante.

El socio solicita el préstamo para la compra de materiales de madera para su trabajo.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Alfredo is a member of the village bank "AHORRO ES PROGRESO - SAYLLA".  The bank is located in the district of Saylla, in the province and department of Cusco.  

He is 32 years old, married and has 2 children.  He works on different projects for which is is commissioned. He is a master carpenter, and this is how he takes care of his family, since this is the only activity that he is undertaking right now.  He is a very optimistic person and wants to buy materials for his work since some of his materials were lost and he wants to replace them.  Without his materials he cannot do his work fully and he wishes to keep working in order to maintain his family.

He asks for a loan to buy wood materials for his work.

He is happy about the loan and promises to meet the payment quotas.

loans.use: To buy wood materials for work

loans.name: Elvis

texts.es: Elvis, es un hombre responsable de 36 años, que junto a su esposa Flora cuidan de sus 2 hijos. En armonía ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Patay. Hace 11 años comenzó a sembrar papa, arveja, y flor de gladiolo. En esos tiempos sembraba en terrenos alquilados, pero gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación logró comprar sus propios terrenos agrícolas. Ahora desde las primeras horas de la mañana se dedica a cuidar de sus cultivos, pues sabe que de eso depende obtener una buena cosecha, para así poder vender todo en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Las expectativas que tiene con respecto a sus cultivos de papa y gladiolo son muy importantes; por ello desea mejorar su producción para lograr obtener buenas ganancias. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Picaflores de Patay”, y esté es el quinto crédito con MFP, donde es un hombre responsable y comprometido. Elvis, muy pronto cosechará sus sembríos, por ello con el crédito solicitado, comprará 2 bolsas de semilla de arveja.
texts.en:
Elvis is a responsible 36 year-old man who, together with his wife Flora, takes care of their 2 children.  They live together peacefully in their own home which is located in the village of Patay.

Eleven years ago, Elvis started growing potatoes, peas and gladioli.  He used to sow his crops on rented land but, through a lot of effort and commitment, he managed to buy his own farmland.  Very early every morning, Elvis heads out to care for his crops as he knows that obtaining a good harvest and being able to sell all his produce in the wholesale market in the city of Tarma depends on him doing this.

Elvis has very big hopes for his potato and gladioli crops.  He would like to improve his production in order to make a good profit.

Elvis belongs to the 'Picaflores de Patay' (Patay Hummingbirds) community bank and this is his fifth loan with MFP.  He is a responsible and committed member of his community bank.  Very soon, Elvis will harvest his crops and he will use the loan he is requesting to buy 2 bags of pea seeds.

loans.use: To buy two bags of pea seeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To build a bathroom

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a mixing machine for her husband's work

loans.name: Margot

texts.es: Margot, es una mujer honesta de 33 años, que junto a su esposo Elmer, cuidan de sus 2 hermosos hijos. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Patay. Para poder mantener a su familia, está valerosa mujer se dedica a la agricultura y al trasporte público. Todas las mañanas su esposo Elmer, sale a trabajar con su auto; trasladando a los pobladores del caserío a la ciudad de Tarma. Mientras que Margot dedica su tiempo y esfuerzo a cuidar de sus sembríos de habas, arvejas y flor de gladiolo, ya tiene 14 años realizando está labor. Lo que más le gusta a ella es viajar a la ciudad de Tarma, donde comercializa su producción. “Estar en el campo es maravilloso, no se ganará mucho pero vives tranquila”, afirma; por esa razón desea seguir mejorando sus sembríos. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Picaflores de Patay”, y este es el quinto crédito con MFP, donde es una socia trabajadora y cumplida. Margot dentro de muy pronto cosechará flor de gladiolo, por ello con el crédito solicitado comprará varios sacos de abono orgánico para así obtener una buena cosecha de esta flor.
texts.en:
Margot is a modest 33 year-old woman who, together with her husband Elmer, cares for their 2 beautiful children.  They live together as a family in their own home which is located in the village of Patay.

In order to support her family, this brave woman works as a farmer and provides public transport services.  Every morning, her husband Elmer goes out working with his car.  He transports residents of their village to the city of Tarma.  Meanwhile, Margot spends her time caring for her bean, pea and gladioli crops.  She has been in this line of work for 14 years.  What she most enjoys is travelling to the city of Tarma where she sells her produce.  "Being in the countryside is marvellous.  You do not earn much but you live peacefully" she says.  For this reason, she would like to continue improving her crops.

Margot is a member of the "Picaflores de Patay" (Patay Hummingbirds) community bank and this is her fifth loan with MFP.  She is a hard-working and responsible member of her community bank.  Very soon Margot will harvest her gladioli flowers.  She will use her loan money to buy several sacks of organic manure so that she can obtain a good harvest.

loans.use: To buy sacks of organic manure

loans.name: Nerida

texts.es: Nerida, es una valiente mujer de 35 años; que en compañía de su esposo Manuel cuidan de sus 2 hijos: Kareli y Arnold. En armonía ellos viven en su casa propia ubicada en el caserío de Patay. Todas las mañanas desde muy temprano Manuel, su esposo; sale a trabajar con su auto en el trasporte público, cubriendo las rutas Tarma-Palca. Mientras que Nerida la apoya en la agricultura, en donde sus principales sembríos constan de arveja, papa, y flor de gladiolo. Lo que más le gusta a ella es poder ayudar a su esposo en los gastos familiares, “me siento realizada”, afirma. Pero está pareja de esposos, conjuntamente viajan a la capital del país donde comercializan su producción después de cada cosecha. En adelante desea mejorar sus cultivos, en principal sus sembríos gladiolo; pues según menciona, esta flor tiene mayor demanda durante todo el año. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los Pioneros de Patay”, y esté es el quinto crédito que tiene con MFP, donde es una socia solidaria y muy comprometida con el desarrollo de su asociación. Nerida dentro de muy pronto cosechará arvejas, por ello con el crédito solicitado, comprará varios sacos de abono orgánico; asimismo desea comprar una bolsa de semillas de gladiolos que le hace falta para sembrar luego de su pronta cosecha.
texts.en: Nerida is a brave 35 year old woman who alongside her husband Manuel have 2 children, Kareli and Arnold.  They live harmoniously in their own home located in the Patay neighborhood.  Every morning Manuel leaves very early for work using his own auto as public transit and covering the Tarma-Palca routes.  Meanwhile, Nerida does her part in agricultre where her main crops consist of: peas, potatoes, and the gladiolus flower.  What she likes most is being able to help her husband with the household expenses, " I feel accomplished", she states.  The couple travels to the capital after every harvest to sell their crops.  In the future she would like to improve her crops, starting with her gladiolus seeds; according to her the flower has great demand all year round.  She is part of the comunal bank, "Los Pioneros de Patay" ( The Patay Pioneers), and this is her 5th credit with MFP.  Nerida is loyal and comitted to the development of her group.  She will soon be harvesting peas, and with the solicited loan she will purchase various sacks of organic fertilizer alongside a sack of galdiolus seed that she is yet to plant until after harvest.

loans.use: Purchase sacks of fertilizer and a sack of gladiolus seed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Home Repairs

loans.name: Kantati Group

texts.es: El Banco de Emprendimiento Kantati esta conformado por nueve personas la mayoría de las señoras viven el zona tres de mayo y se dedican a la artesanía de zapatos y también un porcentaje tiene su tienda de barrio ya que viven por la misma zona y el cual se conocen muy bien en el grupo también están dos varones. El presidente es el Sr. Víctor es chofer asalariado en la una empresa muy conocida de la ciudad, trabaja de lunes a domingo es casado tiene cincuenta seis años es una persona responsable y dinámica  conoce al grupo por eso lo eligieron presidente, con el dinero del crédito realizara el mantenimiento de su vehículo, la  secretaria es la Sra.  Zulma vive  es casada se dedica ala costura de zapatos  su taller es en su mismo domicilio  es una socia que descanso un ciclo y decidió volver al grupo, con el dinero del crédito comprara cuero para la realización de zapatos. También es un grupo antiguo esta en su noveno ciclo y están agradecidas con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
The communal bank Kantati is made of nine members. Most of the women are shoe makers that live in the May 3rd district, but a certain percentage of the members have neighborhood grocery stores since they live in the same area.   There are also two men in the group.

The president is Señor Víctor.  He is 56 years old, married and is a responsible, dynamic person  .His group knows this about him and that is why they elected him president.   He works seven days a week as a salaried driver for a well-known company in the city.  He will use the money from the loan to maintain his vehicle.

The secretary is Señora Zulma.  She is married and crafts shoes for a living from a shop in her home.  She sat out for one loan cycle and decided to rejoin the group.   She will use the money from the loan to buy leather for shoemaking.  

This group has been around for a while and is in its ninth loan cycle.  They are grateful to the institution for the support they provide.

loans.use: Vehicle maintenance and to purchase leather for shoemaking

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Make home improvements

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 56 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de sus tres hijos jóvenes, y su pequeño nieto, juntos se esfuerzan cada día por salir adelante. Desde hace tres años esta emprendedora dama se dedica a la venta de jugos de frutas  por pedidos, los prepara en su casa y los reparte a sus vecinos que le piden. Dice que la labor es muy tranquila y le permite obtener algo más de dinero para apoyar a su familia. Además durante la mayor parte del día se dedica a la atención en el comedor popular que tiene en su casa, donde ella se desempeña como líder zonal, pues reparte platillos de comida  junto con algunas colaboradoras de su vecindario. Aunque ella es líder de su zona sabe que debe cumplir con el reparto de comida equitativamente entre todas las familias humildes de la zona, y desempeña su labor con mucha satisfacción. Para el futuro tiene planeado ampliar su jugueria y hacerlo un negocio permanente para lograr vender en mayor cantidad, de esta manera espera mejorar sus ganancias. Es el séptimo crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. María tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de ingredientes, al por mayor, que necesita para continuar con el negocio de venta de jugos, además quiere implementar mejor el comedor popular que atiende con cantidad de ingredientes, de esta manera espera continuar adelante.
texts.en: María is 56 years old and lives in her own home along with her three children and her young grandson. Together, they work hard every day to make headway. For the past three years this enterprising woman has made a living selling fruit juices on order. She prepares the juices at home and then delivers them to her neighbors who order them. She says the work is very calming and allows her to earn some more money to support her family. Furthermore, during the larger portion of the day she dedicates herself to a soup kitchen she runs out of her home, where she serves as a community leader. She and others deliver meals throughout the neighborhood. As a community leader, she knows that she must distribute the food equally among the area's poor families, and she carries out her work with a lot of satisfaction. For the future, she plans to expand her juice bar and make it a permanent business so she can sell in larger quantities and increase her revenue. This is her seventh loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she promises to make her payments on time because she doesn't want to look bad to the people who have made this possible and allowed her to continue working in search of progress. María plans to invest this loan in the purchase of wholesale ingredients that she needs for her juice business. She also wants to to make some improvements to the soup kitchen by adding new products, and in this way she hopes to continue moving ahead.

loans.use: Purchase fruits and ingredients to prepare juices as well as add new products to her soup kitchen.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Make home improvements

loans.name: Jantetelco Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama Jantetelco, se encuentra localizado en la comunidad de Jantetelco, en el estado de Morelos, México, está conformado por 6 integrantes mujeres que se conocen y son vecinas, las integrantes del grupo son la señora Misael B. N. va a comprar con su préstamo frutas, jícama, plátanos, mandarinas etc. Y compra de pollo para vender por pieza o por kilo, entero, la señora Norma C. R. va a comprar bolsas de dama, billeteras para caballero para surtir su negocio, la señora Eva Rodríguez A. va a comprar cosméticos para su venta y poder surtir su negocio, la señora Minerva R. E. va a comprar zapatos para dama de todo tipo para su venta, la señora Roxana A. R. va a comprar ropa interior por mayoreo para surtir su negocio, la señora Ángela Josefina E. L. va a comprar sus catalogo para vender zapatos. La señora Misael B. N. tiene 38 años de edad estudio hasta el 3er. año de secundaria, ella viven unión libre su esposo él hace trabajos de hojalatería y es checador de las combis, ella tiene 3 hijos que viven en casa y van a la escuela ellos son Diego tiene 8 años va a la primaria, Paola tiene 11 años y Lupita tiene 15 años ellas  están en la secundaria, La señora Misael tiene su negocio de venta de verdura, frutas, pollo y venta por catalogo de productos de Jafra, zapatos y ropa, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar frutas, verduras, pollo, va a comprar zapatos, ropa por catalogo y artículos de regalo diademas, pulseras, cuadros, acuden a su negocio de todo van señoras, señores, muchachas niños, ella ofrece a sus clientes pollo por pieza o por kilo, verduras, frutas, frigo, chiles secos, perfumes, cosméticos, tintes para el pelo, zapatos y ropa, ella inicio en su negocio de venta por catalogo de Jafra, Zapatos y ropa hace 10 años y en la venta de verdura, frutas y pollo hace 4 meses, ella empezó ayudándole a una señora a vender por cátalo y después ella compro los catálogos par empezar a vender y en su propio negocio es fácil se pone el numero el color, la pagina el modelo, los zapatos es más fácil la venta ya no los anda ofreciendo, los clientes le piden los catálogos y es seguro la venta. Ella tiene su negocio en la esquina donde vive su suegra en la calle su esposo le dio para invertir e compra frutas y verduras el plátano por caja y la demás mercancía por kilo su negocio esta a una cuadra de su casa lleva su mercancía en un diablito caminando. Su negocio es importante porque de ahí va saliendo para los gastos de sus hijos que van a la escuela para la comida va agarrando de su negocio, la parte favorita de trabajar su negocio es que si quiere algo o si le falta algo a sus hijos de ahí lo agarra y ya no se preocupa, todo le gusta de su negocio lo hace con contenta y con gusto y no esta atenida a su esposo y se siente orgullosa de poder ayudar a su esposo en los gastos porque luego no alcanza. Ella recuerda que una vez no tenía dinero y se puso a escombrar su ropa y en su ropero tenía guardado un dinero que le sirvió mucho. Su negocio enfrenta los desafíos de costos elevados en el jitomate y la fruta luego sube el precio, la competencia que enfrenta su negocio es el zapato y los perfumes hay varias personas que venden por catalogo, las ganancias del negocio las utiliza en los gastos de sus hijos en la escuela y su hija utiliza perfumes o zapatos de los que vende. Ella está planeando ampliar su negocio meter más productos chiles secos, pasilla, frijol, pasta de mole y recipientes de plástico para agrandar el negocio. Jantetelco es un pueblo tranquilo, los vecinos se llevan bien son amables y respetuosos, el paisaje es bonito pero le faltan mas arboles, se celebra el 29 de Junio la fiesta patronal de san Pedro hay misas, y el 13 de Diciembre el levantamiento en armas de Mariano Matamoros hay un desfile grande van de varios lugares a desfilar el estado de Puebla y Morelos.  Su negocio ha ayudado mucho a su familia con la comida de ahí va  agarrando para todo, la señora Misael quiere comprar otro terreno y hacer mas cuartos y sus planes y esperanzas son tener un carrito para transportar toda su mercancía, para ir a comprar a la central sus frutas y sus verduras y está muy contenta con este préstamo que le dieron porque va a invertir va a comprar más mercancía. Ella quiere tener un local donde ya este establecida y ampliar comprar más ropa y zapatos para tener para ofrecerle a sus clientes, las integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “les damos las gracias, gracias a sus apoyos hemos mejorado nuestras familias, gracias es una gran ayuda y esperamos cumplir y que nos sigan prestando.”
texts.en:
This group is called Jantetelco and is located in the community of the same name in the state of Morelos, Mexico. It consists of six female members who know each other and are neighbors. The members of the group are: Misael B. N., who plans to use the loan to purchase fruits, jicamas, bananas, mandarins, vegetables and chicken to sell by the piece or by the kilo; Norma C. R. plans to purchase women's purses and men's wallets to stock her business; Eva Rodríguez A. plans to purchase cosmetics to sell and to stock her business; Minerva R. E. plans to purchase all kinds of women's shoes to sell; Roxana A. R. plans to purchase undergarments in bulk to store her business; Ángela Josefina E. Linarten plans to buy a catalog to sell shoes.

Misael is 38 years old and has a high school education. She lives with her common-law husband, who works in a body shop and is a mechanic. They have three children who lives at home and go to school: Diego, 8; Paola, 11; and Lupita, 15. Misael has a business selling fruits, vegetables and chicken, and she also sells Jafra-brand products (clothes and shoes) via catalog. She is requesting the loan to purchase fruits, vegetables and chicken as well as the catalog items and gift items such as bracelets and paintings. All kinds of people come to her business, women, men, and many boys and girls. She offers her customers chicken by the piece or kilo, vegetables, fruits, dried chiles, perfumes, cosmetics, hair dye, shoes and clothing. She started her business selling Jafra-brand clothes and shoes via catalog for the past 10 years, and has been selling fruits, vegetables and chicken for the past four months. She started helping out a women selling items via catalog and later bought the catalogs for herself to start her own business. The work is easy. She puts down the number of the color and the page of the model. The shoes are the easiest to sell. The customers ask for the catalogs and the sale is secure. Misael has her business on the corner where her mother-in-law lives, and her husband gave her what she needed to invest in the purchase of fruits and vegetables. She got the bananas in boxes and the rest of the produce by the kilo. The business is a block from her home and she transports the supplies with a hand truck. Her business is important because it helps cover her children's education and gives them food to take to school. Her favorite part of her job is that if her children want something or something is missing they can just get it from her and she doesn't have to worry. She likes everything about her business and it makes her content and she feels proud she can help her husband with expenses. Misael can remember a time when she didn't have money and she had to rummage for clothing. She had some money saved in her closet, which served her well. Her business faces the challenge of higher costs for tomatoes and fruit when prices rise, and she faces competition in selling shoes and perfume since there are various people who sell via catalog. She uses her profits to cover her children's school expenses, and her daughter uses the perfume and shoes she sells. Misael is planning to expand her business with more dried chiles, beans, corn meal, and plastic containers.

Jantetelco is a peaceful village. Her neighbors are friendly and respectful. The countryside is beautiful but lacks trees. They celebrate June 29, St. Peter's Day, with Masses, and on Dec. 13 there is a big parade to commemorate Mexican hero Marino Matamoros that goes from various places in the states of Puebla and Morelos.

Misael's business has help her family a lot by providing everyone with food. She wants to buy some more land and build more rooms. Her plans and hopes are to have a little car to transport all of her merchandise and to go to the center for her fruits and vegetables. She is very content with loan because she plans to purchase more produce. She wants to have a store that is already established and be able to sell more clothing and shoes to offer her customers.

The members of the group want to tell Kiva and Fundación Realidad, "We thank you. Thank you for your support in improving our families. It is a big help and we hope to succeed and that you will keep on giving."

loans.use: Purchase fruits, jicamas, bananas, mandarins, vegetables, and chicken

loans.name: Luis Fernando

texts.es: El Señor Luis de la ciudad de La Paz,  vive en la localidad  del Torno hace 2 años, Su actividad es el servicio de trasporte en la ciudad de Santa Cruz trabaja con radio móvil hace 3 años y como segunda actividad mecánico en la zona del torno.   El Sr. Luis no es casado pero convive hace 5 años con la señora Yandira , ella tiene la actividad venta de comida hace 5 anos en la zona del Torno, los señores cuentan con un hijo pequeño. El Destino del crédito es para la compra de un motor nuevo para su vehículo. El  señor Luis se sienten muy agradecido  por haber depositado la confianza en ellos y haber agilizado el crédito.
texts.en: Luis, of the city of La Paz, has lived in the community of Torno for 2 years.  His business is transportation service in the city of Santa Cruz.  He has worked with Radio Móvil, a taxi company, for three years.  His second job is working as a mechanic in the Torno area.  Luis is not married, but for 5 years he has lived with Yandira.  She has sold food in the Torno area for 5 years.  They have a small child.  The loan will be used to buy a new engine for Luis' vehicle.  Luis is very grateful for the confidence placed in them and for the help in facilitating the loan.

loans.use: For the purchase of a new engine

loans.name: Lizbeth

texts.es: La Sra. Lizbeth, ha solicitado ya su segundo credito, para invertir en el negocio, ella ademas de su esposo, son el sustento de la familia, y actualmente cuentan con un pequeño negocio de abarrotes, que han ido mejorando poco a poco, y la idea de ellos es tener suficiente mercancia en la tiendita, ya que les estan haciendo falta unos productos que los clientes les han estado solicitando, y ellos no quieren perder la clientela, por eso motivo hacen todo lo posible por tener siempre los productos que sus clientes les solicitan, y de esta manera tambien obtener mas ganancias para cubir sus gastos de alimentacion y vestido, tambien quieren en un futuro ampliar la tiendita, ya que son buenos comerciantes.
texts.en: Lizbeth has now asked for her second loan to invest in her business. She and her husband support their family, and currently they run a small grocery store, which has been improving bit by bit. Their idea is to have sufficient merchandise in the shop, since they don't have some items that their customers have been asking them for, and they don't want to lose the business. That's why they do everything they can to always have the products their customers ask them for, and in this way they can also earn more to cover their costs for food and clothing. They also want to expand the shop in the future, since they are good businesspeople.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her business

loans.name: Lester Isidro

texts.es:
El Senor Lester V., es habitante de la Comarca El Coyolito, del Municipio La Concordia en Jinotega; casado, tiene 41 anos de edad, con 2 hijos, sus estudios son basicos, ya que solo llego a 6to grado de primaria; y desde entonces se dedica a la Agricultura.
Incio en estas actividades con su padres, desde muy nino, sobre todo el le ayudaba a limpiar y regar y su Papa le ayudaba para que estudiara y sus gastos personales.
Cuando el tenia 15 anos de edad, su Papa fallecio, quedando el a cargo de la familia, desde esa edad, ya que el era el hermano mayor.
El se dedico a producir las 5 manzanas que su papa le dejo de herencia a todos, al inicio consiguio un socio para poder sembrar, ya que el no tenia suficiente recursos para hacerlo solo; y esto a la vez le impidio seguir con sus estudios, pues sus prioridades eran otras.
Tambien se dedico a la compra/venta de Frijoles y compra venta de terrenos.
El ahora esta apoyando a sus hijos a que estudien y se preparen, para que mejoren su nivel de vida.
Solicito este credito para la siembra de Hortalizas, espera obtener buenas ganancias.
Dentro de sus metas esta comprar terrenos para ampliar su siembra e independizarse por completo de sus otros hermanos, y que sus hijos puedan ser profesionales.
texts.en:
Lester V. is a resident of the region El Coyolito in the La Concordia municipality in Jinotega.  He is 41 years old and married with two kids.  He has a basic education, having only reached sixth grade.  Since then, he's worked in agriculture.  He began working in agriculture with his parents when he was very young, mainly cleaning and watering.  His father helped Lester with his personal finances so he could study.

When Lester was 15 years old, his father died, leaving Lester in charge of his family since he was the eldest brother.  Lester dedicated himself to producing the five parcels of land his father left to the family.  In the beginning, Lester contracted a partner to help him sow the land, since he no longer had sufficient resources to do it by himself.  Taking care of the land stopped Lester from continuing school because now he had other priorities.  Lester also worked buying and selling beans and land.

Right now, Lester is helping his children study so that they can improve their quality of life.

He asked for this loan to grow vegetables, which he hopes will obtain good revenues.  His goals also include buying land to increase his crops, becoming completely independent from his brothers, and having his children become professionals.

loans.use: Growing vegetables

loans.name: Abraham

texts.es: Abraham, de 60 años, vive en su casa que es propia solo, pues hace varios años se separó de su esposa y sus cinco hijos ya son mayores y trabajan independientes. Este emprendedor hombre se dedica a la construcción de grandes obras; desde muy joven aprendió observando a sus familiares que se desempeñaban en el oficio. En la actualidad tiene su empresa de construcción, y aunque le faltan algunos permisos opera junto a otros tres obreros, y él les guía pues es el maestro en este oficio. Le gusta mucho su labor ya que manifiesta que es reconfortante observar las grandes obras terminadas con buen acabado, y es por esta razón que tiene varios clientes que lo recomiendan y no le falta trabajo ya que siempre esta empezando o terminando una construcción. Para el futuro tiene planeado comprar una camioneta para que sus obreros  se movilicen sin problemas. Es el quinto crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Abraham tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de una máquina mezcladora de cemento, pues es un instrumento que le hace falta para terminar las obras con mayor rapidez y calcula que obtendrá mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Abraham is 60 years old and lives alone in his own home. He separated with his wife a number of years ago and his five children are already grown up and working. This enterprising man makes a living in construction. Since he was a young man he learned from watching his relatives who worked in the trade. Currently he has a construction company, and although he lacks a few permits he manages with three other workers. He oversees them since he is the master builder. He really enjoys his work and says it is heartwarming to see the big jobs completed with good results. It's for this reason he has various clients who recommend him, and he doesn't lack for work since he is always starting or completing construction. For the future, he plans on purchasing a pickup truck so that his workers can move around without problems. This is his fifth loan with Kiva partner MFP, and he promises to make his payments on time since he doesn't want to be in bad standing with the people who made this support possible and so that he can continue working in search of progress. Abraham plans to invest the loan in the purchase of a cement mixing machine since it is an instrument he is missing in order to finish his jobs more quickly, and he calculates that he will earn better profits.

loans.use: Purchase a cement mixing machine

loans.name: Mujeres Laboriosas Group

texts.es: Carolina Maribel C. T., es casada, tiene 31 años D. edad, tiene a su cargo 3 hijos los cuales estudian, se dedica a la crianza D. animales, ya lleva diez años D. experiencia en este tipo D. trabajo, empezo su negocio con unos ahorros que empezo ha hacer, cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo quien se dedica a la sastreria. Doña Carolina decidió organizar un grupo con el fin D. solicitar un prestamo, que les servirá para diferentes inversiones, crianza D. animales. Las demas integrantes D. este grupo se dedican a diversas actividades que son: Crianza D. animales, bordado D. blusas, confeccion D. delantales, tejido D. servilletas y tejido D. sábanas. Solicitan el prestamo a ASDIR con el fin D. incrementar su capital D. trabajo y posteriormente en la recuperacion D. su inversión obtener mejores ganancias. Esperan ver su negocio mas granD., lograr cancelar su prestamo y mejorar su condición D. vida.
texts.en:
Carolina Maribel C. T. is married and 31 years old and looks after her 3 children who are in school.  She raises livestock and has 10 years experience in this field of work.  She started her business with her own savings and she counts on the support of her husband who is a tailor. 
Carolina organized a group with the intent of obtaining a loan which will be utilized for raising livestock and other various investments.  The other members of the group do other work, such as: raising livestock, embroidering blouses, making aprons, knitting handkerchiefs and sheets.  ASDIR is being solicited for the loan with the goal of increasing the work capital and later recouping their investment and to obtain better earnings.  They hope to see their business grow and pay-off their loan and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: Raise livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Home improvements

loans.name: Consuela

texts.es: Consuela, de 63 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de su esposo Iván de 67 años, pues sus hijos ya son mayores e independientes; pero aún así esta pareja se esmera por salir adelante. Desde hace más de 20 años, esta emprendedora mujer se dedica a la fabricación de imágenes religiosas, echas a mano. Esta muy satisfecha con esta labor pues es muy tranquila y la realiza junto a su esposo durante todos los días de la semana, sobretodo cuando tienen bastante cantidad de pedidos, principalmente entidades religiosas, que le solicitan estas imágenes por su buen acabado y calidad. Manifiesta que a veces deben amanecerse creando las imágenes (de santos) pues les falta tiempo, pero a su vez dice que es reconfortante darle forma a una imagen que será venerada. Como siempre piensa en el futuro tiene planeado ampliar su negocio, para mejorar sus ganancias. Es el cuarto crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Consuela tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de material (como recina, fibra de vidrio, silicona, cobalto, entre otros) que necesita para seguir fabricando las imágenes religiosas, y espera seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Consuela is 63 years old and lives with her husband, Iván, 67 years old, in their own home.  Their children are adults and live independently, but this couple wants to do everything they can to earn an income.  For over 20 years this hard-working woman has made religious icons by hand.  She enjoys her work very much and she and her husband work together all week long, especially when they have a lot of orders.  Religious organizations are their main customers, since the icons are very well made.

Sometimes they to get up very early in the morning to make the saintly icons but it is always comforting to them because they know the figures will be venerated.  Always thinking of the future, they have plans to expand business to increase earnings.  This is the fourth loan through MFP and Consuela is committed to paying it back on time.  She does not want to fail the people who are making it possible for her to get the loan so she can continue working toward progress.  Consuela plans to use the loan to buy material (resine, fibreglass, silicone, cobalt and others) so she can continue making her religious icons and earn a good living.

loans.use: To buy resine, fibreglass, silicone, cobalt and other materials to make icons

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Gladys, de 45 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de su hija mayor y su madre, juntas se esfuerzan cada día para salir adelante. Desde hace 5 años, esta laboriosa  mujer se dedica a brindar el servicio de corte de cabello además de peinados, este oficio lo aprendió desde muy joven, con el tiempo ha ganado experiencia que luego le ha servido para sacar adelante a su familia. En la actualidad tiene su salón de belleza, ubicada en una pieza de su casa y ahí atiende de lunes a sábado durante todo el día; el tiempo le ha permitido adquirir gran cantidad de clientes que prefieren su servicio de corte y peinado pues es de buen acabado y los precios son muy cómodos. Esta satisfecha con su negocio, pues obtiene regulares ganancias y ya tiene pensado para el fututo ampliar su negocio e implementarlo con mejores instrumentos de estética. Es el 11avo crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Gladys tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de implementos de peluquería que necesita con urgencia, como: secadora, tintes, tijeras, pues los que tiene están algo antiguos, de esta manera espera mejorar su servicio.
texts.en:
Gladys is 45 years old and lives in her own home with her eldest daughter and mother.  They all work hard to make a living.  For five years now this hard-working woman has had a hair salon.  She learned the skill when she was young and has gained experience over time and has been able to provide for her family in this manner.

Currently she operates a salon in her home Monday through Saturday all day long.  She has many customers who go to her for haircuts and styling because she offers good service and low prices.  She is very satisfied with her business and has a steady income.  She hopes to expand business and acquire the best beauty salon tools available.  This is the 11th loan through MFP and she is committed to paying it back on time since she would not want to disappoint the people who have made it possible.

Gladys plans to use the loan to buy items for her beauty salon which she needs urgently such as: hairdryer, hair color and scissors.  She hopes to improve her service this way.

loans.use: To buy a hair dryer, hair color and scissors

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For home repair

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy beer and softdrinks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For home improvement

loans.name: Reyes

texts.es:
La senora Reyes V., es originaria de la ciudad de Masaya, pero actualmente  habita en la ciudad de Esteli, tiene 53 anos de edad, es casada, con 4 hijos, es comerciante; tiene un puesto de venta de Frutas.
Comenzo a trabajar desde los 16 anos de edad, en la venta de frutas, el cual lo inicio sola con un pequeno prestamo que realizo para comenzar.
Antes viaja a los departamentos como Esteli y Matagalpa a vender frutas; pero desde hace 15 anos que se quedo a vivir en Esteli y tiene un puesto de venta en el Mercado Alfredo Lazo, siempre se ha dedicado a este tipo de negocio.
Solicito este credito para compra de inventario de Frutas, espera poder vender todos sus productos y obtener ganancias, que le permitan salir adelante poco a poco.
Su proximamente es poder comprar su propia casa; ya que actualmente tiene que alquilar donde vive.
texts.en:
Mrs. Reyes V. is from the city of Masaya, but at present she lives in the city of Esteli. She is 53 years old, married and has 4 children. She is a merchant and has a fruit stall.  

She started to work selling fruit when she was 16 years old. She began with a small loan she took out to get started. 

She used to travel to the departments such as Esteli and Matagalpa to sell fruit, but for 15 years she has lived in Esteli and has a stall in the Alfredo Lazo Market. She has always worked in this type of business. 

She asked for the loan to buy fruit inventory. She hopes to be able to sell all of her product and make a profit, which will help her get ahead little by little. 

Her next goal is to buy her own house, since she is renting now where she lives.

loans.use: Selling fruit

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy materials to make artisanal accessories.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Reynaldo Antonio

texts.es: Reynaldo tiene 27 años, por lo que su actividad es brindar el servicio de transporte  de triciclo. Hace más de 3 años, que se dedica a este negocio por lo que inicio con esfuerzos propios, el se encarga de proporcionarle lo más necesario a toda su familia. Pues sus inicios fueron muy duros ya algunas veces como no tenía el capital suficiente su automóvil no presentaba las condiciones necesarias. Es por eso que solicita este financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo para la compra de llantas, asientos, pedales entre otros. El sueña con tener otro vehículo que presente mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Reynaldo is 27 years old.  His business is providing transport services with his three-wheeled vehicle.  He started the business through his own efforts and has been in the business for more than three years.  Reynaldo is in charge of covering his family's basic needs.  In the beginning, work was very hard because sometimes, as he didn't have sufficient capital, his vehicle wasn't in a suitable condition to drive.

Reynaldo is requesting this loan as working capital.  He will use it to purchase tires, seats, pedals, etc.  He dreams of owning a vehicle that is in better condition.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Housing improvements

loans.name: Marcia Del Socorro

texts.es: Marcia Del Socorro tiene 62 años, su actividad económica es pulpería. Hace más de 12 años que se dedica a este negocio. Esta actividad se da por iniciativa propia, Ella es una persona muy humilde y disfruta de su trabajo por lo que siempre está al tanto de los que sus clientes le solicitan. Siempre se ha dedicado a mejorar sus ingresos y cada día más. Ella solicita este financiamiento para la compra de granos básicos, golosinas y refrescos naturales. Su deseo es seguir mejorando su vivienda.
texts.en:
Marcia Del Socorro is 62 years old.  She has owned a grocery store business for more than 12 years.  She started out in the business on her own initiative.

Marcia Del Socorro is a very unassuming person and enjoys her work.  For this reason, she is always aware of what her customers are requesting.  She has always been dedicated to improving her income day by day and is requesting this loan to buy basic grains, candies and natural soft drinks.  Her wish is to continue improving her home.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Home improvements

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Home improvements

loans.name: Hermenegilda

texts.es: La Sra. Hermenegilda comprara mobiliario para  su negocio ya que ella se dedica a vender comida como antojitos mexicanos,nachos, lonches y manifiesta que ella quisiera que sus clientes pudiern comer ahí, pero no tiene mas que dos mesas y cuatro sillas por lo cual desea su credito para comprar mobiliario y asi poder otorgar un mejor servicio a sus clientes y a la vez amplear su negocio .
texts.en: Hermenegilda will use her loan to buy furniture for her business.  She runs a business selling food such as Mexican 'antojitos' (snacks), nachos and lunches.  She tells us that she would like her customers to be able to eat in situ but she doesn't have more than two tables and four chairs.  For this reason, she would like a loan to buy furniture so that she can provide a better service to her customers and, at the same time, expand her business.

loans.use: To buy furniture for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Home improvements

loans.name: Virgilla

texts.en:
Virgilla L. is from the village of Banigan, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 40 years old, is married, and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, she owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Virgilla has been engaged in this business for more than 15 years and earns approximately 3500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from the business.

Virgilla joined PMPC in 2009 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virgilla has successfully repaid a previous PMPC loan of 10,000 PHP, which she used to purchase breeding livestock. She is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will likewise be used to purchase breeding livestock. This will be her fifth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita B. is from the village of Bandera. She is 51 years old, married, and has two adult children. Cristita operates a family member's business raising pigs in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month.

In 2009, Cristita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase materials for her pig fence and feeds. Cristita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional piglets and feeds. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Cristita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and feed

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
La señora Silvia G. esta agradecida por su cooperación en el anterior crédito.  
A la vivienda de la señora Silvia G. le está haciendo falta la elaboración de una barda y terminar los acabados del exterior de la casa, pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para realizar la mejora.
Doña Silvia G. es viuda y tiene dos hijos adolescentes baja su responsabilidad y desea lo mejor para ellos.
La señora Silvia trabaja en una casa particular como niñera, este ingreso una parte de esté ingreso será para pagar el crédito.
texts.en:
Silvia G. is grateful to Kiva lenders who helped to fund her previous loan.  She currently needs to build a perimeter wall around her home and to finish off some work to the outside of her house.  However, she doesn't have the money she needs to carry out these improvements.

Silvia is a widow and has two teenage children in her care.  She wants the best for them.  Silvia works as a nanny in a private home.  Some of the income that she makes from this job will be used to pay back her loan.

loans.use: To build a perimeter wall

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita R. is from the village of Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 53 years old, is married, and has 4 school-aged children.

To make a living, Lolita owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from her bakery. Lolita has been engaged in her business for more than 2 years and earns approximately 3,200 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from the business.

Lolita joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) in 2009 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is an individual member of PMPC and is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP that she will use to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be her second loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her immediate family.

loans.use: Capital and inventory for a bakery

loans.name: Ophelia

texts.en:
Ophelia F. is from the village of Banigan, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 49 years old and single. To make a living, Ophelia owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Ophelia has been engaged in her business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 2000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from her business.

Ophelia joined PMPC in 2009 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous PMPC loan of 5000 PHP, which she used to purchase breeding livestock. She is requesting a new loan of 4500 PHP that will likewise be used to purchase breeding livestock. This will be her third loan from PMPC, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Renacientes (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Renacientes esta conformado por 9 mujeres muy luchadoras, alegres y trabajadoras quienes se esfuerzan día a día para crecer más en sus negocios y sacar  adelante a sus familias. Nuestras socias viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida y admirada por muchos debido a la belleza colonial de su centro histórico, de su naturaleza y su gente que es calida y muy amable.

La Señora. Marcia S. es socia del banco comunal Renacientes, vive en el sector de Miraflores, este es su tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y le gusta ya que cuenta con grandes amigas con quienes se distrae.
Nuestra socia se dedica a laborar en una distribuidora de plásticos actividad que la realiza hace 2 años, labora de lunes a sábados desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche. También se dedica a la venta de ropa, inicio este negocio con su primer crédito que realizo en el banco comunal, vende en su tiempo libre y fines de semana.
Doña Marcia tiene 25años, es casada y aun no tiene hijos, su esposo labora como ebanista, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando. 
Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más ropa. Su meta es tener su casa propia. 

La Señora. Sonia U. es socia del banco comunal Renacientes, vive por el sector de Chilcapamba, tiene 35 años, es casada y tiene 5 hijos de 17, 15, 12, 8 y 7 años de edad, sus tres primeros hijos estudian en el colegio y sus dos últimos hijos en una escuela de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como empleado privado, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando. 
Doña Sonia se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y al cuidado de sus hijos, hace apenas 6 meses se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, ternos de niño y libros, estos productos los vende recorriendo la ciudad.
Es socia del banco comunal hace 3 créditos y le gusta  por que tiene muy buenas amigas con quienes conversa en cada reunión saliendo de su rutina, con el dinero de su crédito va a comprar pollos para iniciar  esta actividad. Su sueño es  tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
The Renacientes community bank is made up of 9 very hard-working, happy women who work hard every day to grow in their businesses and get their families ahead in life.  Our members live in different parts of the city of Cuenca.  This city is well known and admired by many people owing to the colonial beauty of its historic center, its nature and its people who are warm and very friendly.

Marcia S. is a member of the Renacientes community bank.  She lives in Miraflores sector.  This is her third loan as a member of the community bank which she likes because she has some great friends there with whom she enjoys herself.

Marcia has been working for a plastics distributor for 2 years.  She works from Monday to Saturday, from 8.00am to 8.00pm.  She also sells clothes.  She started this business with the first loan she received through her community bank.  She sells her products in her spare time and on weekends.

Marcia is 25 years old, married, and does not have any children yet.  Her husband works as a cabinetmaker.  They do not own their own home and so live in a rental property.  Marcia will invest her new loan in buying more clothes.  Her goal is to own her own home.

Sonia U. is another member of the Renacientes community bank and lives in Chilcapamba sector.  She is 35 years old, married, and has 5 children aged 17, 15, 12, 8 and 7.  Her eldest three children are studying in high school and her two youngest are attending elementary school in the city.  Her husband works as a private employee.  They do not own their own home but live in a rental property.

Sonia takes care of her housework and her children.  She has also been selling cosmetics, children's outfits and books for 6 months.  She sells these products all around the city.  Sonia has been a member of the community bank for the past three loan cycles.  She likes it because she has some very good friends with whom she gets to chat during each group meeting which takes her out of her routine.  Sonia will use her loan money to buy chickens so that she can start out in the chicken business.  Her dream is to own her own home.

loans.use: To buy clothes and chickens

loans.name: Seng

texts.en:
Seng V., 39, is married and resides with her three children in Battambong province, Cambodia, an area known for quality rice products. V. grows vegetables to sell, earning an income of $2 per day. Her husband is employed as a security guard, earning an income of $3 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend $50 on food and $60 on the other necessary expenses. 

V. is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a water pump to water the vegetables. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a water pump to water the vegetables

loans.name: Seth

texts.en: Seth K., 45, is married and resides with her child in Battambong province, Cambodia, an area known for quality rice products. K. and her husband sell grilled chicken eggs, earning an income of 15 USD per day. Each month, the family has to spend 83 USD on food and 20 USD on the other necessary expenses. K. is requesting a loan of 700 USD to purchase a motorbike for family use. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for family use

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy groceries to resell and to start a new business

loans.name: Thuon

texts.en:
Thuon C. is a 42-year-old single woman.  She lives in a medium-sized home with her children in Kompong Cham Province. She owns a piece of farmland that she inherited many years ago from her grandparents. She has been using this land to cultivate rice crops since 1990. Thuon C. was married years ago, but is now divorced from her husband. She has two children who are working in various occupations. 

This is dry season, and Thuon C. has planted her dry-season rice field.  However, it is still not growing well because it lacks fertilizer. To solve this problem, Thuon C. would like to ask for a loan to buy a few sacks of fertilizer to improve her crop, and gasoline for the irrigation pump. She hopes that she can use the rest of the funds to buy rice while the prices are low, to resell later for profit.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and gas for pump

loans.name: Pich

texts.en: Pich N., 62, is married and resides with her husband and a child in Prey Veng province, Cambodia, an area known for one of the largest rice producing regions in Cambodia. N. sells fruits, earning an income of 5 USD per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend 20 USD on food and 33 USD on the other necessary expenses. N. is requesting a loan of 1,200 USD to purchase more fruit to stock her store. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy more fruit to stock the store

loans.name: Konh

texts.en: Konh S., 57, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Prey Veng province, Cambodia, an area known for one of the largest rice producing regions in Cambodia. S. is a housewife while her husband is a farmer, earning an income of 1 USD per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend 40 USD on food and 37 USD on the other necessary expenses. S. is requesting a loan of 650 USD to purchase a motorbike for family use. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for family use

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a secondhand motorbike to ride to work

loans.name: You

texts.en:
You L. is 58 years old.  She is married and is devoted to eight children, four of whom are working in a garment factory, and the other four are students at the public school. She stays at home to manage the family housework such as cooking meals and caring for her children. She is married to 61-year-old Khiev Nait, who supports the family by working as a chief of the village. 

You L. is concerned that the local school where her children attend is so far from her house, and they must ride their old bicycles. It is hard for them because their bicycles are getting old and worn.  To encourage her children, she would like to request a loan from Kiva to purchase a motorcycle for her kids.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle for kids to go to school

loans.name: Nitu

texts.en:
This is 30-year-old Nitu S.. She is married and has 2 children; ages 6 and 3. In 2007 she established her meat shop business. Working 7 days a week and 5 hours a day, she supoorts her family. She has already received and successfully repaid 2 loans from Patan BPW. She used her most recent loan to buy buffalo for her business

In the future, Nitu plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

In Nepal, the meat is always fresh. In small stalls along busy roads, open air butcher shops sell chicken, goat, and water buffalo by the kilo. The stalls are piled high with product and sales are brisk. With the help of a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase additional stock at better prices. This increase in purchasing volume creates greater profit margins for the borrower. 

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community. For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates:
 BPW Partner Page.  Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team

loans.use: To buys buffalo meat and some chickens

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.en:
Ma. Luisa is a separated woman who lives in Bago City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures: a general store and a rice and beer retail business. She has 3 children who are between 27 and 30 years old, One has family and the other 2 are working. 

Ma. Luisa joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 16 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Ma. Luisa has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 19,500 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 15,000 PHP, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 17th loan, she is borrowing 29,000 PHP, which she intends to use to purchase more stocks of rice and beer so that she can continue to save up for future house repairs. 

Ma. Luisa is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.	

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Jonalyn's Group

texts.en:
Jonalyn T. is from the village of San Antonio. She is 27 years old, and she is the leader of a 10-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults on their loan.

Jonalyn is married and has 2 infant-aged children. To make a living, Jonalyn plants and harvests rice for sale. Jonalyn has been engaged in her business for more than 2 years and earns approximately 20000 PHP per harvest.

In 2010, Jonalyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.
