loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe P. lives in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. She is 48 years old and married. She is a farmer who plants and harvests rice and corn crops. Ma. Fe's harvest is for her family's consumption as well as for sale. For additional income, Ma. Fe also raises pigs.  She fattens them and sells them at the market. 

She would like the loan to buy farm inputs and pig feeds. Ma. Fe hopes to be of better service to people in her community, by serving quality crops and pigs.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and pig feeds

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia B. is from the village of Brgy. Abinganan, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 49 years old, married and has 5 school-age children. To make a living, Julia raises crops. Her main source of income is planting and harvesting rice for sale. Julia has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 45,000 PHP per harvest.

In 2010, Julia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to pay for services to increase crop yield. Julia is requesting a new loan of 30000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be Julia's second loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of the borrower's family.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Sem

texts.en:
Sem T. has her own store in the province of Kompong Chhnang where she operates a retail business. Sem T. sells such items as urns and jars, which are made mostly from clay. She can earn a profit of around $1.75 per day from her business. 

Sem T. has a life partner in her husband, who is a mobile fish seller.  He sells fish by using his motorbike, and makes an income of approximately $2 each day to contribute to the family’s income. 

Unfortunately, the motor on his motorbike is broken with usage, which affects her husband’s business.  Sem T. requested a loan to repair her husband's motorbike and to use as working capital for his fish selling business.

loans.use: To repair motorbike, and use as working capital for fish selling business

loans.name: Mary Chor

texts.en:
Mary Chor, 23 years old, is a farmer from Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. She is married and has 2 young children. Mary Chor plants and harvests rice and corn crops and sells it to rice traders. She does her best, to give her family better living conditions. 

Mary Chor applied for a loan from CEVI which she will use to fund her farm. She needs additional seeds and fertilizers.  Mary Chor is hopeful that with this investment, her harvest will increase.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en: Merlinda M. is a 56-year-old farmer. She is married and has 5 children. Farming has been the source of her family's income for quite some time now. Merlinda works hard to keep the farm productive. Right now, she is in need of additional rice and corn seeds, fertilizers and other inputs for the farm. She is a member of CEVI and has applied for a loan of 13000 PHP.  Merlinda says her previous loans were very helpful to her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Tuul

texts.en:
Mrs.Tuul is a 45-year-old widow.  She lives with her only son in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her 18-year-old son, Lkhagvasuren, is currently unemployed and is planning to join the army, a compulsory service for men who reached 18 in Mongolia. At the moment he is helping his mother’s business. 

Since 2005 Mrs.Tuul has been running a business selling children's clothes. Once a month she travels to Ereen, a Chinese border city, and buys  clothes for resale. Sometimes she buys them from wholesalers who bring them from China. She rents a stall in Narantuul, the biggest outdoor market in Ulaanbaatar.

Mrs. Tuul is the only bread winner for her family and her business is the only source of income.  She is planning to increase her sales capacity by renting one more stall and buying more children's clothes before the lunar new year. She is applying for a loan to buy more children’s clothes for resale.

loans.use: To buy children's clothes for resale

loans.name: Hang

texts.en:
Hang H. is a 30-year-old farmer who lives in Kompong Chhnang Province. She is married to Chan Nimal, age 32.  They have 5 children, all of whom are single.  One of them is a sewing worker and has a salary of about $70 per month.

Hang H. has a plot of farm land where she grows rice.  Her husband has been earning a living for many years by climbing the palm trees in and around his community (to collect oil). Palm-tree-climbing jobs are very common for the poor.  This family currently generates an income of approximately $3.75 per day. 

Due to the fact that rice harvesting season is coming, Hang H. has decided to seek a loan from Kiva to buy more rice while rice is commanding its lowest price. TH. she will sell it later wH. the price increases.

loans.use: To stock up rice while prices are low for later resale.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia A. is from the town of Bayombong,Nueva Vizcaya. She is 51 years old, married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Leticia owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste to the local community. Leticia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Leticia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leticia is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be Leticia's 1st loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rosemin

texts.en:
Rosemin G. is a farmer in a town of Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. She is 46 years old and married. Rosemin's husband is also a farmer. Together, they make sure the rice and corn crops that they plant grow healthy. They also want to serve the best quality of produce to their customers. 

Rosemin is requesting for a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase additional fertilizers and seeds. She hopes that this loan will help in increasing their harvest. She is working hard as her way of thanking lenders for the financial provisions they give to her.

loans.use: To purchase additional fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion S. is 60 years old and has six children. Her husband passed away already, so she is the one providing for the needs of the family.  To make a living, she has a farm and also raises hogs. Salvacion's older children help in maintaining their farm. 

She is asking for a loan to buy rice and corn seedlings for her farm. She will also buy fertilizers after planting the seeds for a good harvest.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Romeo L. is from the town of Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 49 years old. Romeo is married and has three school-aged children. 

To make a living, Romeo owns and operates a general store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Romeo has been engaged in his business for over seven years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Romeo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. Romeo is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Romeo from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Senina

texts.en:
Senina T. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 49 years old. Senina is married. 

To make a living, Senina raises crops, primarily rice and corn, for sale.

Senina joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Senina is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve her farm. 

About CEVI:
Community Economic Ventures, Inc. (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over recent years. Based in Bohol, it has numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides its clients credit, but also savings, insurance and training, which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Miami

texts.en:
Miami L. is from the town of Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 43 years old. Miami is single. To make a living, Miami owns and operates a  specialized retail store selling rice in the local market. Miami has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 7,500 PHP a month.

In 2011, Miami joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Miami from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Karim

texts.ru: Холов Карим житель района Муминобод. Ему 48 лет. Он женат, имеет 8 детей. Жена работает уборщицей в средней школе. Сам Карим имеет высшее образование, агроном. По профессии работает 20 лет. Кроме того он занимается животноводством. Откармливает и продает скот. Этим видом деятельности занимается 10 лет. Кредит берет для закупа скота.
texts.en: Karim K. lives in the Muminobod Region. He is 48 years old. He is married, with eight children. His wife works as a janitor in a high school. Karim has a college degree: he is an agronomist. He has been working in his profession for 20 years. In addition, he raises livestock. He fattens cattle for later resale. He has been in this business for 10 years. He is taking out a loan in order to buy cattle.

loans.use: Purchasing cattle

loans.name: Handaa

texts.en: Mrs. Handaa is 49 years old and lives with her husband in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has one daughter, who is married and lives separately. Mrs. Handaa has been running a retail sales business since 2000. She buys different tools, instruments, hardware and spare parts from wholesalers and sells them at Khar Khorin, the second largest outdoor market in Ulaanbaatar city. She has taken a loan from Credit Mongol before and repaid it on time. Her business is doing very well. In the future she is planning to build a new family house on her plot of land. Therefore she is trying to save some money by increasing her business profit. This time, she is applying for a loan to increase her working capital, inventory and to buy more tools and instruments for resale.

loans.use: To increase her inventory and to buy more tools, hardware, and instruments for resale.

loans.name: Men

texts.en:
Men K. is a 55-year-old married woman and a local villager living in Kompong Thom Province. She has a life partner in her husband, who works in the farming business as well as repairing bicycles for additional income. 

Men K. has a piece of farmland that she inherited many years ago from her grandparents. She uses this land to grow rice crops. Currently, she has plans to grow watermelon, but she doesn’t have funds as capital to do it yet. To remedy the situation, Men K. is looking for a loan to use toward purchasing fertilizers, insecticides, and seeds for planting. With the rest of funds, she will support her husband’s business by buying some materials for repairing bicycles.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, insecticides, and seeds for planting

loans.name: Sadurdin

texts.ru: Сайфудинов Садурдин проживает в районе Муминобод. Ему 57 лет. Женат. Имеет 5 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сын работает в телестудии города Куляб. Сам Садурдин имеет высшее образование, агроном. Работает по профессии. Кроме того в свободное от работы время занимается животноводством. Он разводит скот у себя дома. В этой области более 10 лет. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Sadurdin S. lives in the Muminobod Region.  He is 57 years old. Married, with five children. His wife is a homemaker. His son works at the TV studio of the city of Kuliab. Sadurdin has a college degree; he is an agronomist. He works in his profession. IN addition, in his spare time he raises livestock. He raises cattle at his home. He has been doing this for over 10 years. He is taking out a loan in order to purchases cattle.

loans.use: Purchasing cattle

loans.name: Pom

texts.en:
Pom S., age 35, is a married woman who has been living in her own small house with other family members in Kompong Thom province. To earn a living, she cultivates a rice crop on her own farmland, which came from her grandparent. 

Pom S. can grow her crop two times a year, in both the rainy season and dry seasons. Growing crops is an annual action with which she has had great success. To help be responsible for family, her husband works in construction for a profit. This couple has two small kids. 

Pom S. requests a loan to decorate her house.

loans.use: To decorate her house

loans.name: Karya Murni Abadi Group

texts.en:
Karya Murni Abadi Group has paid off their previous loan with MUK in accordance with their agreement. They wish to continue with a second loan, equal to the previous loan, of 10,000,000 Indonesian rupiah (IDR) for 10 people. They plan to use the funds to buy pigs and cattle feed.

I Putu D. is chairman of the group, responsible to all the business members. If a member is experiencing difficulties in their efforts, I Putu D. will immediately contact the MUK officer or find a vet. I Putu D. maintained four pigs, which were sold to pay off the MUK loan. From the sale, he got enough profit to finance everyday life expenses and school fees with a little savings.

loans.use: To buy pigs and cattle feed

loans.name: Koun

texts.en: Koun P. sells a few wares in front of her home. She sells items like soft drinks, sweets for kids, and some cooking supplies. Her husband works as a local farmer and earns an income of around US$3 each day to share with Koun P. the responsibility for providing for the family’s living expenses. Koun P. is blessed with a lovely child, who still lives under her care. Recently, the stock of some of Koun P.’s items has been exhausted; she wants to restock and is requesting a loan to replenish her inventory to continue selling. Note: Koun P. and her young child appear in the photo.

loans.use: To replenish her inventory to continue selling

loans.name: Otgon

texts.en:
Mrs.Otgon, 40 years old, lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They don’t own any land. Currently they are living in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, on her husband’s uncle’s plot of land. Their future plan is to buy some land and to build a family house on it. Therefore they have work hard to increase income and accumulate some money. 

Since 2000, Mrs.Otgon has been running a hardware and tools retail business. She buys the items from wholesalers. She also buys second hand tools to restores and sells them as well. She is applying for a loan to buy more tools and hardware for resale and to buy one more cow for milking. She sells milk to her neighbors as well.

loans.use: To buy more tools and hardware for resale and to buy one more cow for milking.

loans.name: Genelyn

texts.en:
Genelyn B., 32, is from Villar, Sibalom, Antique, Philippines. She is married to Melvin B. and they are blessed with three children, John Mark (8 years old), John Michael (5 years old) and John Melvin (3 years old).

Genelyn has a hog-fattening business while her husband works as a laborer. They help each other to earn an income in order to address the growing needs of the family. They want to make a small investment while their children are still young because, according to them, when their children get older, their needs will grow bigger.

Genelyn has successfully repaid her previous loan and now she is applying for a new loan of PHP 4,000. This amount will be used to buy feed for her piglets.

She dreams that all of their children will complete their studies through college so that they will get good jobs. She also hopes some day to have a variety store in their village to have more income.

loans.use: To buy feed

loans.name: Mawar Group

texts.en: Mawar Group has 10 members located in Pejarakan, Singaraja. They are requesting a loan of 10,000,000 Indonesian rupiah. Ni Komang S. is the chairman. She is 30 years old and has two children. In addition to her daily life as a housewife, she has developed a business raising pigs at home. With this first loan, she will buy piglets and poultry feed. With the profits, she will pay for everyday expenses, both in the kitchen and for extra school fees, and prepare for settlement with KSU MUK.

loans.use: To buy piglets and poultry feed

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine M. is from the village of Brgy. Poblacion South, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 33 years old. Josephine is married and has two school-aged children. 

To make a living, Josephine owns and operates a general store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Josephine has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Josephine joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Josephine has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Josephine is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be the second loan taken out by Josephine from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia A. is from the village of Poblacion, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 55 years old. Olivia is married. 

To make a living, Olivia owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods and toothpaste in the local community. She also makes and sells snacks like rice and cheese cakes. Olivia has been engaged in her business for over 27 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Olivia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Olivia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. Olivia is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods and snack foods. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Olivia from HSPFI. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira G. is from the village of Poblacion, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 53 years old. Elvira is married and has four adult children. 

To make a living, Elvira owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods, beverages and toothpaste in the local community. Elvira has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Elvira joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Elvira has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. Elvira is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods and snack foods. This will be the second loan taken out by Elvira from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
Melba D. is from the village of San Antonio, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 34 years old. Melba is married and has five school-aged children. 

To make a living, Melba owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling vegetables like squash, eggplants & tomatoes in the local community. Melba has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Melba joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Melba has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional vegetables and for working capital. Melba is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional vegetables like carrots and potatoes. This will be the second loan taken out by Melba from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional vegetables like carrots and potatoes

loans.name: Gresilda

texts.en:
Gresilda I. is from the village of Olingan, Dipolog City. She is 49 years old. Gresilda is single and has no children. To make a living, Gresilda owns & operates a specialized retail store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste in the local community. Gresilda operates this business for over 3 years and earn approximately PHP 3,000 a month.

In 2010, Gresilda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She successfully paid her previous loan of PHP 10,000.Gresilda is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Gresilda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional capital for her sari-sari store business.

loans.name: Henrietta

texts.en:
Henrietta R. is from the village of Dicayas. She is 55 years old, married, and has 4 adult children. Henrietta operates a family member's business, in services sector,primarily sewing dress and pillow case in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over 6 years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Henrietta joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities.Henrietta is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional materials for her sewing business. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Henrietta from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials for her sewing business.

loans.name: Expedita

texts.en:
Expedita S. is from the village of Poblacion, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 58 years old. Expedita is separated from her spouse and has 1 adult child. To make a living, Expedita owns & operates  a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, junk foods, beverages & toothpaste in the local community. Expedita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Expedita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Expedita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Expedita is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & junk foods. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Expedita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell, like canned goods & junk foods.

loans.name: Ma. Theresa

texts.en:
Ma. Theresa I. is from the village of Poblacion, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 54 years old. Ma. Theresa is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Ma. Theresa owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, junk foods, beverages & toothpaste in the local community. Ma. Theresa has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Ma. Theresa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Ma. Theresa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Ma. Theresa is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & junk foods. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Ma. Theresa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. This picture was taken during the center meeting with other clients. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell, like canned goods & junk foods.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily C. is a twenty seven years old married lady, mother of two children. Her husband is called Willy Kipsang and he is a maize farmer. Emily, on the other hand, does a horticulture business; she plants vegetables for resale. She has been in this business for six months now and she gets an income of  KES 30,000 per month

This will be Emily's first loan from KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan on the farm to buy fertilizer and seeds for planting. In the future she wants to continue with her horticulture business and also to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer for horticulture business.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia S. is from the village of Poblacion, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 41 years old. Delia is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Delia owns & operates a retail store, selling rice by the kilogram in the local community. She also has a motorela, or habal-habal service, with her husband as the driver. Delia has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Delia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Delia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional tools for the maintenance of the service & towards working capital. Delia is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional rice for sale & to use as working capital. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Delia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional rice for selling & using towards working capital.

loans.name: Rustam

texts.ru: Казаков Рустам житель района Курган-Тюбе. Ему 47 лет. Женат. Имеет 4 детей. Жена домохозяйка, дети учатся. Сам Рустам имеет высшее образование, педагог. По профессии проработал 10 лет. Сейчас Рустам работает на рынке. Он в основном занимается продажей золотых украшений. В этой области уже 12 лет. Кредит берет для увеличения ассортимента.
texts.en: Rustam K. lives in the Qurgan-Tube Region. HE is 47 years old. Married, with four children. His wife is a homemaker; his children are in school. Rustam has a college degree: he is an educator. He has worked in his profession for 10 years. At present Rustam works as a retailer at the market. He mainly sells gold jewelry. He has been in this line of business for 12 years. He is taking out a loan in order to expand his stock.

loans.use: Increasing stock of goods

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann B. is 22 years old, married, and has three school-aged children.  She lives in the village of Poblacion, Talakag, Bukidnon. To make a living, Mary Ann makes and sells food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making and selling snacks and other delicacies such as rice and cheese cakes in the local community. Mary Ann has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Mary Ann joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Ann has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to purchase additional ingredients and acquire working capital. Mary Ann is requesting a new loan of 16,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients such as flour, eggs, and milk. This loan will be Mary Ann's fifth loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients such as flour, eggs, and milk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buying used clothes for resale

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth O. is from the village of Lilingayon, Valencia City, Bukidnon. She is 33 years old. Ruth is married and has 4 school-aged children. Ruth owns & operates a store that buys and sells ready-to-wear clothing & shoe products. She also sells hypo which is a diswashing liquid, and snacks like cinnamon breads & cassava cakes. Ruth has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 8000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.

In 2009, Ruth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. Ruth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. 

Ruth is requesting her fourth loan, for 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell & ingredients for making snacks. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchasing store inventory and ingredients for snacks

loans.name: Rosecepcion

texts.en:
Rosecepion E. is 41 years old and lives in Guibongan, Hamtic, Antique, Philippines. She has been a good mother to her five children and a loving wife to her husband, Ananias E., who works as a foreman at a construction company.

She has been an active member of the ASHI-Antique Southwest Branch since 2006, which has allowed her to secure the loans she needed for her business, where she sells goods in both wholesale and retail markets. She is committed to make this business a success because she wants to provide for her children, including ensuring that they all get a good education through college. She would also like to earn enough money to renovate her house and save for future needs.

loans.use: To expand a small business selling wholesale and retail goods

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie B. lives is the village of Puerta, Lurugan, Valencia City, Bukidnon. She is 32 years old, single and the mother of one infant. She makes a living by running a sari-sari (or variety) store, where she sells items people need daily such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snacks and toothpaste. She has been in this business for more than two years and earns about 6,000 PHP a month from her work.

Last year, Rosie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid her first loan, which was for 5,000 PHP, from HSPFI. Now she is applying for a second loan, for 8,000 PHP, to buy additional products, such as canned food and beverages, to sell to her customers. She plans to use the additional revenue she earns from this loan to continue expanding her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to expand a small variety store

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en: Dolores V. is 51 years old, married and lives in the town of Banga, South Cotabato. For years, she has made a living by raising and selling rice.  She supplements her farming income by raising pigs, which she sells to people who live in her community. She works hard to provide her family with a decent standard of living. Dolores is applying for this loan to buy supplies for her farm and additional food for her livestock. She believes this loan will help her improve her business and her ability to support her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies for a farm and livestock feed

loans.name: Kaeut

texts.en:
Kaeut C., 25, is a married woman who is a local farmer in the province of Kompong Thom. She has been in the farming business since 2005, earning an income of approximately $1.60 per day. Her husband is a furniture maker, and his finished products consist of beds and cupboard. His furniture is made mostly from wood and rattan. The couple have been married for a few years, and they have only one child who still lives under their care. 

Recently, Kaeut C.’s husband's business is doing better day to day, so her husband wishes to buy additional wood in order to make beds for sale. This is the reason why Kaeut C. would like to ask for a loan from Kiva.

loans.use: To buy additional wood in order to make beds for sale

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en: Kadiatu S. is 39 years old, married and works hard to make sure that all of her children can attend school. Since 2003, she has made a living by selling beverages, working six days a week and eight hours a day. She has a very good loan repayment history, and is applying for a new one, for Le 5,000,000, to buy more soft drinks to sell to her customers. She extends her sincerest thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more soft drinks to sell to her customers

loans.name: Saidjahfar

texts.ru: Абдурахмонов Саидчахфар проживает в городе Сарбанд. Ему 41 год. Он женат, имеет 4 детей. Образование среднее. Вместе с женой занимается торговлей на центральном рынке города. Арендует торговую точку, де продает мобильные телефоны и панели для мобильных телефонов. Этим видом бизнеса занимается 5 лет. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Saidjahfar A. lives in the town of Sarband. He is 41 years old. He is married, with four children. He has secondary education. He and his wife have a retail business at the central market in their town. He leases a stall where he sells mobile phones and phone panels. He has been in this business for five years. He is taking out a loan in order to increase his sales volume.

loans.use: Increasing sales volume

loans.name: Joel Cheruiyot

texts.en:
Joel Cheruiyot M. is  48 years old, married, and a father of six children. His wife Monica M. runs a poultry business and adds to the family income.  Joel does dairy farming and sells milk in Tuiyo on the outskirts of Eldoret town. He has been in this business for eight years now and gets a monthly income of nine thousand shillings.


This will be Joel's first loan from KADET LTD, and he plans to buy a dairy cow so that he can increase his income by selling the milk that the cow produces. With the income he is going to get, he plans to pay school fees for his children. 


In future he desires to improve and grow in the dairy farming business and also continue running a school which he started a few years ago.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for milk production

loans.name: Kadie

texts.en: This is 57-year-old Kadie T..  She is a widow who entered her current line of work, selling African cloth, when her mother died and passed the family business on to her in 1984. She works six days a week, 10 hours a day, and is applying for this loan for Le 4,500,000, to buy more cloth to sell to her customers. She extends sincerest thanks to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To buy more African cloth to sell to her customers

loans.name: Hour

texts.en:
Mrs. Hour C., age 43, makes a living by selling fish. She sells the fish that her husband gives her or that she buys from other fisherman. She earns an average of US$4.70 a day, and she has been running her business for over ten years. Her husband is 44 years old and is a fisherman who works along a local river.

 Mrs. Hour C. is the mother of six teenage children; all of them are single. Currently, Mrs. Hour C. uses an existing motorcycle as transportation to sell her fish in the busy market. Unluckily, her motorcycle has broken down, and that may influence her fish selling business. Because of this problem, Mrs. Hour C. decided to request a loan to purchase a used motorcycle to replace the broken one.

loans.use: To purchase a used motorcycle to replace her broken one.

loans.name: Willy Jean

texts.en:
Willy Jean C. is 26 years old, married, and has two children.  She lives in Guibongan, Hamtic, Antique. Her husband is a meat vendor.  They live a simple life with the dream of educating their children, having a comfortable house, and putting away some savings for their future needs. While their children are still young, they really work hard just to earn an income for their daily expenses. 

Through their hardships and with the help of ASHI, they have a business stall in the market where they can sell their goods during the market days. There are times that they had a big income but there are times that their income is just enough for their needs. They understand the flow of business where you may earn money one day and suffer a loss another day.

Willy Jean has successfully repaid her previous loans and she is requesting a loan 25,000 PHP, which will be uses as additional capital for her meat vending business.

loans.use: Meat vending

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena, 50 years old, lives in the town of Banga, South Cotabato. She has 10 children; the eldest is 32 years old. Elena's husband has passed away so she is the only one taking care of her younger children. Four of her kids are still in school and she works hard to be able to sustain their education.

Elena tills a rice farm. She spends the whole day making sure the crops are growing healthily and that the farm is free of weeds and pests. Elena also grows ducks. She sells the eggs to her town's market. Elena wishes for her duck-raising business to grow. She applied for a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos from CEVI to acquire more ducks to raise. She will also buy feeds and vitamins.

loans.use: To purchase feeds, vitamins and more ducks to raise

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
This is 35-year-old Hawa. She is married and has five dependents. For the past 15 years, Hawa has been selling local foodstuffs in the city of Freetown. She began her business as a way of generating income to provide a livelihood for her family. She opens her business six days a week for 10 hours a day.

She would like a loan in the amount of 4,500,000 Sierra Leone leones. Hawa requires a loan in order to expand her business as a way of increasing her profit margin. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more local foodstuffs for her business

loans.name: Bati

texts.en:
Bati N. is a married man with 10 children. His wife does not work and stays at home to take care of the household chores while Bati goes to his clinic at Changamwe in Mombasa to provide medical services to his customers at his clinic. 

Mombasa is in the coastal region of Kenya and is well-known for its many tourist-attraction sites, not forgetting the Indian Ocean's white beaches. 

He has been in this business for the last five years and has managed to provide employment to three people. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is financial constraints. Sometimes, he also gets harassment from the local government. However, he works very hard from early morning to late evening to keep his business doing well. 

He is using his loan of 80,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more drugs to be able to give proper medications to his customers. He hopes to have the best clinic with the best public relations in the future. He also sees the business growing to a big hospital that will be providing treatment to more people. He describes himself as a very hardworking man.

loans.use: To buy more drugs to be able to give proper medications to his customers

loans.name: Mam

texts.en: From Kompong Thom province, Mam N. is a 57-year-old married woman. She owns a piece of farmland that she inherited many years ago from her grandparents. She uses this land to grow different kinds of crops. She planted rice and vegetable crops and they are growing well almost every season. She has other financial support from her husband who is a classical Khmer musician at the mobile place. The couple has only one kid who works in the farming business also. Earlier she hired a few domestic laborers to harvest her rice crop. Now is the time for paying back to them. But her saving is not enough to pay them. So Mam N. is seeking a loan to pay the harvesting fee.

loans.use: To pay the harvesting fee.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter K. N. is 33 years old, married, and  has five children to whom they hope to give quality education to the university level. His business is located at a busy area known as Athi River and he is served by the Kitengela branch. He owns a food cafe from where he sells tea, doughnuts, and other snacks. He has been in this business for six years and has provided employment to three people. Peter says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is financial constraints. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of  20,000 KES to buy flour to make more doughnuts since the demand for snacks is high in the busy area. He hopes to expand his business and start supplying to other towns.

loans.use: To purchase flour

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela is married. She owns a small business, selling children’s clothing in a local mall in Vinogradovo, Western Ukraine. The favorable location of Angela’s shop adds to her good sales rates. Angela has been in the business for eight years. Presently, she has about 75,000 Ukraine Hryvnia (UAH) in merchandise. Her monthly income amounts to 7,000 UAH. 

Some of the major characteristics of Angela’s business are stability and consistency. This is partly due to the financial assistance she received in previous years. Angela is very optimistic and cheerful, which has helped her fulfill her business goals in the past. She was able to start a second sales location last year. She hopes to develop her business further and open a third location. 

Angela is requesting a loan of 20,000 UAH to purchase more inventory and increase her sales.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Ed Rose

texts.en: Ed Rose S. is 24 years old. She is from a municipality where we find the famous rafflesia, a very large and rare flower; this is the municipality of Sibalom, Antique, Philippines. She is a very industrious mother and a loving wife of July S., a fish vendor. They have two children; they are James Michael and Julie Rose. Because of poverty they did not finish their studies in college; that’s the reason opportunities for them are very limited and they could not find decent jobs. So when ASHI came into their baranggay (district or neighborhood), they didn’t let that opportunity pass by. Instead, she joined as a member and she starts to dream for their future. Her first loan was used in her business: buying and selling fish. This business is managed by her husband. The income that they earned from this business really helped them to sustain their basic needs, and sometimes, if they got a bigger income, she set aside some money for her savings. As of now, she is applying for 10,000 Philippines pesos for her next loan. This amount will be utilized as additional capital for her fish-vending business. Her greatest dream in life is to have more capital so that they will have also a bigger income that will sustain their needs, especially for the educational expense of their children. She also wishes to have a decent house someday.

loans.use: Fish vending

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua S. M. is 24 years old and he is not married yet. His business is located at the Kinanie market and he is served by the Kitengela branch of SMEP, a Kiva partner. 

He repairs bicycles and motorbikes. He has been in this business for two years. He serves other business people who operate motorbikes and bicycles. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenges he has are financial constraints and the fact that some spare parts are not readily available. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. 

He is using his loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more spare chains, bulbs, spokes and other parts to use to repair the motorbikes and bicycles brought to him. He hopes to grow his business and become a distributor of spare parts in the future. He describes himself as very focused, determined and innovative.

loans.use: Spare parts

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine A., 46, lives with her family in the town of Banga, South Cotabato. She plants and harvests rice for sale. She also grows pigs for fattening. She works hard to sell quality rice and pigs. She believes it is her responsibility to be of good service to her customers.

Geraldine is in need of additional fertilizer and seeds. She has applied for a loan of 8,000 Philippines pesos from Kiva partner CEVI. This loan will surely help Geraldine continue with her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen A., 52 years old, is married to a farmer. She has 10 children: 3 girls and 7 boys. Helen raises hogs and ducks. Helen sells the pigs and duck eggs at the market. She also helps her husband maintain their rice farm. Helen says that, with a big family like hers, providing their household needs is a challenge. But Helen is happy that she and her husband always support each other to sustain their family.

Helen is in need of additional piglets, ducks and feed. She has applied for a loan of 8,000 PHP from CEVI. She is hopeful that this loan will help improve her business.

loans.use: to buy piglets, ducks and feed

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy C. is 22 years old, married and a mother of two beautiful children. Her husband, Daniel Kipruto, practices horticulture and hence produces additional income for the family. Lucy does dairy farming and also poultry rearing in Tuiyo where they live. Lucy has been in this business for six months now and gets a monthly income of KES. 4,000.


This will be Lucy's first loan from KADET LTD. She plans to buy one young cow and poultry for egg production. With the income she is going to get, she wants to buy more cows for milk production so that she can sell the milk. 

In the future, she wants to own a piece of land where she can do her agricultural business.

loans.use: To buy a young cow and poultry

loans.name: Nyevu

texts.en:
Nyevu is a single woman with four children. Two of her children attend school, and two have graduated from school. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are rent bills and school fees.

She has operated a business selling sunflower seeds and nuts for the past six years, selling at a nearby schoool to school children. Nyevu faces a major challenge of seasonality. During high season, when schools are open, the demand for cashews and groundnuts (peanuts) is high. During the holiday season, when schools have closed, the demand goes down. She hopes to expand her business and supply as wholesale in the future.

With the 10,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase sacks of sunflower seeds and groundnuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu because of efficiency of the loan products.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of sunflower seeds and groundnuts

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia is a 40-year-old married lady. She has been blessed with five children. To earn a living, she sells second-hand clothes. She started the business in 1997 after leaving her grocery business. She says that through Faulu Kenya, she has changed her living standards because her business has improved. She hopes to expand her business into wholesale in the future. She has requested a loan of 80,000 KES, which she will use to buy clothes, handbags, shoes, and curtains.

loans.use: To buy second-hand clothes

loans.name: Joeffer

texts.en:
Joeffer A., 32 years old, is married and has one beautiful daughter. Joeffer is a farmer. He plants and harvests rice then sells it at the market. He also raises hogs for fattening and sale. Joeffer works hard to provide a better living for his family.

Joeffer applied for a loan of 8000 PHP from CEVI. He will use it to purchase additional piglets that he will raise. Joeffer is hopeful that this loan will help his business immensely.

loans.use: to purchase piglets to raise

loans.name: Mary Jelagat

texts.en:
Mary Jelagat S. is a single mother of four children. They live in Tuiyo in the outskirts of Eldoret. She buys and sells maize around the same area. She has been in this business for two years now and she gets a monthly income of 5,000 shillings.

This will be Mary's first loan from KADET LTD. She will use the entire loan to buy maize stock and, with the income that she will get, she plans to diversify her business to poultry keeping. 


In the future, she would like to grow her own maize rather than buying and selling and to educate her children to the highest level.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock like maize for resale

loans.name: Hun

texts.en: Hun S. has been spending her life cultivating crops for a long time. She learned this skill from her grandparent when she was young. Growing crops is an annual action with which she has had great success. She is able to plant the crops at least twice a year by following both rainy and dry seasons. Her husband works in the farm fields frequently alongside her. Hun S. is now married and has five kids. Two of the children are employed in various jobs. One of her children has just finished high school and doesn’t have a job yet. In addition, Hun S. says that her kid wishes to work in Korea, but she has no way to pay for the arrangement fee. Because of this, Hun S. has decided to borrow a loan from Kiva. This loan will help her to support her kid in order to work in Korea.

loans.use: To pay for her kid to work in Korea.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Goals are nothing unless one takes the effort to meet them. Ruth S., 43, knows this, and gives her best to accomplish the goals she has set for her and her family. She finished a high school education and is married to Reynaldo S., her business partner who serve as a cook the their food stall. They have four children; with one attending college, two in high school and one in elementary school. Ruth’s family resides in Baseco Port Area, Manila.

Ruth presently runs a sari-sari (variety) store which caters to those customers needs that are more immediate than the nearest grocerystore. Along with this, she also manages her food stall that offers all kinds of viands that her local community is used to eating during meal time. Ruth has been into these kind of businesses for several years and has gained regular customers who keep her businesses alive. She employs no one and mobilize members of her family to help her business run well.  With this, Ruth earns an estimated net income of around Php900 per day.

To help her continue operating businesses, she would like to request a loan for a Php12,000. She will use this to buy goods that her customers prefer. She will see to it that her store will not lack any particular item that her customers need, This will make her the number one sari-sari store in the community.  She will also use part of this loan to purchase more raw ingredients that are needed to continue operation of her food stall.

Ruth has learned the value of improving one’s business. She also has experienced terrible tragedy in her live, five years ago, when their entire community was consumed by fire including her house and business.  Despite all of this, she remained focus on how to sustain her family, used her savings in CCT to start up a small business and eventually grew and rebuilt their house and their growing business. Goals cannot be met just by identifying the problem, but by acting on them. One most important goal she has is to support her children until their college graduation which she will feel greatly fulfilled her dream.

As of now, Ruth enjoys attending the fellowship* meeting in CCT where she also gained strength and inspiration from the Word of God she received. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy additional items for her variety store and more raw ingredients needed for her food stall

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase phone accessories.

loans.name: Junrey

texts.en:
Junrey , 23 years old, lives in the town of Banga, South Cotabato with his family. He is engaged in farming. Planting and harvesting rice crops are some of the activities he does in a day. Junrey also allots time raising pigs in his backyard. Junrey wants to provide a better house for his family. He also wishes to own a car someday. He says that nothing is impossible if you work hard for it.

Junrey is in need of additional fertilizer and pig feed. He has applied for a loan of 10,000 PHP from Kiva partner, CEVI. He is hopeful that this loan will help him achieve his dreams.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and feed

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina A., 45 years old, is married to a farmer. She has 1 daughter and 3 sons. Marina owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector production raising pigs and ducks. She sells the pigs and ducks eggs at the market. She also helps her husband till their rice farm. Marina works hard to provide a better living for her family.

Marina is in needs of piglets, ducks and feed. She has applied for a loan of 8,000 PHP from Kiva partner, CEVI. She is hopeful that this loan will help improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, ducks and feed

loans.name: Di

texts.en: Di M., 32 years old, owns a small shop located in her village where she sells soft drinks, food, candy, and other cooking ingredients. She typically makes around US$ 3 in profit each day to help her family live a proper life. Her husband is a fisherman. She is married with one child who still lives with her. Di M. is running her business smoothly because she has skills in public relations, which she uses with her customers. Currently, she also faces a problem: her house is too old, a few parts are broken, and it is not comfortable for her and her family. To solve an obstacle, Di M. would like to request a loan to be used to buy wood to repair the broken parts of her house.

loans.use: To buy wood to repair the broken parts of her house.

loans.name: Mukaddas

texts.ru: Ибрагимова Мукаддас проживает в городе Курган-Тюбе. Ей 34 года. Она разведена, имеет двоих детей. Дети учатся. Сама Мукаддас не имеет высшего образования. Она более 8 лет занимается торговлей. Арендует торговую точку, где продает хозяйственные товары. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Mukaddas I. lives in the town of Qurgan-Tube. She is 34 years old. She is divorced, with two children. Her children are in school. Mukaddas does not have a college degree. She has been working in retail for over eight years. She rents out a stall to sell household goods at. She is taking out a loan in order to increase her sales volume.

loans.use: Increasing sales volume

loans.name: Teresa Jepchumba

texts.en:
Teresa Jepchumba K. is a single woman of 41 years. She has three children who are still young. They live in Tuiyo in the outskirts of Eldoret. She runs a horticulture business where she plants vegetables for resale after harvest. She has been in this business for one year now and gets a monthly income of 10,000 shillings.

This will be Teresa's first loan from KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to diversify her business and start poultry keeping for eggs production. She will use the money to construct a poultry house and use the balance to buy chicks to raise and sell later. 

With the income she will get, she will use the income to save and buy a piece of land and start maize farming. In the future, she wants to continue with horticulture business and also educate her children.

loans.use: To construct a poultry house for poultry keeping

loans.name: Ngowa

texts.en:
Ngowa is a single man who lives in a rental house that  has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is rent bills.

He has operated a hawking business, selling various commodities ( books, posters, cups, cutlery and necklaces) for the past four years. His potential customers are neighbours and passersby. He moves from door to door hawking his products. Ngowa faces a major challenge with the high cost of transportation in his business. He hopes to establish a shop to sell his products in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase bundles of posters, cups, cutlery, ear rings and necklaces for sale. He decided to join Yehu because of its easy access to loans.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of posters, cups, cutlery, ear rings and necklaces to sell.

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en:
Oksana is married with a grown daughter. She runs a bakery business in her home town of Ivano-Frankivsk. Her baking facility is located on the premises of a local poultry factory. Along with 15 hired employees Oksana bakes different kinds of bread, rolls and pastry for further retail sale. With her daughter Tatyana the purchases all the produce and re-sells it in their 8 vending kiosks located in different parts of the central food market. Oksana has been in the business for 9 years. Presently, she has about 40,000  Grivnyas in turnover capital. Her net profit is about 7,000 Grivnyas a month.   

Oksana used to work at a meat factory. However, one day she decided to follow her friends’ advice and launch her own venture. This is when she invested her savings in baking equipment, rented a facility at the poultry factory and made a dream about owning a baking business come true. This time Oksana is seeking a loan of 12,500 Grivnyas to purchase 4 tons of flour for her baking business. This business is the main source of income for this borrower.

loans.use: to purchase 4 tons of flour

loans.name: Sarah

texts.fr: Sarah U. a 58 ans, et elle est client d’ACB depuis 2009.  Elle est mariée, elle a 5 enfants entre 25 et 30 ans, et tous ses enfants vont à l’école.  Sarah a fini 2 ans d’université elle-même.  Elle va utiliser son prêt pour payer les minervaux pour ses enfants pendant l’année 2011.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est de payer les frais d’études supérieurs pour ses enfants, et achever elle-même tous les niveaux supérieurs exigés.  Elle voudrait étudier jusqu’au niveau de la profession, et avoir une famille qui a terminé ses études.
texts.en: Sara U. is 58 years old. She has been a client of ACB since 2009. She is married and has five children, between 25 and 30 years of age. All her children study. Sarah herself has completed two years of university studies. She is going to use her loan in order to pay tuition for her children during  2011. Her business strategy is to pay the cost of higher education for her children, and to continue studying herself. She would like to earn a professional diploma, and to allow her children to finish their university studies.

loans.use: Paying tuition for her children for 2011

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a motorbike for one of her children to operate a new business

loans.name: Marline

texts.en:
Marline A. is from the town of Banga. She is 23 years old. Marline is married and has a 3-year-old child. To make a living, Marline owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs and ducks. Marline's husband is a farmer and she also helps him maintain their rice farm.

Marline joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marline has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Marline is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to buy piglets, ducks and fertilizer. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy piglets, ducks and fertilizer

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria M. M. is a married lady and a mother of four children. Her business is located at a residential area in Mombasa,  Kenya. Mombasa is the coastal region of Kenya and is well known for its many, many tourist attraction like the white beaches of the Indian ocean. She has been selling  items such as kales, tomatoes, cabbages, mangoes, ripe bananas and other fruits and vegetables for the last three years to the local people. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is there are so many people doing the same kind of business as hers in the area and so customers are spoiled with choice. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. 

She is using her loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more fruits and vegetables to grow her business and meet the demands of her customers. She hopes to be a wholesaler and in future open a supermarket. She describes herself as a very hardworking lady.

loans.use: To buy supplies of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Nila

texts.en:
Nila is married with a son Ivan and a daughter Anastasia. She is a farmer from Tavriyskoye who grows early spring vegetables, i.e. radish, tomatoes, cucumbers, corn, and potatoes in her greenhouses or in the field in warmer weather. Nila has been in this business for 10 years. Currently, she has already invested about 50,000 Grivnyas in this enterprise. Her net profit is about 2,500 Grivnyas a month. 

Nila is requesting a loan of 15,000 Grivnyas to purchase seeds, polyethylene film, wood, and fertilizer to maintain her greenhouses and grow quality vegetables this farming season. Nila enjoys running this business because it appeals to her interests and provides funds to support the family. In addition to her farming endeavors, she also breeds pigs: at the moment she has 17 of them.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, polyethylene film, wood, and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchasing a box of notepads, a bag of sugar, and a bag of rice for resale

loans.name: Bech

texts.en:
Bech S., age 34, is married with three children who are not going to school. She and her husband have a small business selling furniture such as cupboards and beds, and most of their products are made from wood and rattan. This couple uses an ox cart to transport their rattan furniture to sell around their community. They take a few days or a week to sell their products. 

Since selling furniture is a very profitable business, this family would like to depend on it. To make the business more successful and to increase their profit, Bech S. is applying for a loan to be used to purchase additional wood to make beds for sale.

loans.use: To purchase additional wood to make beds for sale

loans.name: Mylinda

texts.en:
Mylinda is a married woman from the town of Banga, South Cotabato. To make a living, she has a business raising rice for sale. She also raises hogs.

Mylinda joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI and is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and pig feed. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pig feed

loans.name: Zoya

texts.en:
Zoya is married with two grown children. She lives in the small town of Gladkovka, south-eastern Ukraine, which doesn’t leave her with too many job options. Seventeen years ago Zoya started her farming business to be able to feed her family and provide for their basic needs. Currently, she grows early spring vegetables, i.e. radish, tomatoes, cucumbers, cabbage, garden radishes, etc. for sale in different regions of Ukraine. Zoya has invested about 70,000 Grivnyas in this business and her net profit amounts to 5,000 Grivnyas a month. 

Zoya is seeking a loan of 15,000 Grivnyas to purchase seeds, polyethylene film, wood and fertilizers to keep her greenhouses in good condition and grow a good harvest. She takes joy in her accomplishments but doesn’t want to stop where she is. She hopes to continue growing her business by constructing new greenhouses thus increasing her sales and income.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, wood, polyethylene film, and fertilizer

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna, 55 years old, lives in the town of Banga, South Cotabato with her family. She has children who go to school. To make a living, Myrna raises rice for sale. She works hard to sustain her children's education.

Myrna joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP to purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies. This will be the first loan taken out by Myrna from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly in recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Alexei

texts.en:
Alexei is married with two grown children. He is a farming entrepreneur from Kamenka which is a predominantly rural and agricultural region of Ukraine. Alexei owns three big greenhouses and plants 3,700 tall-growing tomato plants every year. He started the enterprise 22 years ago. Presently, Alexei has already invested 100,000 Grivnyas in this business and his annual expenses on seeds and polyethylene film amount to 35,000 Grivnyas. 

Alexei is requesting a loan of 10,000 Grivnyas to construct an additional greenhouse. A new addition will give him a chance to plant and grow more vegetables, thus increasing his harvests and income. One of Alexei’s short-term plans is to reconstruct his greenhouse for seedlings to grow better quality seedlings. He is very energetic and enthusiastic about his business. He is willing to work hard and see his venture expand and develop even further in the future.

loans.use: to construct an additional greenhouse

loans.name: Sairambi

texts.ru: Тоирова Саирамби проживает в городе Курган-Тюбе. Ей 52 года. Замужем, имеет двоих детей. Муж занимается бизнесом. Сама Саирамби имеет высшее образование, педагог. По профессии проработала более 20 лет. Сейчас она занимается торговлей на рынке. Она в основном продает литературные книжки и тетради. Этим видом деятельности занимается 7 лет. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Sairambi T. lives in the town of Qurgan-Tube. She is 52 years old. Married, with two children. Her husband is an entrepreneur. Sairambi has a college degree; she is an educator. She has worked in her profession for over 20 years. At present she is a retailer, mostly selling fiction books and exercise books at the marketplace. She has been in this line of business for over seven years. She is taking out a loan in order to increase her sales volume.

loans.use: Increasing sales volume

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To start a retail shop and purchase wheat flour, maize flour, and rice.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda I. is from the town of Banga. She is 56 years old. To make a living, Nilda owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Nilda is working hard because she is planning to build a new house for her family. 

Nilda joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nilda has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. She is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP  to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.use: Tp purchase seeds, fertilizers and farming supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy mobile phone accessories
